30.Mustaqim: And some women in the town said: the wife of the governor desired her male servant, he has infatuated her with love, we consider her clearly astray.

31.Mustaqim: Then when she heard of their plot she sent for them and prepared for them couches and gave each of them a knife and said: come out to them. Then when they saw him they praised him and cut their hands and said: Allah save us, this is not a man but this is a noble angel!

32.Mustaqim: She said: so that is what you blamed me about and I did desire him but he resisted, and if he does not do what I command him, he will be imprisoned and will be of those humiliated.

33.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, prison is dearer to me to what they call me to, and if You do not divert their plot from me, I will give in to them and be of the ignorant.

34.Mustaqim: So his Lord responded to him and diverted their plot from him, for He hears and knows.

35.Mustaqim: Then it seemed right to them after seeing the signs that they should imprison him for some time.

36.Mustaqim: And two male servants entered the prison with him. One of them said: I saw myself press wine, and the other said: I saw myself carry bread on my head of which the birds ate. Tell us its interpretation for we consider you amongst those who do good.

37.Mustaqim: He said: I will tell you its interpretation before your provision of food will come to you. This is of what my Lord has taught me, for I left the religion of people who do not believe in Allah and who reject the hereafter.

38.Mustaqim: And I followed the religion of my fathers Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya´qub (Jacob). We would not associate anything with Allah. That is of the favours of Allah upon us and upon mankind, but most people give no thanks.

39.Mustaqim: Oh my companions in prison, are different masters better or Allah, the one and dominant?

40.Mustaqim: You only serve besides Allah names which you have invented, you and your fathers. Allah has not sent any authority for it. The judgement is Allah´s alone, He has commanded that you serve only Him, that is the upright religion but most people do not know.

41.Mustaqim: Oh my companions in prison, as for one of you, he will pour wine for his master, and for the other, he will be crucified and the birds will eat from his head. Decided is the matter about which you asked.

42.Mustaqim: And he said to the one of them who thought he would be saved: mention me to your master, but the devil made him forget to make mention to his master, so he stayed in prison a number of years.

43.Mustaqim: And the king said: I saw seven fat cows being eaten by seven skinny cows and seven green ears of grain and another dried batch. Oh leaders, explain me my visions if you understand visions.

44.Mustaqim: They said: confused dreams, and we do not know the interpretation of dreams.

45.Mustaqim: And the one of the two who was saved and remembered after some time said: I will inform you of the interpretation of it, so send me.

46.Mustaqim: Yusuf (Joseph), oh you truthful one, explain to us seven fat cows being eaten by seven skinny ones and seven green ears of grain and another dried batch, so that I can return to the people so that they will know.

47.Mustaqim: He said: sow for seven years and what you harvest, leave it on its ear but for a little which you eat.

48.Mustaqim: Then seven severe years will come after that which will consume what you have stored up for them but for a little which you keep safe.

49.Mustaqim: Then a year will come after that during which people receive rain and press (grapes and oil).

50.Mustaqim: And the king said: bring him to me, and when the messenger came to him he said: go back to your master and ask him about the women who cut their hands, for my master knows their plots.

51.Mustaqim: He said: what do you women have to say about when you desired Yusuf (Joseph)? They said: Allah save us, we do not know any bad about him. The wife of the governor said: now the truth has come out, I desired him and he is telling the truth.

52.Mustaqim: This so that he would know that I did not deceive him secretly and that Allah does not guide the plot of the treacherous.

53.Mustaqim: And I do not call myself blameless, for the soul commands evil except when my Lord has mercy, for my Lord is forgiving and merciful.

54.Mustaqim: And the king said: bring him to me, I will keep him for myself, and when he spoke to him he said: you are influential and safe with us today.

55.Mustaqim: He said: place me over the storehouses of the earth, for I am a knowledgeable keeper.

56.Mustaqim: And this is how We established Yusuf (Joseph) on earth to settle wherever he liked. We grant Our mercy to whom We will and do not waste the reward of those who do good.

57.Mustaqim: And the reward of the hereafter is even better for those who believe and beware (of Allah).

58.Mustaqim: And the brothers of Yusuf (Joseph) came and entered upon him, and he recognised them whilst they did not recognise him.

59.Mustaqim: And when he issued them with their supplies he said: bring me your brother from your father, do you not see that I give full measure and am one of the best hosts?

60.Mustaqim: But if you do not bring him, then you will have no measure with me and you shall not come close.

61.Mustaqim: They said: we will implore our father, we will certainly do that.

62.Mustaqim: And he said to his male servants: place their merchandise in their luggage so that they find it when the return to their family so that they come back.

63.Mustaqim: Then when they got back to their father they said: oh our father, measure has been denied to us, so send our brother with us, we will obtain measure and we will look after him.

64.Mustaqim: He said: shall I entrust him to you like I entrusted his brother to you before? But Allah is the best keeper and the most merciful of all.

65.Mustaqim: And when they opened their provisions they found their merchandise had been returned to them. They said: oh our father, what more do we want? This our merchandise has been returned to us, and we will provide for our family and add the measure of a camel, that will be an easy measure.

66.Mustaqim: He said: I will not send him with you until you give me a promise by Allah that you will bring him back unless you are surrounded. Then when they gave him their promise he said: Allah is a guardian over what we say.

67.Mustaqim: And he said: oh my children, do not enter from a single gate but enter from different gates, and I will not benefit you in any way against Allah, for the judgement is only for Allah, on Him I have relied, and on Him let all those rely who want to rely on something.

68.Mustaqim: And when they entered from where their father had commanded them, it did not benefit them in any way against Allah but was a need within Ya´qub (Jacob) which he discharged, and he had much knowledge of what We taught him, but most people don´t know.

69.Mustaqim: And when they entered upon Yusuf (Joseph), he took his brother in his care and said: I am your brother, so don´t be sad about what they used to do.

70.Mustaqim: Then when he issued their supplies he placed the drinking cup in his brother´s luggage, then a caller announced: oh you travellers, you are thieves.

71.Mustaqim: They said, whilst they approached them: what are you missing?

72.Mustaqim: They said: we are missing the king´s measuring cup, and whoever brings it will have a camel´s load, and I am going to claim it.

73.Mustaqim: They said: by Allah, you know that we did not come to cause corruption on earth and that we are not thieves.

74.Mustaqim: They said: and what is the punishment if you are lying?

75.Mustaqim: They said: the punishment is that whoever it is found in his luggage, he will be the punishment, this is how we punish the wrongdoers.

76.Mustaqim: Then he started with their bags before the bag of his brother, then he took it out of the bag of his brother. This is how We plotted for Yusuf (Joseph): he could not have taken his brother under the king´s rule unless Allah willed. We raise in stages whom We will, and above everybody with knowledge is He who knows.

77.Mustaqim: They said: if he stole, then his brother stole before, but Yusuf (Joseph) kept it inside and did not disclose it to them. He said: you are in a bad situation, and Allah knows best what you make out.

78.Mustaqim: They said: oh governor, he has a very old father, so take one of us in his place, we consider you of those who do good.

79.Mustaqim: He said: Allah forbid that we take except him whom we found our belongings with, otherwise we would be wrongdoers.

80.Mustaqim: And when they gave up on him, they drew apart to consult. Their eldest said: don´t you know that your father has already taken your promise by Allah and how you abandoned Yusuf (Joseph)? So I will not leave this land until my father gives me permission or Allah judges for me and He is the best of judges.

81.Mustaqim: Go back to your father and say: oh our father, your son has stolen, and we only witness that which we know and we are not keepers of the unseen.

82.Mustaqim: So ask the town we were in and the caravan that we came with, and we are telling the truth.

83.Mustaqim: He said: but you have made something up yourselves, so (I will have) beautiful patience. Maybe Allah will bring them all to me, for He is knowing and wise.

84.Mustaqim: And he turned away from them and said: oh my grief over Yusuf (Joseph), and his eyes turned white from suppressed worry.

85.Mustaqim: They said: by Allah, you will not stop remembering Yusuf (Joseph) until you ruin your health or will be destroyed.

86.Mustaqim: He said: I only disclose my anguish and worry to Allah and I know from Allah what you do not know.

87.Mustaqim: Oh my sons, go and look for Yusuf (Joseph) and his brother and do not despair of relief from Allah, for only people who reject (the truth) despair of relief from Allah.

88.Mustaqim: And when they entered upon him they said: oh governor, hardship has afflicted us and our family and we have come with meagre merchandise, but give us full measure and give us charity, for Allah rewards those who give charity.

89.Mustaqim: He said: Do you know what you did with Yusuf (Joseph) and his brother when you were ignorant?

90.Mustaqim: They said: are  you actually Yusuf (Joseph)? He said: I am Yusuf (Joseph) and this is my brother. Allah has bestowed His favours on us, for if someone bewares (of Allah) and is patient, then Allah does not waste the reward of those who do good.

91.Mustaqim: They said: by Allah, Allah has preferred  you over us and we were guilty.

92.Mustaqim: He said: you will not be blamed today, may Allah forgive you, and He is the most merciful of all.

93.Mustaqim: Go with this shirt of mine and throw it onto my father´s face, he will become sighted (again), and come to me with all your family.

94.Mustaqim: And when the caravan broke up (on arrival) their father said: I notice the scent of Yusuf (Joseph) even if you contradict me.

95.Mustaqim: They said: by Allah, you are in your old aberration.

96.Mustaqim: Then when the bringer of good news came, he threw it over his face and he became sighted again. He said: did I not say to you that I know from Allah what you do not know?

97.Mustaqim: They said: oh our father, ask forgiveness for our sins, for we were guilty.

98.Mustaqim: He said: I will ask my Lord for forgiveness, for He is the forgiving and merciful.

99.Mustaqim: And when they entered upon Yusuf (Joseph) he took care of his parents and said: enter Egypt safely if Allah wills.

100.Mustaqim: And he raised his parents on to the throne and they fell prostrate before him, and he said: oh my father, this is the outcome of my earlier dream, Allah has made it come true and He was good to me when He brought me out of prison and brought you from the desert after the devil came between me and my brothers, for my Lord is kind to whom He pleases, for He is the knowing and wise.

101.Mustaqim: My Lord, you have given me a kingdom and taught me the interpretation of meanings, originator of the heavens and the earth, You are my protector in this world and the hereafter, take me away whilst having submitted (as Muslim) and join me with the righteous.

102.Mustaqim: This is of the information of the unseen which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they agreed on their affairs and schemed.

103.Mustaqim: And most people do not believe even if you are eager.

104.Mustaqim: And you do not ask them for a reward for it, for it is only a reminder for all the worlds.

105.Mustaqim: And how many signs in the heavens and on earth do they pass by and turn away from them?

106.Mustaqim: And most of them do not believe in Allah without being idolaters.

107.Mustaqim: Are they then safe that a disaster from the punishment of Allah reaches them or the hour reaches them suddenly without them realising it?

108.Mustaqim: Say: this is my way, I call to Allah based on my understanding - I and those who follow me, and glorified is Allah, and I am not of the idolaters.

109.Mustaqim: And before you We did not send anything else but men from the people of the towns to whom We revealed. Do they not travel on the earth so they see what the outcome was like for those before them? And the abode of the hereafter is better for those who beware (of Allah), do you not understand?

110.Mustaqim: Until when the messengers gave up and thought they had already been denied, Our help reached them, so We rescue whom We will, and Our distress is not averted from the sinful people.

111.Mustaqim: In their story is a lesson for those with understanding. It is not an invented tale but a confirmation of what came before it and an explanation of everything and a guidance and mercy for people who believe.

1.Mustaqim: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the book, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth but most people do not believe.

2.Mustaqim: Allah is who raised the heavens without visible support, then He rose to the throne and subjugated the sun and the moon, each floats for a fixed term, He manages all affairs, He explains the signs so that you would be certain about meeting your Lord.

3.Mustaqim: And He is who expanded the earth and placed on it stabilisers and rivers and placed pairs of every fruit on it; He makes the night cover the day, indeed in this are signs for people who reflect.

4.Mustaqim: And on earth there are continuous sections and gardens of grapes and grain and palms, with and without clusters, which are fed from the same water, and We made some taste better than others. In that are signs for people who understand.

5.Mustaqim: And if you are astonished, then astonishing is their saying: when we are dust, shall we be in a new creation? Those are the ones who reject their Lord and those are the ones with cuffs around their necks and those are the inmates of the fire where they will remain.

6.Mustaqim: And they ask you to hasten the bad before the good, and examples have gone before them, and your Lord is full of forgiveness to people in spite of their wrongdoing, and your Lord is severe in punishment.

7.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: why has not a sign been sent to him from his Lord? But you are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.

8.Mustaqim: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs retain less or longer, and everything is measured with Him.

9.Mustaqim: The One who knows of the unseen and the apparent, the great and elevated.

10.Mustaqim: It makes no difference whether any of you keeps his speech secret or proclaims it and whether he hides at night or is visible in the day.

11.Mustaqim: He is accompanied ahead of him and behind him by those who guard him by the command of Allah, for Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change their own condition, and if Allah wants harm for people, then it cannot be averted, and they have no protection besides Him.

12.Mustaqim: He is who shows you the lightning in fear and hope and makes the heavy clouds grow.

13.Mustaqim: And the thunder glorifies His praise and the angels out of fear of Him, and He strikes down with it whom He pleases, yet they argue about Allah and He is severe in response.

14.Mustaqim: He has the right to be called, and those whom they call besides Him do not answer them any more than someone who stretches out his hands to the water will thereby make it reach his mouth, and the calling of those who reject (the truth) is only in error.

15.Mustaqim: And to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and on earth obediently and reluctantly as well as their shadow in the mornings and afternoons.

16.Mustaqim: Say: who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth? Say: Allah. Say: So do you take protectors besides Him who have no power to benefit or harm themselves? Say: Are the blind and the sighted alike or are the darkness and the light alike? Or do they assign to Allah associates who created like His creation so that the creation looks similar to them? Say: Allah is the creator of everything and He is the one and dominant.

17.Mustaqim: He sends water down from the sky and its force makes it flow through channels, then the torrent carries a foam on top, and of what they melt in the fire to fashion into jewellery or utensils there is a similar foam, this is how Allah points out truth and falsehood. So as for the foam, it is carried away as useless, and as for what benefits people, it remains on the ground; this is how Allah coins examples.

18.Mustaqim: For those who respond to their Lord is good, and those who do not respond to Him, even if they had all that is on earth and the like again, they would give it up. For those is a bad reckoning and their abode is hell, a bad place to be.

19.Mustaqim: Is then the one who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like the one who is blind? Only those with understanding remember.

20.Mustaqim: Those who uphold their agreement with Allah and do not break their promise.

21.Mustaqim: And those who keep together what Allah commanded to keep together and fear their Lord and are afraid of a bad reckoning.

22.Mustaqim: And those who are patient seeking the presence of Allah and keep up prayer and spend of what We have provided them with secretly and openly and repel a bad deed with a good one, for those is the final abode.

23.Mustaqim: The gardens of Eden which they and whoever of their parents and partners and children who were righteous will enter, and the angels will enter upon them from every gate.

24.Mustaqim: Peace be with you on account of your patience, so blessed is the final abode.

25.Mustaqim: And those who break their agreement with Allah after it has been entered into and who cut off what Allah commanded to be kept together and who cause corruption on earth - those will be cursed and theirs is a bad abode.

26.Mustaqim: Allah expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, and they rejoice in the life of this world, yet the life of this world is only a short provision compared to the hereafter.

27.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: why has not a sign been sent down to him from his Lord? Say: Allah lets go astray whom He pleases and guides to Him who turns (to Him).

28.Mustaqim: Those who believe and their hearts find reassurance in the remembrance of Allah, for in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find reassurance.

29.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, for them are delights and a good return.

30.Mustaqim: This is how We sent you to a community which was preceded by other communities to recite to them that which We revealed to you, yet they reject the Merciful. Say: He is my Lord, there is no god but Him, on Him I rely and to Him I repent.

31.Mustaqim: And even if it were a Qur´an by which the mountains were moved or the earth was cut up or the dead would speak - but all affairs belong to Allah. Do not the believers know that if Allah willed He could have guided all of mankind? But those who reject (the truth) will continue to be afflicted by misfortune on account of what they have produced or it will get close to them until Allah´s promise comes, for Allah does not break His promise.

32.Mustaqim: And messengers before you were made fun of, so I gave those who reject (the truth) some time, then I overtook them, and how was My punishment!

33.Mustaqim: So who maintains every soul in line with what it has earned? And they assign to Allah associates. Say: name them! Or will you inform Him of what He does not know on earth, or is it just talk? But their scheming and diversion from the way of Allah appeals to those who reject (the truth), and when Allah lets somebody go astray, there is no guide for him.

34.Mustaqim: Theirs is a punishment in this world, and the punishment of the hereafter is even heavier and they have no defence against Allah.

35.Mustaqim: The likeness of the garden (of paradise) promised to those who beware (of Allah): rivers flow through it, its food and shade are permanent. This is the outcome for those who beware, and the outcome for those who reject (the truth) is the fire.

36.Mustaqim: And those whom We have given the book rejoice in what Allah has revealed to you. And of the allies are those who dislike some of it. Say: I have been commanded to serve Allah and not to associate anyone with Him. I call on Him and repent to Him.

37.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed to you wisdom in Arabic, and if you were to follow their desires after the knowledge you have received, you would have neither protector nor defence against Allah.

38.Mustaqim: And We sent messengers before you and gave them wives and children, and no messenger was able to bring a sign except by permission of Allah. Everything is ordained in time.

39.Mustaqim: Allah obliterates or confirms what He wills, and with Us is the original book.

40.Mustaqim: And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or take you away, your duty is the delivery (of the message) and Ours the reckoning.

41.Mustaqim: Do they not consider how We reduce the earth from its ends? And Allah judges, there is no appeal against His judgement, and He is swift in counting.

42.Mustaqim: And those before them already schemed, and with Allah is all their scheming, He knows what every soul earns, and those who reject (the truth) will know for whom the final outcome is.

43.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: you are no messenger. Say: Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you as well as those who have knowledge of the book.

1.Mustaqim: Alif Lam Ra. A book which We have revealed to you to bring people out of darkness to the light by permission of their Lord - onto the path of the mighty and praiseworthy;

2.Mustaqim: Allah, to whom belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and woe to those who reject (the truth) due to a severe punishment.

3.Mustaqim: Those who prefer the life of this world over the hereafter and divert from the way of Allah and desire it to be crooked, those are in extensive error.

4.Mustaqim: And We always sent each messenger with the language of his people to make things clear to them, then Allah lets go astray whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases, and He is the mighty and wise.

5.Mustaqim: And We previously sent Musa (Moses) with Our signs: take your people out from darkness to the light and remind them of the days of Allah, for in that are signs for everyone who is patient and grateful.

6.Mustaqim: And when Musa (Moses) said to his people: remember the blessing of Allah upon you when He rescued you from the family of Pharaoh who afflicted you with bad punishment and slaughtered your sons and spared your women, which was a tremendous test from your Lord for you.

7.Mustaqim: And when your Lord announced: if you are grateful, I give you increase, and if you reject, then My punishment is severe.

8.Mustaqim: Musa (Moses) said: if you and all those who are on earth reject (the truth), then Allah is independent and praiseworthy.

9.Mustaqim: Did not the account of those before reach you, the people of Nuh (Noah), ´Ad and Thamud and those after them? Only Allah knows them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs but they bit on their hands and said: we reject what you have been sent with and we are in severe doubt about what you call us to.

10.Mustaqim: Their messengers said: are you in doubt about Allah, the originator of the heavens and the earth who calls you to forgive you your sins and give you respite until a fixed date? They said: you are only humans like us. You want to divert us from what our fathers served, so bring us a clear authority.

11.Mustaqim: Their messengers said to them: we are only humans like you but Allah blesses whom He pleases of His servants, and we cannot bring you an authority except with the permission of Allah, and on Allah let the believers rely.

12.Mustaqim: And how could we not rely on Allah when He has already guided us our ways? And we will endure what you harm us with, and on Allah let all those rely who want to rely on something.

13.Mustaqim: And those who rejected (the truth) said to their messengers: we will drive you out of our land unless you return to our religion. Then their Lord revealed to them: We will destroy the wrongdoers.

14.Mustaqim: And We will let you live in the land after them. That is for him who fears My presence and fears My promise.

15.Mustaqim: And they asked for a decision, and every obstinate tyrant was brought down.

16.Mustaqim: After that there is hell and he is given repulsive water to drink.

17.Mustaqim: He gulps it down and it is hard to swallow, and death reaches him from everywhere but he does not die, and after that there is an unrelenting punishment.

18.Mustaqim: The likeness of those who reject their Lord: their works are like ash stirred up by the wind on a stormy day, they have no control over anything they obtained, that is the extensive error.

19.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills He will remove you and bring a new creation.

20.Mustaqim: And that is not difficult for Allah.

21.Mustaqim: And they are all presented to Allah, then the weak will say to those who were arrogant: we followed you, so will you avert any of Allah´s punishment from us? They will say: if Allah had guided us we would have guided you. It is the same for us whether we are anxious or patient, there is no escape for us.

22.Mustaqim: And the devil will say when the matter is decided: Allah promised you a true promise and I promised you but betrayed you, and I had no authority over you except to call you and you responded to me, so do not blame me but blame yourselves, I cannot assist you and you cannot assist me, I already rejected that which you associated me with, for the wrongdoers there is a painful punishment.

23.Mustaqim: And those who believed and did good work will be entered into gardens through which rivers flow where they will remain by the permission of their Lord. There greeting in it is peace.

24.Mustaqim: Have you not considered how Allah coins the example of a good word like a good tree with its roots firm and its branches into the sky?

25.Mustaqim: It produces its fruit every season with the permission of its Lord, and Allah coins the examples for people so that they reflect.

26.Mustaqim: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree with its roots exposed above the earth that has not got established.

27.Mustaqim: Allah strengthens the believers with firm speech in this world and the hereafter, and Allah lets the wrongdoers go astray, and Allah does as He pleases.

28.Mustaqim: Have you not considered those who replaced the blessing of Allah with rejection and lead their people to the abode of ruin?

29.Mustaqim: Hell, which they will enter, a bad place to stay.

30.Mustaqim: And they set up partners for Allah to lead astray from His way. Say: enjoy for a while, for  your journey is to the fire.

31.Mustaqim: Tell My servants who believe to keep up prayer and spend of what We have provided them with secretly and openly before a day reaches them on which there is neither trade nor friendship.

32.Mustaqim: Allah is who created the heavens and the earth and sent down water from the sky with which He makes fruit grow as provision for you, and He made the ship of service to you to sail on the sea by His command, and He made the rivers of service to you.

33.Mustaqim: And He made the sun and the moon of service to you, both in constant motion, and has made the night and the day of service to you.

34.Mustaqim: And He gave you of whatever you asked Him for, and if you were to count the blessings of Allah you could not enumerate them - man is unjust and ungrateful.

35.Mustaqim: And when Ibrahim (Abraham) said: my Lord, make this land safe and prevent me and my children from serving idols.

36.Mustaqim: My Lord, they have lead many people astray. So if someone follows me he belongs to me, and if he disobeys me, then You are forgiving and merciful.

37.Mustaqim: Our Lord, I have settled some of my children in a valley without vegetation near Your sacred house, our Lord, so that they keep up prayer. So make the hearts of people incline to them and provide them with fruit so that they may be grateful.

38.Mustaqim: Our Lord, You know what we conceal and what we disclose, and nothing on earth nor in the sky is concealed from Allah.

39.Mustaqim: Allah is praised who granted me in old age Isma´il (Ishmael) and Ishaq (Isaac), for my Lord hears the call.

40.Mustaqim: My Lord, make me keep up prayer and my children, our Lord, and accept my call.

41.Mustaqim: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers on the day the reckoning takes place.

42.Mustaqim: And don´t count on Allah being unaware of what the wrongdoers do, We only give them time until a day when the eyes will be fixed in a stare.

43.Mustaqim: Stretching their necks and raising their heads, but they see nothing, and their hearts are feeble.

44.Mustaqim: And warn people of a day when the punishment will reach them and those who did wrong will say: our Lord, give us a little bit more time, we will respond to Your call and follow the messengers. Did you not swear previously that there would be no end for you?

45.Mustaqim: And you lived in the homes of those who wronged themselves and it was clear to you how We dealt with them and We coined examples for you.

46.Mustaqim: They previously came up with their scheme and their scheme is with Allah, even if their scheme would make the mountains disappear.

47.Mustaqim: So do not count on Allah breaking His promise to His messengers, for Allah is mighty and vengeful.

48.Mustaqim: On the day the earth will be replaced with another earth, and the heavens, and they are presented to Allah the one and dominant.

49.Mustaqim: And you see the sinful on that day tied in cuffs.

50.Mustaqim: Their clothes are made of tar and the fire covers their faces.

51.Mustaqim: So that Allah rewards every soul in line with what it has earned, for Allah is swift in counting.

52.Mustaqim: This is a declaration for mankind to be warned with and so that they know that He is one single god, and so that those with understanding remember.

1.Mustaqim: Alif Lam Ra. These are the signs of the book and a clear reading (Qur´an).

2.Mustaqim: It may happen that those who reject (the truth) wish they were Muslims (who submit).

3.Mustaqim: Leave them to eat and enjoy and entertain hope, for soon they will know.

4.Mustaqim: Whenever We destroyed a town, there was a known decree for it.

5.Mustaqim: No community precedes its fixed term nor do they delay it.

6.Mustaqim: And they say: oh you whom the reminder has been revealed to, you are possessed.

7.Mustaqim: Why don´t you bring us the angels if you are truthful?

8.Mustaqim: We only send the angels with the truth, and then they will not be spared.

9.Mustaqim: For We have revealed the reminder and We guard it.

10.Mustaqim: And before you We sent to the earliest communities.

11.Mustaqim: And whenever a messenger came to them, they made fun of him.

12.Mustaqim: This is how We let it pass through the hearts of the sinful.

13.Mustaqim: They do not believe in it, and the example of the earliest communities has already gone before.

14.Mustaqim: And even if We opened a door of heaven for them so they could climb up through it,

15.Mustaqim: They would say: our eyesight has been fooled, no we have been bewitched as people.

16.Mustaqim: And We place constellations in the sky and made it appealing to look at.

17.Mustaqim: And We guarded them against every cursed devil.

18.Mustaqim: But if one tries to listen secretly, then a visible shooting star pursues him.

19.Mustaqim: And We expanded the earth and placed on it stabilisers and made grow on it of everything in proportion.

20.Mustaqim: And We placed on it a livelihood for you and those for whom you don´t provide.

21.Mustaqim: And whatever there is, its reserves are with Us, and We only send it down with a known measure.

22.Mustaqim: And We sent the pollinating wind, then sent down from the sky water to give you to drink from it and it is not you who keep its reserves.

23.Mustaqim: And indeed We give life and give death and We are the inheritors.

24.Mustaqim: We already know those of you who go ahead and those who stay behind.

25.Mustaqim: And your Lord is who will gather them, for He is wise and knows.

26.Mustaqim: And We created man from a cement of altered mud.

27.Mustaqim: And the Jinn We created before from dry hot fire.

28.Mustaqim: And when your Lord said to the angels: I am creating a human from a cement of altered mud.

29.Mustaqim: Then when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall prostate before him.

30.Mustaqim: Then all the angels prostrated.

31.Mustaqim: Except Iblis (the devil), he refused to be with those who prostrated.

32.Mustaqim: He said: oh Iblis, what is the matter with you that you were not with those who prostrated.

33.Mustaqim: He said: I am not going to prostrate to a human whom You created from a cement of altered mud.

34.Mustaqim: He said: then get out of here, for you are cursed.

35.Mustaqim: And the curse will be upon you until the day of repayment.

36.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, then give me time till the day when they are resurrected.

37.Mustaqim: He said: then you are given time.

38.Mustaqim: Till the day of the time known.

39.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, because You allowed me to stray I shall make it appealing for them on earth and lead them all astray.

40.Mustaqim: Except Your sincere servants amongst them.

41.Mustaqim: He said: this is a straight path for Me.

42.Mustaqim: You have no authority over My servants except those who follow you of the misguided.

43.Mustaqim: And hell is the abode for all of them.

44.Mustaqim: It has seven gates, for each gate a portion of them will be assigned.

45.Mustaqim: Those who beware (of Allah) will be in gardens and springs.

46.Mustaqim: Enter safely with peace.

47.Mustaqim: And We remove what is within them of ill feeling, they accept each other happily as brothers.

48.Mustaqim: No hardship afflicts them there and they will not be expelled from there.

49.Mustaqim: Inform My servants that I am the forgiving and merciful.

50.Mustaqim: And that My punishment is a painful punishment.

51.Mustaqim: And inform them of the guests of Ibrahim (Abraham).

52.Mustaqim: When they entered upon him and said: peace. He said: we are afraid of you.

53.Mustaqim: They said: don´t be afraid, for we give you good news of a knowledgeable boy.

54.Mustaqim: He said: do you give me good news after old age has afflicted me? On what account do you give me good news?

55.Mustaqim: They said: we give you good news based on the truth, so do not be of those who despair.

56.Mustaqim: He said: and who would despair of the mercy of his Lord except those in error?

57.Mustaqim: He said: So what have you come for, oh messengers?

58.Mustaqim: They said: we were sent to the sinful people.

59.Mustaqim: Except the family of Lut (Lot), we will rescue all of them.

60.Mustaqim: Except his wife, we have decided that she is of those who stay behind.

61.Mustaqim: Then when the messengers came to the family of Lut (Lot),

62.Mustaqim: He said: you are unfamiliar people.

63.Mustaqim: They said: but we have come to you with what they were in doubt of.

64.Mustaqim: And we have reached you with the truth and we tell the truth.

65.Mustaqim: So travel with your family part of the night and follow behind them and let not any of them look back and go to where you have been commanded.

66.Mustaqim: And We decided for him in this matter that the remainder of these will be cut off in the morning.

67.Mustaqim: And the people of the town came rejoicing.

68.Mustaqim: He said: these are my guests, so do not dishonour me.

69.Mustaqim: And beware of Allah and do not disgrace me.

70.Mustaqim: They said: did we not forbid you contact with everybody else?

71.Mustaqim: He said: these are my daughters if you have to do it.

72.Mustaqim: By your life, they were blind in their intoxication.

73.Mustaqim: Then the roar overtook them at sunrise.

74.Mustaqim: Then We turned them upside down and rained upon them hardened stones.

75.Mustaqim: In this are indeed signs for those who observe.

76.Mustaqim: And they are on an established route.

77.Mustaqim: In this is indeed a sign for the believers.

78.Mustaqim: And the inhabitants of the woodlands were wrongdoers.

79.Mustaqim: So we took revenge on them and they are clearly visible ahead.

80.Mustaqim: And the inhabitants of the stone dwellings denied the messengers.

81.Mustaqim: And they brought them Our signs, but they turned away from them.

82.Mustaqim: And they carved out safe homes from the mountains.

83.Mustaqim: Then the roar overtook them in the morning.

84.Mustaqim: And what they had gathered did not benefit them.

85.Mustaqim: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except with truth, and the hour will come, so leave them nicely alone.

86.Mustaqim: For your Lord is the knowledgeable creator.

87.Mustaqim: And We gave you seven of the repeated (verses) and the great Qur´an.

88.Mustaqim: Do not extend your eyes to the enjoyment We have given some couples of them and do not worry about them and give comfort to the believers.

89.Mustaqim: And say: I am the clear warner.

90.Mustaqim: Like We sent to those who like to cause division.

91.Mustaqim: Those who are selective about the Qur´an.

92.Mustaqim: By your Lord, We will ask them all.

93.Mustaqim: About what they used to do.

94.Mustaqim: So declare what you have been commanded with and turn away from the idolaters.

95.Mustaqim: We suffice you against those who mock you.

96.Mustaqim: Those who claim there is another god with Allah, they will soon know.

97.Mustaqim: And We know that what they say makes you uptight.

98.Mustaqim: So glorify the praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate.

99.Mustaqim: And serve your Lord until the inevitable reaches you.

1.Mustaqim: Allah´s command has come, so do not be in a hurry for it, glorified and exalted is He above what they assign as partners.

2.Mustaqim: He sends the angels with the revelation by His command to anyone He pleases of His servants: issue a warning that there is no god but I, so beware of Me.

3.Mustaqim: He created the heavens and the earth in truth, exalted is He above what they assign as partners.

4.Mustaqim: He created man from a sperm, then he argues openly.

5.Mustaqim: And the cattle He created which provide warmth and benefits for you and you eat of them.

6.Mustaqim: And there is beauty in them for you when you bring them in and take them out to graze.

7.Mustaqim: And they carry your burden to a land you could not have reached without personal exertion, for your Lord is lenient and merciful.

8.Mustaqim: And the horses, the mules and the donkeys for you to ride and as an adornment, and He creates what you do not know.

9.Mustaqim: And Allah directs the way, and some deviate from it, and had He willed, He would have guided all of you.

10.Mustaqim: He is who sent water from the sky which produces drinking water and trees amongst which you let them graze.

11.Mustaqim: With it He makes grain grow for you and olives, palms and grapes and every kind of fruit; in that is a sign for people who reflect.

12.Mustaqim: He made the night and day of service to you, and the sun, moon and stars are put into service by His command; in that are signs for people who understand.

13.Mustaqim: And what He has spread for you on earth in different colours; in that is a sign for people who remember.

14.Mustaqim: And He is who made the sea of service so that you eat fresh meat from it and extract from it jewellery which you wear. And you see the ship cut through it, so that you seek of His bounty and so that you would be grateful.

15.Mustaqim: And He placed stabilisers on earth so it does not shake you up, and rivers and pathways for you to be guided.

16.Mustaqim: And as signposts, and by the stars they are guided.

17.Mustaqim: Is then He who creates like he who does not create? Do you not reflect?

18.Mustaqim: And if you were to count the blessings of Allah you could not enumerate them, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.

19.Mustaqim: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you disclose.

20.Mustaqim: And those they call besides Allah do not create anything and are themselves created.

21.Mustaqim: They are dead, not alive, and they have no idea when they will be raised.

22.Mustaqim: Your god is one single god, and those who do not believe in the hereafter, their hearts are averse and they are arrogant.

23.Mustaqim: Without fail Allah knows what they conceal and what they disclose, and He does not love the arrogant.

24.Mustaqim: And when they were asked what did your Lord reveal, they said: stories of old.

25.Mustaqim: So that they carry their burden in full on the day of resurrection and of the burden of those whom they lead astray without knowledge; bad is what they carry.

26.Mustaqim: Those before them schemed, then Allah shook their building from its foundations and the roof fell on them from above and the punishment reached them from where they did not realise.

27.Mustaqim: Then on the day of resurrection He will humiliate them and say: where are My associates on whose behalf you were in opposition? Those with knowledge will say: today disgrace and troubles is upon those who rejected (the truth).

28.Mustaqim: Those whom the angels take away whilst they wronged themselves, and they offer peace, saying: we didn´t do anything wrong, but no, Allah knows what you did.

29.Mustaqim: So enter the gates of hell to remain there, and bad is the home of the arrogant.

30.Mustaqim: And it will be said to those who bewared (of Allah), what did your Lord reveal, they will say: that which is good. There is good for those who did good in this world, and the abode of the hereafter is (even) better, and blessed is the home of those who beware.

31.Mustaqim: The gardens of Eden which they will enter; rivers flow through it and they have there whatever they wish. This is how Allah rewards those who beware (of Him).

32.Mustaqim: Those whom the angels take away whilst they are good, saying: peace be with you, enter the garden on account of what you used to do.

33.Mustaqim: Do they wait that the angels will come to them or the command of your Lord will come? This is what those before them did, and Allah did not wrong them but they wronged themselves.

34.Mustaqim: Then their bad deeds caught up with them and what they used to make fun of overcame them.

35.Mustaqim: And the idolaters say: if Allah willed we would not have served anything besides Him, neither us nor our fathers, and we would not have sanctified anything besides Him. This is what those before them did, so are the messengers tasked with anything but to convey clearly?

36.Mustaqim: And We sent amongst every community a messenger saying: serve Allah and shun the idols. Then amongst them are those whom Allah guides and among them are those for whom error comes true, so travel on the earth, then see what the outcome was like for the deniers.

37.Mustaqim: You may desire their guidance, but Allah does not guide those who lead astray, and they have no helpers.

38.Mustaqim: And they swear their utmost oaths by Allah that Allah will not raise the dead, but no, it is a binding promise upon Him, but most people don´t know.

39.Mustaqim: So that He explains to them what they differed in and so that those who rejected (the truth) will know that they were liars.

40.Mustaqim: For whenever We want something, We say to it: Be, then it is.

41.Mustaqim: And those who migrate for Allah after having been wronged, We will arrange for them good in this world and the reward of the hereafter will be greater, if they only knew.

42.Mustaqim: Those who were patient and relied on their Lord.

43.Mustaqim: And before you We only sent men to whom We gave revelation, so ask those who keep the reminder if you don´t know.

44.Mustaqim: With clear proofs and the scriptures, and We revealed to you the reminder to explain to mankind what has been revealed to them so that they reflect.

45.Mustaqim: Are then those who scheme evil safe that Allah should not make the earth swallow them up or bring them the punishment from where they do not realise?

46.Mustaqim: Or overtake them whilst they move about, then they will not escape?

47.Mustaqim: Or take things away from them? For your Lord is lenient and merciful.

48.Mustaqim: Do they not see that whatever Allah created, its shadow turns submissively to the right and left in prostration to Allah?

49.Mustaqim: And to Allah prostrates whatever creature is in the heavens and on earth and the angels, and they are not arrogant.

50.Mustaqim: They fear their Lord above them and do as they are commanded.

51.Mustaqim: And Allah stated: do not take two gods, for He is one single god, so fear only Me.

52.Mustaqim: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth, and His is the lasting religion, so would you beware of other than Allah?

53.Mustaqim: And whatever blessing you have, it is from Allah, then, when hardship afflicts you, you pray to Him.

54.Mustaqim: Then, when He removes the hardship from you, a group of you assign partners to their Lord.

55.Mustaqim: So that they reject that which We gave them, then enjoy it for a while, you will soon know.

56.Mustaqim: And they assign a share of what We have provided them with to that which they do not know. By Allah, you will be asked about what you invented.

57.Mustaqim: And they assign daughters to Allah, glorified is He, and for them is what they desire?

58.Mustaqim: And when any of them is given news of a female, his face darkens and he is upset.

59.Mustaqim: He hides from the people on account of the news he received: should he keep it in shame or bury it in the ground? Bad is how they judge.

60.Mustaqim: For those who do not believe in the hereafter have evil attributes and Allah has the highest attributes, and He is mighty and wise.

61.Mustaqim: And if Allah held people to account for their wrongdoing, He would not leave a single creature (on earth), but He gives them time until a fixed date, then when their date comes, they will not delay it for an hour nor speed it up.

62.Mustaqim: And they assign to Allah what they dislike, and their tongues invent lies that they will have the best, without fail they will have the fire and they will be abandoned.

63.Mustaqim: By Allah, We sent to communities before you, then the devil made their deeds appeal to them, so he is their protector today, and theirs is a painful punishment.

64.Mustaqim: And We only revealed the book to you to explain to them that in which they differed and as a guidance and mercy for people who believe.

65.Mustaqim: And Allah sent down from the sky water then revived with it the earth after its death, in that is a sign for people who listen.

66.Mustaqim: And there is a lesson for you in the cattle, We give you pure milk to drink from their bellies, originating in between the waste matter and blood, pleasant to drink.

67.Mustaqim: And of the fruit of the palm tree and grape vine you obtain intoxicants and good provision, in that is a sign for people who understand.

68.Mustaqim: And your Lord inspired the bee to adopt houses in the mountains and the trees and in what they construct.

69.Mustaqim: Then eat of every fruit and travel on the paths made available by your Lord. From its belly emerges a syrup of different colours in which there is healing for people. In that is a sign for people who reflect.

70.Mustaqim: And Allah created you, then He takes you away, and amongst you is he who is returned to most feeble old age, so that he knows nothing after having had knowledge, for Allah knows and is able.

71.Mustaqim: And Allah preferred some of you over others in provision, and those who were preferred  do not reject their provision in favour of those in their possession so that they would be equal in it. Do they then dispute Allah´s blessings?

72.Mustaqim: And Allah gave you partners from amongst yourselves and gave you from your partners children and grandchildren and provided well for you. Do they then believe in falsehood and reject the blessings of Allah?

73.Mustaqim: And they serve besides Allah that which does not have control of any provision for them from the heavens or the earth nor could they.

74.Mustaqim: So do not coin likenesses for Allah, for Allah knows and you don´t know.

75.Mustaqim: Allah coins the likeness of a wholly owned slave unable to do anything and him whom We have provided with good provision of which he spends secretly and openly - are they the same? Allah is praised, but most of them don´t know.

76.Mustaqim: And Allah coins the likeness of two men, one of them dumb, unable to do anything and useless to his master, wherever he directs him, he does not do any good - is he the same as the one who commands justice and is on the straight path?

77.Mustaqim: And to Allah belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and the Hour will happen in the blink of an eye or is even closer, for Allah is able to do anything.

78.Mustaqim: And Allah brought you out of the wombs of your mothers when you knew nothing and gave you hearing and eyesight and hearts, so that you would be grateful.

79.Mustaqim: Do they not consider the birds held suspended in the air of the sky. Only Allah holds them up, for in that are signs for people who believe.

80.Mustaqim: And Allah gave you dwellings in your houses and gave you houses from the skins of cattle which are lightweight on the days you depart and camp, and of their wool and fur and hair you obtain furnishings and provision for a while.

81.Mustaqim: And Allah gave you shade from what He created and gave you shelter in the mountains and gave you clothing to protect you against the heat and clothing to protect you against harm. Like this He completed His favours for you, so that you would submit (as Muslims).

82.Mustaqim: But if they turn away, then your duty is only to convey clearly.

83.Mustaqim: They know the favours of Allah, then they negate them and most of them are rejecters (of the truth).

84.Mustaqim: And on the day We raise a witness of every community, no excuses will be accepted from those who rejected (the truth) nor will they be allowed redress.

85.Mustaqim: And when those who did wrong see the punishment it will not be lightened for them and they will not be spared.

86.Mustaqim: And when the idolaters see their idols, they will say: our Lord, these are our idols on whom we called besides You, but they respond to them: you are liars.

87.Mustaqim: And that day they will offer submission to Allah and what they used to invent deserted them.

88.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) and divert from the way of Allah, We increase the punishment manifold for them because of their corruption.

89.Mustaqim: And on the day We raise in every community a witness against them from amongst themselves and bring you as a witness against these - and We revealed to you the book as an explanation of everything and a guidance and a mercy and good news for those who submit (as Muslims).

90.Mustaqim: Allah commands justice and goodness and to give to relatives and forbids indecency, wrongdoing and transgression; He admonishes you so that you take heed.

91.Mustaqim: And observe your promise to Allah when you have promised and do not violate your oaths after confirming them when you have made Allah a guarantor over you, for Allah knows what you do.

92.Mustaqim: And do not be like the woman who completely undoes her knitting after it has been put together, using your oaths as a means of gaining an advantage between you when one community is stronger than the other, for Allah tests you with it in order to explain to you on the day of resurrection what you used to differ in.

93.Mustaqim: And had Allah willed, He would have made you a single community, but He lets go astray whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases, and you will be asked about what you did.

94.Mustaqim: And do not use your oaths to gain an advantage between you, derailing things after they were established, so you will experience hardship because you diverted from the way of Allah and you will have a severe punishment.

95.Mustaqim: And do not sell your promise to Allah for a small price, for what is with Allah is better for you if you knew.

96.Mustaqim: What is with you vanishes and what is with Allah remains, and We will give those who have patience their reward in line with the best of what they did.

97.Mustaqim: Whoever does good work, male or female, and is a believer, We let them live a good life and give them their reward in line with the best of what they did.

98.Mustaqim: And when you read the Qur´an seek refuge in Allah from the cursed devil.

99.Mustaqim: For he has no authority over those who believe and rely on their Lord.

100.Mustaqim: He only has authority over those who befriend him and who take him as an associate.

101.Mustaqim: And when We replace one verse with another, and Allah knows best what He reveals, they say: you invented it. But most of them don´t know.

102.Mustaqim: Say: the holy spirit revealed it from your Lord in truth to strengthen those who believe and as a guidance and good news for those who submit (as Muslims).

103.Mustaqim: We know that they say: a man taught him. The language of the one they refer to is foreign and this is a clear Arabic language.

104.Mustaqim: Those who do not believe in the signs of Allah, Allah does not guide them and theirs is a painful punishment.

105.Mustaqim: The ones who invent lies are those who do not believe in the signs of Allah, and they are the liars.

106.Mustaqim: Whoever rejects Allah after having believed, except for one who has been compelled whilst his heart is content with belief, but whoever openly shows rejection, upon them is anger from Allah and theirs is a severe punishment.

107.Mustaqim: This is because they prefer the life of this world to the hereafter and that Allah does not guide people who reject (the truth).

108.Mustaqim: Those are the ones whose hearts, hearing and eyesight Allah has sealed, and those are the careless.

109.Mustaqim: Without fail they will be the losers in the hereafter.

110.Mustaqim: Then your Lord is forgiving and merciful to those who migrated after having been persecuted, then they fought and were steadfast.

111.Mustaqim: On the day when every soul will come arguing on its own behalf and every soul will be given in full what it has worked for and they will not be wronged.

112.Mustaqim: And Allah coins the likeness of a town which was safe and content, with its provision reaching it freely from everywhere, but they rejected the blessings of Allah, so Allah made them taste the garment of hunger and fear on account of what they used to fabricate.

113.Mustaqim: And a messenger from amongst them had previously come to them, but they denied him, so the punishment overtook them whilst they were wrongdoers.

114.Mustaqim: So eat of what Allah has provided you with as lawful and good and be grateful for the blessings of Allah if you serve Him.

115.Mustaqim: He has only forbidden you carrion, blood and pork and whatever has been consecrated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced without (wilful) transgression or habit, then Allah is forgiving and merciful.

116.Mustaqim: And do not state from your own fabrications that this is lawful and this is forbidden in order to invent a lie against Allah, for those who invent a lie against Allah will not succeed.

117.Mustaqim: They will have a short provision and a painful punishment.

118.Mustaqim: And to the Jews We made unlawful what We previously told you about, and We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

119.Mustaqim: Then your Lord is forgiving and merciful to those who do bad out of ignorance, then repent and do good.

120.Mustaqim: Ibrahim (Abraham) was a humble leader, sincerely devoted to Allah, and was not of the idolaters.

121.Mustaqim: He was grateful for His blessings, and He chose him and guided him on a straight path.

122.Mustaqim: And We gave him good in this world, and in the hereafter he is amongst the righteous.

123.Mustaqim: Then we revealed to you to follow the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham), sincerely devoted, for he was not one of the idolaters.

124.Mustaqim: The Sabbath was imposed on those who differed about it, and your Lord will judge between them on the day of resurrection with regard to what they used to differ in.

125.Mustaqim: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and beautiful admonition and argue with them through that which is better, for your Lord knows best who strays from His way and He knows best those who are guided.

126.Mustaqim: And if you punish, then punish with the like of what you were afflicted with, and if you have patience, then it is better for those who have patience.

127.Mustaqim: And be patient, and your patience is only through Allah, and do not worry about them and do not be uptight about what they are scheming.

128.Mustaqim: For Allah is with those who beware (of Him) and those who do good.

1.Mustaqim: Glorified is He who took His servant on a journey by night from the sacred mosque (the Ka´bah) to the furthest mosque (al-Aqsa), whose surroundings We blessed, to show him of Our signs, for He listens and sees.

2.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) the book and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel, (saying): do not take any protector besides Me.

3.Mustaqim: They were descendants of those We carried with Nuh (Noah), for he was a grateful servant.

4.Mustaqim: And We decreed for the Children of Israel in the book: you will cause corruption on earth twice and will display great arrogance.

5.Mustaqim: Then when the first of the promises came We raised against you servants of Ours with terrifying strength and they devastated your homes and it was an accomplished promise.

6.Mustaqim: Then We returned to you the advantage over them and helped you with wealth and children and increased you in numbers.

7.Mustaqim: If you do good, you do good for your own souls, and if you do bad, then against them; then when the second of the promises came for them to strike your faces and to enter the temple as they had done the first time and to completely destroy what they conquered:

8.Mustaqim: Maybe your Lord will have mercy on you, but if you do it again, We will do it again, and we have made hell a prison for those who reject (the truth).

9.Mustaqim: This Qur´an guides to that which is more upright and gives good news to the believers who do good that they will have a great reward.

10.Mustaqim: And that We have prepared for those who do not believe in the hereafter a painful punishment.

11.Mustaqim: And man calls for bad as much as he calls for good, and man is always in haste.

12.Mustaqim: And We made the night and the day as two markers and We erased the marker of the night and made the marker of the day visible for you to seek the favours from your Lord and so that you know the number of years and counting, and We arranged everything in detail.

13.Mustaqim: And We attached every man´s destiny to his neck and produce a book for him on the day of resurrection which he finds laid open.

14.Mustaqim: Read your book, it will suffice as your own account against you today.

15.Mustaqim: Whoever wants to be guided is guided for his own good and who goes astray, goes astray only against himself, and no-one burdened will carry another´s burden, and We never punish until We send a messenger.

16.Mustaqim: And if We want to destroy a town, We give authority to its affluent people, then they act immorally in it, so it deserves the decree, and We annihilate it completely.

17.Mustaqim: And how many a generation after Nuh (Noah) did We destroy, and your Lord is sufficient to know and see the sins of His servants.

18.Mustaqim: Whoever wants the immediate life, We hasten for whoever We please whatever We please in it, then We arrange hell for him in which he burns condemned and rejected.

19.Mustaqim: And whoever wants the hereafter and makes an effort for it and is a believer, their effort will be acknowledged.

20.Mustaqim: To all of them We extend the gifts of your Lord, and the gifts of your Lord are not held back.

21.Mustaqim: See how We prefer some over others, and the hereafter will have even greater grading and preferment.

22.Mustaqim: Do not place another god with Allah or you will be left condemned and abandoned.

23.Mustaqim: And your Lord decreed that you should serve none but Him and show kindness to parents. If one or both of them reach old age with you, then do not say words of irritation to them nor scold them but speak to them with respect.

24.Mustaqim: And give them comfort in humility out of mercy and say: my Lord, have mercy on them as they looked after me when I was little.

25.Mustaqim: Your Lord knows best what is within you. If you are righteous, then He is forgiving to those who repent.

26.Mustaqim: And give relatives their due and the poor and the traveller and do not be wasteful.

27.Mustaqim: For the wasteful are the brothers of the devils, and the devil was ungrateful to his Lord.

28.Mustaqim: And if you turn away from them seeking mercy from your Lord which you look forward to, then say words of ease to them.

29.Mustaqim: And do not keep your hands tied to your neck nor stretch them out completely, so that you would be left regretful and destitute.

30.Mustaqim: For your Lord expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, for He knows and sees His servants.

31.Mustaqim: And do not kill your children due to fear of poverty, We provide for them and for you. Killing them is a great sin.

32.Mustaqim: And do not go near fornication, for it is indecency and a bad way.

33.Mustaqim: And do not kill a soul, which Allah has forbidden, except with right. And if somebody was killed wrongfully, We have given authority to his successor, but let him not be excessive in killing, for he will be helped.

34.Mustaqim: And do not approach the wealth of the orphan, except to improve it, until he reaches full strength, and keep promises, for promises will be asked about.

35.Mustaqim: And always give full measure and weigh with a level balance, that is better and better in outcome.

36.Mustaqim: And do not support anything of which you have no knowledge, for the hearing and eyesight and hearts all will be asked about.

37.Mustaqim: And do not walk triumphant on earth, for you cannot cut through the earth nor reach the mountains in height.

38.Mustaqim: The evil of all that is disliked by your Lord.

39.Mustaqim: This is of the wisdom your Lord revealed to you, and do not place another god with Allah, so that you will be thrown regretful and rejected into hell.

40.Mustaqim: Does your Lord then select sons for you and take females from amongst the angels? You make some great claim!

41.Mustaqim: We have repeatedly explained things in this Qur´an so that they would reflect, but it only increases their disagreement.

42.Mustaqim: Say: if there were other gods with Him as you say, then they would try to contest the owner of the throne.

43.Mustaqim: Glorified and exalted is He greatly above what they say.

44.Mustaqim: The seven heavens and the earth and whoever is within them glorify Him, and there is nothing which does not glorify His praise, but you do not understand their glorification, for He is gentle and forgiving.

45.Mustaqim: And when you read the Qur´an We place between you and those who do not believe in the hereafter a protective barrier.

46.Mustaqim: And We place a cover over their hearts, so they do not understand it, and a weight upon their ears, and if you mention your Lord alone in the Qur´an, they turn away in disagreement.

47.Mustaqim: We know best what they listen to when they listen to you and when they talk secretly, when the wrongdoers say: you only follow a deranged man.

48.Mustaqim: See how they coin likenesses for you and go astray and can´t find a way.

49.Mustaqim: And they say: when we are bones and dust, are we going to be raised as a new creation?

50.Mustaqim: Say: even if you were stones or iron,

51.Mustaqim: Or some creation which seems greater to you. Then they will say: who will bring us back? Say: the One who originated you the first time. Then they will shake their heads at you and say: when will it be? Say: maybe it will be soon.

52.Mustaqim: On the day He will call you and you will respond with His praise and think that you only stayed a little while.

53.Mustaqim: And tell My servants to speak nicely as the devil causes provocation between them, for the devil is a clear enemy to man.

54.Mustaqim: Your Lord knows best about you. If He pleases, He has mercy on you or, if He pleases, He punishes you, and We did not send you as a guardian over them.

55.Mustaqim: And your Lord knows best who is in the heavens and on earth, and We have favoured some prophets over others and gave Dawud (David) the Psalms.

56.Mustaqim: Say: call on those whom you claim besides Him, then they will have no power to remove harm from you nor change it.

57.Mustaqim: Those on whom they call compete (themselves) as to who gets closest to Allah and look forward to His mercy and fear His punishment, for the punishment of your Lord is to be guarded against.

58.Mustaqim: And there is no town which We will not destroy before the day of resurrection or punish severely, that is recorded in the book.

59.Mustaqim: And nothing prevented us from sending signs except that the earliest communities denied them, and We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign but they wronged her, and We only send signs as a warning.

60.Mustaqim: And when We told you: your Lord has surrounded the people, and We only made the dream We showed you a test for the people, and the cursed tree in the Qur´an, and We frighten them but it only increases them in major transgression.

61.Mustaqim: And when We said to the angels: Prostrate before Adam, they prostrated except for Iblis (the devil); he said: am I going to prostrate before someone You created from clay?

62.Mustaqim: He said: Look at the one You have favoured above me, if You give me delay until the day of resurrection I will mislead his descendants except for a few.

63.Mustaqim: He said: Go, then whoever follows you among them, hell is your reward, an ample reward!

64.Mustaqim: And incite whoever you can among them with your voice and impress on them with your horses and men and share in their wealth and children and promise them, and the devil only promises them an illusion.

65.Mustaqim: As for My servants, you have no authority over them, and your Lord is sufficient as protector.

66.Mustaqim: Your Lord is the One who makes the ship move on the sea for you so you seek of His favours, for He is merciful to you.

67.Mustaqim: And when harm afflicts you on sea, all whom you call upon besides Him disappear, then when He rescues you on to land, you renounce, and man is ungrateful.

68.Mustaqim: Are you then safe from Him subjecting you to a landslide or sending a storm against you? Then you will not find a protector for yourselves.

69.Mustaqim: Or are you safe that He returns you to it another time and sends against you a raging wind, then drowns you because you rejected (the truth), then you will not find anyone to assist you against Us.

70.Mustaqim: And We have honoured the children of Adam and carried them on land and sea and provided well for them and favoured them greatly above many of those We created.

71.Mustaqim: On the day We call every people with their leader, then who is given his book in his right hand, those will read their book and will not be wronged the least.

72.Mustaqim: And whoever was blind in this world, he will be blind in the hereafter and most astray from the way.

73.Mustaqim: And they were about to tempt you away from what We revealed to you so that you would invent something else against us, and then they would have taken you as a friend.

74.Mustaqim: And had We not made you firm you would have inclined to them a little.

75.Mustaqim: Then We would have made you taste double (the punishment) in life and double in death, then  you would not have found for yourself a helper against Us.

76.Mustaqim: And they were about to drive you out from the land in order to expel you from it, and then they would not have stayed behind after you except a little.

77.Mustaqim: This was the custom for whoever We sent as messenger before you, and you will not find an alteration in Our custom.

78.Mustaqim: Keep up prayer from the lowering of the sun to the darkness of night and recite the Qur´an at daybreak, for the recitation of the Qur´an at daybreak is witnessed.

79.Mustaqim: And spend some of the night in prayer as an additional effort for you, your Lord might raise you to a recognised position.

80.Mustaqim: And say: my Lord, provide me an honourable entrance and an honourable exit, and give me authority and assistance from You.

81.Mustaqim: And say: the truth has come and falsehood has vanished, for falsehood always vanishes.

82.Mustaqim: And We have revealed of the Qur´an that which is a healing and mercy for the believers, and it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.

83.Mustaqim: And when We give blessings to man, he rebels and keeps aside, and when harm afflicts him, he is despondent.

84.Mustaqim: Say: let everyone do as he sees fit, for  your Lord knows best who is most guided on the way.

85.Mustaqim: And they ask you about the Spirit. Say: the Spirit is from the command of my Lord and you were only given very little knowledge.

86.Mustaqim: And if We pleased, We would take away that which We revealed to you, then you would not find for yourself a protector against Us.

87.Mustaqim: Except by the mercy of your Lord, for His favours upon you are great.

88.Mustaqim: And if men and jinn combined to bring similar to this Qur´an, they would not bring anything similar to it, even if they supported each other.

89.Mustaqim: And We have explained to people in this Qur´an all kind of examples, but most people refuse anything but rejection.

90.Mustaqim: And they say: we will not believe until you make a spring gush out of the earth for us.

91.Mustaqim: Or you have a garden of palm trees and grapes and the rivers run through it.

92.Mustaqim: Or you make the sky fall on us like you claimed or you bring Allah and the angels in front of us.

93.Mustaqim: Or you have a house of gold or ascend in the sky, and we will not believe in your ascent until you bring down to us a book we can read. Say: Glorified is my Lord, am I anything but a man and messenger?

94.Mustaqim: And nothing prevents people from believing when the guidance comes to them except that they say: did Allah raise a man as a messenger?

95.Mustaqim: Say: if angels walked safely on earth, We would have send upon them from the sky an angel as a messenger.

96.Mustaqim: Say: Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you, for He knows and sees His servants.

97.Mustaqim: And whomever Allah guides, he is guided, and whom He lets go astray, you will not find protectors besides Him for them, and We gather them on the day of resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf. Their abode is hell; whenever it dies out We increase the flame for them.

98.Mustaqim: This is the punishment for having rejected Our signs. And they say: when we are bones and dust, are we going to be raised as a new creation?

99.Mustaqim: Have they not considered that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is capable of creating the like of them? And He has appointed for them a fixed term in which there is no doubt, but the wrongdoers refuse anything but rejection.

100.Mustaqim: Say: if you were to own the treasures of your Lord´s mercy you would withhold out of fear of poverty, and man is always stingy.

101.Mustaqim: We gave Musa (Moses) seven clear signs, so ask the Children of Israel, when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him: Oh Musa (Moses), I think you are deranged.

102.Mustaqim: He said: you already know that these were sent by the Lord of the heavens and the earth as clear evidence, and oh Pharaoh, I think you are doomed.

103.Mustaqim: And he wanted to drive them out of the land, so We drowned him and all those with him.

104.Mustaqim: And after that We said to the Children of Israel: live on the land, then when the final promise comes, We bring you herded together.

105.Mustaqim: And We revealed it in truth and in truth it came down, and We only sent you as a bringer of good news and warner.

106.Mustaqim: And it is a Qur´an which We have divided so that you recite it to people gradually, and We have sent it down successively.

107.Mustaqim: Say: believe in it or do not believe in it, those who were given knowledge before fall prostrate on their faces when it is recited to them.

108.Mustaqim: And they say: glorified is our Lord, the promise of our Lord will come to pass.

109.Mustaqim: And they fall prostrate on their faces crying, and it increases them in humility.

110.Mustaqim: Say: call on Allah or call on the Merciful, whatever you call on, His are the most beautiful names. And do not be loud in your prayer nor hide it, and seek a way between that.

111.Mustaqim: And say: Allah is praised who did not adopt a son nor does He have a partner in the kingdom nor does He have an ally from beneath Him, and proclaim His greatness.

1.Mustaqim: Allah is praised who revealed to His servant the book and did not place any deviation in it.

2.Mustaqim: Upright as a warning of severe harm from Him and good news to the believers who do good work that they will have a beautiful reward.

3.Mustaqim: In which they will remain forever.

4.Mustaqim: And as a warning to those who say Allah has adopted a son.

5.Mustaqim: They have no knowledge of it nor have their fathers, grave is the word that comes out of their mouths, they only speak a lie.

6.Mustaqim: So you almost kill yourself with worry pursuing them as they do not believe in this word.

7.Mustaqim: For We have placed everything on earth as an adornment for it to test them who of them is best in deeds.

8.Mustaqim: And We will turn what is on it into barren soil.

9.Mustaqim: Or do you consider the companions of the cave and the inscription amongst Our amazing signs?

10.Mustaqim: When the youths sought refuge in the cave and said: our Lord, give us mercy from You and grant us righteousness in our affair.

11.Mustaqim: So We sealed their ears in the cave for a number of years.

12.Mustaqim: Then We raised them in order to know which of the two groups would best count the duration they stayed.

13.Mustaqim: We tell you their account in truth. They were youths who believed in their Lord and We increased them in guidance.

14.Mustaqim: And We fortified their hearts when they rose and said: our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, we shall not call on any god besides Him or we would say something excessive.

15.Mustaqim: These our people have adopted gods besides Him. Why do they not bring a clear authority for them? So who is more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah?

16.Mustaqim: And when you part from them and what they serve besides Allah, seek refuge in the cave, your Lord will spread out His mercy for you and grant you ease in your affair.

17.Mustaqim: And you see the sun pass to the right of their cave when it rises and avoid them on the left when it sets whilst they are in a gap between. This is from the signs of Allah. Whom Allah guides, he is guided, and whom He lets go astray, you will not find a guardian for him to lead him right.

18.Mustaqim: And you consider them awake whilst they are asleep, and We turn them to the right and the left, and their dog stretches out its paws at the entrance. If you were to stumble across them, you would have run away and been filled with fear of them.

19.Mustaqim: And likewise We raised them so that they would ask each other. One of them said: how long did you stay? They said: we stayed a day or part of a day. They said: your Lord knows best how long you stayed, so send one of you with these coins of yours to the town and let him see which food is purest and bring you provision from it, and let him be discrete, so nobody notices you.

20.Mustaqim: For if they discover you, they will stone you or return you to their religion and you will never succeed.

21.Mustaqim: And like this We had them found out so that they would know that Allah´s promise is true and that there is no doubt about the hour when they argued amongst each other about their affair and said: construct a building over them. Your Lord knows best about them. Those who won the argument said: we will erect a prayer place over them.

22.Mustaqim: They will say (they were) three and their dog the fourth, and they say five and their dog the sixth, guessing the unseen, and they say seven and their dog the eighth. Say: my Lord knows their number best, only few know about them, so do not openly dispute about them regarding anything that is not apparent nor ask any of them their opinion about them.

23.Mustaqim: And do not say about anything that I will do this tomorrow,

24.Mustaqim: Except if Allah pleases. And remember  your Lord if you forgot and say: maybe my Lord will guide me to greater righteousness than this.

25.Mustaqim: And they stayed in their cave for three hundred years, to which they add nine.

26.Mustaqim: Say: Allah knows best how long they stayed, His is the unseen of the heavens and the earth, He sees and hears all; they have no protector besides Him nor does He share His judgement with anyone.

27.Mustaqim: And recite to them what has been revealed to you from the book of your Lord, there is no changing His words and you will not find a refuge besides Him.

28.Mustaqim: And be yourself patient together with those who call their Lord in the mornings and evenings seeking His presence, and do not avert your eyes from them seeking the adornment of this world, and do not obey the one whose heart We have made careless about remembering Us and he follows his desire and his effort is wasted.
