29.Mustaqim: And say: the truth from your Lord, so whoever pleases, let him believe, and whoever pleases, let him reject, for We have prepared a fire for the wrongdoers which surrounds them completely, and when they ask for drink, they are given to drink water like lava which roasts their faces - what a bad drink and what a bad resting place.

30.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, We do not waste the reward of anyone with good deeds.

31.Mustaqim: For them are the gardens of Eden through which rivers flow, they are adorned there with bracelets of gold and wear green clothes from silk and brocade, reclining there on couches - what a blessed reward and what a beautiful resting place.

32.Mustaqim: And coin for them the likeness of two men: one of them We gave two gardens of grapes and surrounded them with palm trees and placed between them land for cultivation.

33.Mustaqim: Each of the gardens produced its fruit without any reduction and We made a river emerge between them.

34.Mustaqim: And he had abundance, so he said to his companion, challenging him, I have more wealth than you and stronger numbers.

35.Mustaqim: And he entered his garden, doing wrong to himself, saying: I don´t think this will ever disappear.

36.Mustaqim: And I don´t think the hour will happen, and if I were to be brought back to my Lord, I would find even better than this in its place.

37.Mustaqim: His companion said to him, challenging him, do you reject the One who created you from soil, then from a sperm, then shaped you into a man?

38.Mustaqim: But He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord.

39.Mustaqim: Why did you not say, when you entered your garden, whatever pleases Allah! There is no power except in Allah, if you look at me, I have less wealth and children than you.

40.Mustaqim: But maybe my Lord will give me better than your garden and send against it a torrent from the sky so that it becomes washed away soil.

41.Mustaqim: Or its water recedes, so you will not be able to find it.

42.Mustaqim: And his abundance was rounded up and he wrung his hands regarding what he had spent on it whilst it was abandoned in ruins and said: if only I did not associate anyone with my Lord.

43.Mustaqim: And he had no party to help him besides Allah and was not going to be helped.

44.Mustaqim: There the only true protection is with Allah, with Him is the best reward and the best outcome.

45.Mustaqim: And coin for them the likeness of the worldly life as water which We send down from the sky and the plants of the earth absorb it, then they become dry stalks which the winds carry off, and Allah has power over all things.

46.Mustaqim: Wealth and children are the adornment of the worldly life, and the lasting good deeds have a better reward with your Lord and give better rise to hope.

47.Mustaqim: And on the day We move the mountains and you see the earth exposed, and We gather them and leave not any of them out.

48.Mustaqim: And they will be presented before your Lord in ranks; you have come to Us as We created you the first time, but you claimed We would not have an appointment for you.

49.Mustaqim: And the book will be placed and you see the sinners anxious about what it contains and they say: woe to us, this book does not leave anything small or big without counting it. And they find present what they had done and your Lord does not wrong anyone.

50.Mustaqim: And when We said to the angels: prostrate before Adam, they prostrated except Iblis (the devil) who was from among the Jinn and deviated from the command of his Lord - are you then going to take him and his descendants as protecting friends besides Me when they are an enemy to you? A bad swap for the wrongdoers.

51.Mustaqim: I did not let them witness the creation of the heavens and the earth nor the creation of themselves and I did not take the support of those who lead astray.

52.Mustaqim: And on the day He says: call whom you claim to be My associates, then they call them but they do not respond to them and We place a barrier between them.

53.Mustaqim: And the sinners see the fire and think that they will be thrown in it and will not find an escape from it.

54.Mustaqim: We have explained to people in this Qur´an all kind of examples but man argues about most things.

55.Mustaqim: And nothing prevented people from believing when the guidance came to them and to seek forgiveness from their Lord except (that they waited) for the example of the earliest communities to reach them or the punishment to face them.

56.Mustaqim: And We only send the messengers as bringers of good news and warners, and those who reject (the truth) argue with falsehood in order to refute the truth with it and take My signs and their warnings as a joke.

57.Mustaqim: And who is more wrong than he who has been reminded by the signs of his Lord and turns away from them and forgets what he has sent ahead for himself. We have placed a cover over their hearts, so they do not understand it, and a weight upon their ears, and if you call them to the guidance they will never be guided.

58.Mustaqim: And your Lord is forgiving, full of mercy; if He overtook them on account of what they have earned, He would hasten the punishment for them, but there is a fixed term for them which they cannot avoid.

59.Mustaqim: As for the towns We have destroyed when they did wrong, We decreed a fixed term for their destruction.

60.Mustaqim: And when Musa (Moses) said to his male servant: I will not stop until I have reached the crossing between the two seas even if it takes a very long time.

61.Mustaqim: And when they reached the crossing between them they forgot their fish and it quickly made its way into the sea.

62.Mustaqim: And when they had passed beyond he said to his male servant: bring us our food, we have earned our share from this journey.

63.Mustaqim: He said: see, when we went towards the rock I forgot the fish, and only the devil made me forget to mention it, and it amazingly made its way into the sea.

64.Mustaqim: He said: this is what we were looking for, so they retraced their steps.

65.Mustaqim: Then they found one of Our servants whom We had given mercy from Us and taught him knowledge from Us.

66.Mustaqim: Musa (Moses) said to him: may I follow you so you will teach me of the righteousness you have been taught?

67.Mustaqim: He said: you cannot bear patience with me.

68.Mustaqim: And how can you bear patience with what you do not understand?

69.Mustaqim: He said: if Allah wills you will find me patient and I will not disobey you in anything.

70.Mustaqim: He said: then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I mention it to you.

71.Mustaqim: So they set off until they boarded a boat in which he made a hole. He said: did you make a hole in it to drown its people? You´ve done a strange thing.

72.Mustaqim: He said: did I not say that you cannot bear patience with me?

73.Mustaqim: He said: do not take me to account for having forgotten and do not make the matter difficult for me.

74.Mustaqim: So they set off until they met a boy and he killed him. He said: did you kill someone pure other than in retaliation, you have done something unacceptable.

75.Mustaqim: He said: did I not tell you that you cannot bear patience with me?

76.Mustaqim: He said: if I ask you anything after that, then do not accompany me; you will have found an excuse with me.

77.Mustaqim: So they set off until when they reached the inhabitants of a town they asked them for food but they refused to entertain them. Then they found a wall there which was about to fall, so he strengthened it. He said: if you wanted, you could have taken a reward for it.

78.Mustaqim: He said: this is the parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of what you could not bear patience with.

79.Mustaqim: As for the boat, it belonged to poor people who worked on the sea, and I intended to damage it because there was a king after them who took every boat by force.

80.Mustaqim: And as for the boy, his parents were believers and we feared that he would overpower them with transgression and rejection.

81.Mustaqim: So we intended that their Lord replaced him for them with someone purer and more merciful.

82.Mustaqim: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphans in the town and there was a treasure for them under it and their father was a righteous man, so your Lord intended that they should reach their full strength and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it on my own accord. That is the interpretation of what you could not bear patience with.

83.Mustaqim: And they ask you about the one with two horns. Say: I will recite to you a reminder about him.

84.Mustaqim: We established him on earth and gave him the means for everything.

85.Mustaqim: So he pursued a matter.

86.Mustaqim: Until when he reached the setting point of the sun he found it set in a muddy spring and found near it a people. We said: oh two-horned one, you can punish them or you can treat them well.

87.Mustaqim: He said: whoever does wrong, we will punish him, then he will be returned to his Lord who will punish him severely.

88.Mustaqim: And whoever believes and does good, he will have a good reward and we will make it easy for him.

89.Mustaqim: Then he pursued a matter.

90.Mustaqim: Until when he reached the rising point of the sun he found it rising near a people whom We had not given any screening from it.

91.Mustaqim: This is how it was, and We knew all about him.

92.Mustaqim: Then he pursued a matter.

93.Mustaqim: Until when he reached between the two extremes, he found another people who hardly understood any speech.

94.Mustaqim: They said: Oh two-horned one, Ya´juj and Ma´juj (Gog and Magog) are spreading corruption on earth, so shall we give you a tribute for you to place between us and them a barrier?

95.Mustaqim: He said: what my Lord has established me with is better, so help me with labour, I will place between you and them a structure.

96.Mustaqim: Bring me blocks of iron, then when he levelled the two ends he said: blow, until he made it glow, then he said: bring me the melted mass to pour on it.

97.Mustaqim: And they could not climb over it nor could they cut through it.

98.Mustaqim: He said: this is of the mercy of my Lord, but when my Lord´s promise comes to pass He will make it crumble, and my Lord´s promise is true.

99.Mustaqim: And on that day We let some of them mingle with others, and the horn is blown and We gather them all.

100.Mustaqim: And We present hell to those who rejected (the truth) on that day.

101.Mustaqim: Those whose eyes were closed to My remembrance and who could not listen.

102.Mustaqim: Do those who reject (the truth) count on taking My servants as protectors besides Me? We have prepared hell as a gift for those who reject (the truth).

103.Mustaqim: Say: Shall I inform you whose work is most useless?

104.Mustaqim: Those whose effort went astray in the life of the world and they reckon that they have done well.

105.Mustaqim: Those are the ones who reject the signs of their Lord and the meeting with Him, so their deeds are wasted and We assign no weight to them on the day of resurrection.

106.Mustaqim: This is their reward: hell, on account of having rejected (the truth) and taken My signs and My messengers for a joke.

107.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, the gardens of paradise are their gift.

108.Mustaqim: They remain there and will not want it to change.

109.Mustaqim: Say: if the sea was the ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would run out before the words of my Lord would run out even if We brought a similar measure once more.

110.Mustaqim: Say: I am only a human like you to whom has been revealed that your god is a single god, so whoever looks forward to meeting his Lord, let him do good work and not associate in the service to my Lord anyone.

1.Mustaqim: Kaf, Ha, Ya, ´Ayn, Sad.

2.Mustaqim: A mention of the mercy of your Lord upon His servant Zakariya (Zacharias).

3.Mustaqim: When he secretly called out to his Lord.

4.Mustaqim: Saying: my Lord, my strength is leaving me and my head has turned grey and I have never been disappointed when calling to You.

5.Mustaqim: And I fear about my succession, and my wife is barren, so grant me from Yourself a successor.

6.Mustaqim: To inherit from me and the family of Ya´qub (Jacob) and, oh Lord, make him pleasing (to You).

7.Mustaqim: Oh Zakariya (Zacharias), We are giving you good news of a boy whose name is Yahya (John), We have not issued this name to anyone before.

8.Mustaqim: He said: oh my Lord, how can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached the end of my life.

9.Mustaqim: He said: this is what your Lord states: it is easy for Me, I previously created you out of nothing.

10.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, assign me a sign. He said: your sign is that you shall not talk to people for three nights consecutively.

11.Mustaqim: So he went out to his people from the prayer niche and gestured to them to glorify (Allah) in the mornings and evenings.

12.Mustaqim: Oh Yahya (John), adopt the book with strength, and We gave him sound judgement as a young boy.

13.Mustaqim: And (he was given) compassion and purity from Us, and he was aware (of Allah).

14.Mustaqim: And devoted to his parents, and he was not oppressive or rebellious.

15.Mustaqim: And peace is with him on the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is brought to life again.

16.Mustaqim: And mention in the book Maryam (Mary) when she retreated from her family to a place facing East.

17.Mustaqim: Then she separated herself from them and We sent to her Our spirit and he appeared to her like a real man.

18.Mustaqim: She said: I seek refuge in the Merciful from you if you beware (of Allah).

19.Mustaqim: He said: I am a messenger of your Lord to grant you a pure boy.

20.Mustaqim: She said: How can I have a boy when no man has touched me and I have not been immoral.

21.Mustaqim: He said: this is what your Lord states: it is easy for Me, and in order for Us to make you a sign for people and a mercy from Us, and it was a decided matter.

22.Mustaqim: So she carried him and retreated with him to a far off place.

23.Mustaqim: Then going into labour drove her to a palm trunk. She said: woe to me, if only I died before this and would be completely forgotten.

24.Mustaqim: Then he called her from beneath her: do not worry, your Lord has placed a stream beneath you.

25.Mustaqim: And shake the palm tree towards you, ripe fresh dates will fall on you.

26.Mustaqim: So eat and drink and rest your eyes, and if you see any person, say: I promised a fast to the Merciful and will therefore not speak to anyone today.

27.Mustaqim: So she brought him to her people. They said: oh Maryam (Mary), you have brought something unacceptable.

28.Mustaqim: Oh sister of Harun (Aaron), your father was not a bad man and your mother was not immoral.

29.Mustaqim: Then she pointed to him. They said: how can we talk to someone who is a child in a cradle?

30.Mustaqim: He said: I am the servant of Allah, He gave me the book and made me a prophet.

31.Mustaqim: And He made me a blessing wherever I am and He instructed me with prayer and Zakat as long as I live.

32.Mustaqim: And to be devoted to my mother and He did not make me oppressive or rebellious.

33.Mustaqim: And peace is with me on the day I was born and the day I die and the day I am brought to life again.

34.Mustaqim: That is ´Isa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), the statement of truth in which they have doubt.

35.Mustaqim: It is not befitting for Allah to adopt a son. Glorified is He. When He decides a matter, then He says to it: Be, then it is.

36.Mustaqim: And Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him. This is a straight path.

37.Mustaqim: Then the allies differed amongst themselves, so woe to those who reject (the truth) from the assembly on a tremendous day.

38.Mustaqim: Hear and see them on the day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers are in clear error today.

39.Mustaqim: And warn them of the day of loss when the matter is decided, whilst they are careless and do not believe.

40.Mustaqim: We will indeed inherit the earth and whoever is on it and they will return to Us.

41.Mustaqim: And mention in the book Ibrahim (Abraham), he was a truthful prophet.

42.Mustaqim: When he said to his father: oh my father, why do you serve that which does not hear nor see nor benefit you in any way?

43.Mustaqim: Oh my father, I have received knowledge you did not receive, so follow me, I will guide you to a level path.

44.Mustaqim: Oh my father, do not serve the devil, for the devil was disobedient to the Merciful.

45.Mustaqim: Oh my father, I fear that a punishment from the Merciful will afflict you and you will be a friend to the devil.

46.Mustaqim: He said: do you dislike my gods, oh Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you do not stop, I will curse you and you better get out of my way.

47.Mustaqim: He said: peace be with you, I will ask my Lord for forgiveness for you, for He is always kind to me.

48.Mustaqim: I will move away from you and what you serve besides Allah and call on my Lord, hopefully I will not be disappointed when calling to my Lord.

49.Mustaqim: Then when he moved away from them and what they served besides Allah, We gave him Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya´qub (Jacob) and made each of them a prophet.

50.Mustaqim: And We granted them of Our mercy and gave them a truthful and elevated reputation.

51.Mustaqim: And mention in the book Musa (Moses), he was sincere and was a messenger and prophet.

52.Mustaqim: And We called him from the mountain on the right and brought him near in direct communication.

53.Mustaqim: And We gave him of Our mercy his brother Harun (Aaron) as a prophet.

54.Mustaqim: And mention in the book Isma´il (Ishmael), he was the one to fulfil the promise and was a messenger and prophet.

55.Mustaqim: And he instructed his family to pray and give Zakat and was accepted by His Lord.

56.Mustaqim: And mention in the book Idris (Enoch), he was a truthful prophet.

57.Mustaqim: And We raised him to a high status.

58.Mustaqim: Those are the ones Allah has favoured of the prophets and the descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried with Nuh (Noah) and of the descendants of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isra´il (Israel) and of those whom We guided and chose; when the signs of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell prostrate in tears.

59.Mustaqim: And after them came a succession (of people) who neglected prayer and followed desires, and they will soon meet their downfall.

60.Mustaqim: Except he who repents and believes and does good, for those will enter the garden and will not be wronged at all.

61.Mustaqim: The gardens of Eden which the Merciful has promised to those who serve Him without seeing Him, for His promise will come to pass.

62.Mustaqim: They will not hear any idle talk there, only peace, and they will have their provision in the mornings and evenings.

63.Mustaqim: This is the garden which those of Our servants who bewared will inherit.

64.Mustaqim: And we (the angels) only descend by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs what lies before us and what lies behind us and what is in between, and your Lord does not forget.

65.Mustaqim: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is in between, so serve Him and persist in His service. Do you know anyone else like Him?

66.Mustaqim: And man says: when I die, am I going to be brought back to life?

67.Mustaqim: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

68.Mustaqim: So by your Lord, We shall gather them and the devils, then We shall present them kneeling down around hell.

69.Mustaqim: Then We shall pick out from every faction those who were most obstinate against the Merciful.

70.Mustaqim: Then We will know best those who are most deserving to burn in it.

71.Mustaqim: And all of you will approach it, this is a final decision of your Lord.

72.Mustaqim: Then We rescue those who bewared (of Allah) and abandon the wrongdoers kneeling down in it.

73.Mustaqim: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, those who reject (the truth) say to those who believe: which of the two groups is more settled and better represented?

74.Mustaqim: And how many generations have We destroyed before them who were better in luxury and appearance?

75.Mustaqim: Say: whoever is in error, the Merciful will give him space until when they see what they were promised, either the punishment or the hour, then they will know who is worse off and weaker in support.

76.Mustaqim: And Allah increases those who are guided in guidance, and the lasting good deeds have a better reward with your Lord and are better in return.

77.Mustaqim: Have you considered him who rejects Our signs and says: I will be given wealth and children.

78.Mustaqim: Does he access the unseen or has he entered into an agreement with the Merciful?

79.Mustaqim: No way, We write down what he says and extend the punishment for him.

80.Mustaqim: And We inherit what he says was his and he comes to Us alone.

81.Mustaqim: And they adopt gods besides Allah to be a strength for them.

82.Mustaqim: No way, they will reject their service and be hostile to them.

83.Mustaqim: Have you not considered that We sent the devils to those who reject (the truth) to stir them up.

84.Mustaqim: So be not in a hurry about them, We have a count-down for them.

85.Mustaqim: On the day We carry those who beware (of Allah) to the Merciful.

86.Mustaqim: And We herd the sinners towards hell.

87.Mustaqim: They have no power of intercession except for him who had an agreement with the Merciful.

88.Mustaqim: And they say: the Merciful has adopted a son.

89.Mustaqim: You have come up with something awful.

90.Mustaqim: The heavens almost split from it and the earth shakes and the mountains crumble,

91.Mustaqim: That they claim for the Merciful a son.

92.Mustaqim: And it is not befitting for the Merciful to adopt a son.

93.Mustaqim: For all who are in the heavens and on earth come to the Merciful as servants.

94.Mustaqim: He has counted them and given them a number.

95.Mustaqim: And each of them comes on the day of resurrection alone.

96.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, the Merciful will give them a welcome.

97.Mustaqim: And We have made it easy on your tongue so that you give good news to those who beware (of Allah) and warn with it an obstinate people.

98.Mustaqim: And how many generations have We destroyed before them; do you notice any of them or hear the slightest sound from them?

1.Mustaqim: Ta Ha.

2.Mustaqim: We did not reveal the Qur´an to you to be distressed.

3.Mustaqim: Only as a reminder to whoever fears (Allah).

4.Mustaqim: A revelation from the One who created the earth and the elevated heavens.

5.Mustaqim: The Merciful, who rose to the throne.

6.Mustaqim: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth and what is in between and what is below the ground.

7.Mustaqim: And when you speak audibly, He knows the secrets and what is most hidden.

8.Mustaqim: Allah, there is no god but Him, His are the most beautiful names.

9.Mustaqim: And has the story of Musa (Moses) reached you?

10.Mustaqim: When he saw a fire and said to his people: wait, I noticed a fire, maybe I can bring you a spark of it or find guidance by the fire.

11.Mustaqim: Then when he came to it he was called: oh Musa (Moses).

12.Mustaqim: I am your Lord, so take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

13.Mustaqim: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is being revealed.

14.Mustaqim: For I am Allah, there is no god except Me, so serve Me and keep up prayer to remember Me.

15.Mustaqim: The hour will come, I hardly hide it, so that every soul is rewarded for what it strives for.

16.Mustaqim: So let not one who does not believe in it and follows his desire divert you from it so that you are ruined.

17.Mustaqim: And what is that in your right hand, oh Musa (Moses)?

18.Mustaqim: He said: it is my staff, I lean on it and I round up my sheep with it and it has other uses for me.

19.Mustaqim: He said: throw it, oh Musa (Moses).

20.Mustaqim: So he threw it and it became a moving snake.

21.Mustaqim: He said: take it and do not fear, We will return it to its original form.

22.Mustaqim: And press your hand against your side, it will come out white without harm, another sign.

23.Mustaqim: So that We show you of Our great signs.

24.Mustaqim: Go to Pharaoh, he is transgressing.

25.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, expand my chest.

26.Mustaqim: And make my task easy for me.

27.Mustaqim: And untie the knot from my tongue.

28.Mustaqim: So they understand my speech.

29.Mustaqim: And give me a deputy from my family.

30.Mustaqim: Harun (Aaron), my brother.

31.Mustaqim: Increase with him my strength.

32.Mustaqim: And give him a share in my task.

33.Mustaqim: So that we glorify You a lot.

34.Mustaqim: And remember You a lot.

35.Mustaqim: For You watched over us.

36.Mustaqim: He said: your request has been granted, oh Musa (Moses).

37.Mustaqim: And We already favoured you another time.

38.Mustaqim: When We revealed to your mother what was revealed:

39.Mustaqim: Drop him into the basket and drop it into the river, then the river will carry it to the bank and an enemy to Me and to him will take it. And I poured love from Me on you so that you would grow up under My eyes.

40.Mustaqim: When your sister went and said: shall I point you to someone who will care for him? So We returned you to your mother to comfort her eyes and so she would not worry. And you killed a person and We rescued you from the grief and tested you a great deal, then you stayed a few years with the people of Madyan (Midian), then you came as decreed, oh Musa (Moses).

41.Mustaqim: And I have chosen you for Myself.

42.Mustaqim: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not tire of My remembrance.

43.Mustaqim: Go to Pharaoh, he is transgressing.

44.Mustaqim: And talk to him gently so that he might reflect or fear.

45.Mustaqim: He said: Our Lord, we fear that he will abuse us or transgress.

46.Mustaqim: He said: do not fear, I am with you, listening and seeing.

47.Mustaqim: So go to him and say: we are two messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not punish them. We have brought you a sign from your Lord, and peace be with him who follows the guidance.

48.Mustaqim: It has been revealed to us that the punishment is upon him who denies and turns away.

49.Mustaqim: He said: and who is your Lord, oh Musa (Moses).

50.Mustaqim: He said: our Lord is the One who gave everything its origin then directed it.

51.Mustaqim: He said: then what is the state of the earliest generations?

52.Mustaqim: He said: knowledge about them is with my Lord in a book, my Lord neither errs nor forgets.

53.Mustaqim: The One who gave you the earth as an expanse and cut paths in it for you and sent water from the sky by which We bring out various pairs of plants.

54.Mustaqim: Eat and graze your cattle, for in this are signs for those with reason.

55.Mustaqim: From it We created you and into it you return and from it We will bring you out once again.

56.Mustaqim: And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied and refused.

57.Mustaqim: He said: did you come to expel us from our land with your magic, oh Musa (Moses)?

58.Mustaqim: So we will bring you similar magic. Set an appointed time between us and you that neither we nor you will miss, at an open place.

59.Mustaqim: He said: your appointed time is the day of celebration and let people gather in the morning.

60.Mustaqim: So Pharaoh turned away and agreed his plot, then he came.

61.Mustaqim: Musa (Moses) said to them: woe to you, do not invent a lie against Allah so He afflicts you with punishment, and whoever invents (a lie) will be destroyed.

62.Mustaqim: Then they discussed their situation secretly amongst themselves.

63.Mustaqim: They said: these are two magicians who want to expel you from your land with their magic and take away your traditions.

64.Mustaqim: So agree on your plot, then come in ranks, and today the one who comes out on top will be successful.

65.Mustaqim: They said: oh Musa (Moses), either you throw or we throw first.

66.Mustaqim: He said: no, you throw, then their ropes and sticks appeared to move with their magic.

67.Mustaqim: So Musa (Moses) sensed fear in himself.

68.Mustaqim: We said: do not fear, you will come out on top.

69.Mustaqim: And throw what is in your right hand, it will take over the magician´s plot they have constructed, and the magician does not succeed, wherever he goes.

70.Mustaqim: Then the magicians fell prostrate, saying: we believe in the Lord of Harun (Aaron) and Musa (Moses).

71.Mustaqim: He said: do you believe him before I have given you permission? He must be your chief who taught you magic, so I will cut your hands and feet from opposite sides and crucify you on palm trunks and you will know who of us is more severe and lasting in punishment.

72.Mustaqim: They said: we will not give you priority over the clear proofs which have come to us and the One who originated us, so decide what you have to, you only decide about this worldly life.

73.Mustaqim: For we believe in our Lord so that He forgives us our sins and the magic you compelled us to do, and Allah is better and more lasting.

74.Mustaqim: Whoever comes to his Lord as a sinner, for him is hell where he will neither die nor live.

75.Mustaqim: And whoever comes to Him as a believer who does good work, for them are the highest stages.

76.Mustaqim: Gardens of Eden through which rivers flow where they will remain, and that is the reward for him who purifies himself.

77.Mustaqim: And We revealed to Musa (Moses) to travel with My servants and strike a dry path in the sea for them without fearing to be overtaken or being afraid.

78.Mustaqim: Then Pharaoh followed them with his soldiers and the sea completely surrounded them.

79.Mustaqim: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide them.

80.Mustaqim: Oh Children of Israel, We rescued you from your enemy and had a meeting with you with the mountain on the right and sent to you honeydew and quails.

81.Mustaqim: Eat from the good things We have provided you with and do not transgress in this state, so My anger becomes lawful on you, and on whom My anger becomes lawful, he has fallen.

82.Mustaqim: And I am forgiving to him who repents and believes and does good work and then is guided.

83.Mustaqim: And why have you hurried away from your people, oh Musa (Moses)?

84.Mustaqim: He said: they are following behind me, and I hurried to you in order to please  You, my Lord.

85.Mustaqim: He said: We have tested your people after you and Samiri led them astray.

86.Mustaqim: So Musa (Moses) returned to his people angry and sad, saying: oh my people, did not your Lord give you a good promise? Was this taking too long for you or did you want anger from you Lord to become lawful on you, so that you broke your promise to me?

87.Mustaqim: They said: we did not break our promise to you on our own account, but we carried loads of the jewellery of the people and cast it (in the fire) just as Samiri told us to.

88.Mustaqim: Then he brought the body of a calf out for them which had a mooing sound, so they said: this is your god and the god of Musa (Moses), but he forgot.

89.Mustaqim: Do they not see that it does not talk back to them nor has any control over harm or good for them?

90.Mustaqim: And Harun (Aaron) said to them before: oh my people, you are being tested by it and your Lord is the Merciful, so follow me and obey my command.

91.Mustaqim: They said: we will not stop being devoted to it until Musa (Moses) returns to us.

92.Mustaqim: He said: oh Harun (Aaron), what prevented you, when you saw them go astray,

93.Mustaqim: From following me? Did you disobey my command?

94.Mustaqim: He said: oh son of my mother, do not grab me by the beard nor by the head, I feared that you would say: you divided the Children of Israel and did not heed my word.

95.Mustaqim: He said: and what do you have to say, oh Samiri?

96.Mustaqim: He said: I saw what they did not see and took hold of a handful of the trace of the messenger and threw it in, and this is what my soul suggested to me.

97.Mustaqim: He said: so go and your destiny in life will be that you will say: I am untouchable, and you will have an appointed time which you will not miss, and look at your god that you were devoted to: we will burn it, then scatter it in the sea.

98.Mustaqim: For your god is Allah, the One besides whom there is no god and whose knowledge extends to everything.

99.Mustaqim: This is how We tell you of the information gone before and of which We have given you a reminder from Ourselves.

100.Mustaqim: Whoever turns away from it, he will carry a burden on the day of resurrection.

101.Mustaqim: They will remain there and what they carry on the day of resurrection will be bad for them.

102.Mustaqim: On the day the horn is blown and We will gather the sinners on that day with their eyes turning white.

103.Mustaqim: Whispering to each other: you have only stayed ten days.

104.Mustaqim: We know best what they say when the one most reasonable of them says: you have only stayed a day.

105.Mustaqim: And they ask you about the mountains, so say: my Lord will scatter them.

106.Mustaqim: Then leave them as an empty space.

107.Mustaqim: In which you will see neither contours nor protrusion.

108.Mustaqim: On that day they will follow the caller without deviation and the voices will be subdued to the Merciful and you will not hear anything except a whisper.

109.Mustaqim: On that day intercession will not benefit anyone unless the Merciful has given him permission and is pleased with what he says.

110.Mustaqim: He knows what lies before them and behind them and they do not grasp Him in knowledge.

111.Mustaqim: And the faces are humbled before the Living, the Eternal, and whoever is burdened with wrongdoing will be destroyed.

112.Mustaqim: And whoever did good work and is a believer, he will not fear wrongdoing nor injustice.

113.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed it as an Arabic Qur´an and explained the promise in it so that they beware (of Allah) or are given a reminder.

114.Mustaqim: Exalted, therefore, is Allah, the true king, and do not be in a hurry with the Qur´an before its revelation has been completed for you and say: my Lord, increase me in knowledge.

115.Mustaqim: And We had an agreement with Adam before but he forgot and We did not find that he had resolve.

116.Mustaqim: And when We said to the angels: "Prostrate before Adam", they prostrated except for Iblis (the devil); he refused.

117.Mustaqim: So We said: oh Adam, this is an enemy to you and your wife, so let him not expel you from the garden, so you would be distressed.

118.Mustaqim: For you are not hungry there nor are you exposed.

119.Mustaqim: And you are not thirsty there nor are you hot.

120.Mustaqim: Then the devil whispered to him, saying: oh Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and a kingdom which does not diminish?

121.Mustaqim: So they both ate from it and their bodies became apparent to them and they began to cover themselves with leaves from the garden, and Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray.

122.Mustaqim: Then His Lord chose him and turned back to him and guided him.

123.Mustaqim: He said: Get down from here, all of  you, as enemies one to another. then when a guidance reaches you from Me, whoever then follows My guidance, he will not go astray nor be distressed.

124.Mustaqim: And whoever turns away from My reminder, he will have a constrained life and on the day of resurrection We will gather him blind.

125.Mustaqim: He will say: my Lord, why did You gather me blind when I could see?

126.Mustaqim: He will say: likewise Our signs came to you but you forgot them, likewise you will be forgotten today.

127.Mustaqim: And this is how We punish the one who is wasteful and does not believe in the signs of his Lord, and the punishment of the hereafter is more severe and more lasting.

128.Mustaqim: Are they not guided by how many generations We destroyed before them in whose homes they walk? In this are signs for those with reason.

129.Mustaqim: And if a word from your Lord had not gone before, it would be inevitable, but it is a limited term.

130.Mustaqim: So have patience with what they say and glorify the praise of your Lord before sun rise and before it sets, and during part of the night glorify Him and at the ends of the day, so that you may be content.

131.Mustaqim: And do not extend your eyes to the enjoyment We have given some couples of them as the splendour of this world in order to test them by it, and the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting.

132.Mustaqim: And instruct your family to pray and be consistent in it; We do not ask provision from you, We provide for you, and the outcome is for those who beware (of Allah).

133.Mustaqim: And they say: why does not a sign come to us from our Lord? Did not a clear proof reach them from the earlier records?

134.Mustaqim: And had We destroyed them with a punishment before that, they would have said: our Lord, why did You not send a messenger to us so we would follow Your signs before being humiliated and disgraced?

135.Mustaqim: Say: all are waiting, so wait, then you will know who are the companions on the level path and who is guided.

1.Mustaqim: People´s reckoning is coming close and they are turning away carelessly.

2.Mustaqim: Whenever a new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they listen to it whilst playing.

3.Mustaqim: Their hearts are distracted and the wrongdoers meet secretly saying: is this not a human like you? Are you going to give in to the spell when you can see?

4.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord knows what is spoken in the heaven and on earth and He listens and knows.

5.Mustaqim: But they said: confused dreams, rather he invented it, rather he is a poet, so let him bring us a sign like the messengers sent before.

6.Mustaqim: No town which We destroyed before them believed, so are they going to believe?

7.Mustaqim: And before you We only sent men to whom We gave revelation, so ask those who keep the reminder if you don´t know.

8.Mustaqim: And We did not give them bodies which do not consume food nor were they immortal.

9.Mustaqim: Then We fulfilled the promise and rescued whom We please and destroyed the wasteful.

10.Mustaqim: We have revealed to you a book containing your reminder, so will you not understand?

11.Mustaqim: How often did We crush a town who did wrong and brought into existence other people after them?

12.Mustaqim: Then when they felt our adversity, they ran away from it.

13.Mustaqim: Don´t run away but return to the luxury you were in and your homes so you can be questioned!

14.Mustaqim: They said: woe to us, we were wrongdoers.

15.Mustaqim: And this call of theirs did not stop until We cut them down completely.

16.Mustaqim: And We did not create the heaven and earth and what is between as a pastime.

17.Mustaqim: Had We wanted to find amusement, We could have found that with Ourselves if We were to do so.

18.Mustaqim: But We pour the truth over falsehood so it repels it and it vanishes, and you will suffer for what you make out.

19.Mustaqim: And to Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, and those near him are not too arrogant to serve Him and do not tire of it.

20.Mustaqim: They glorify night and day without slowing down.

21.Mustaqim: Or do they adopt gods from the earth who resurrect the dead?

22.Mustaqim: If there were gods other than Allah in them (the heavens and the earth), they would have been corrupted, so glorified is Allah, the Lord of the throne, above what they make out.

23.Mustaqim: He is not questioned about what He does, and they are questioned.

24.Mustaqim: Or do they adopt gods besides Him? Say: bring your proof! This is the reminder for those who are with me and was the reminder for those before me, but most of them don´t know the truth and turn away.

25.Mustaqim: And whenever We sent a messenger before you We revealed to him that there is no god but I, so serve Me.

26.Mustaqim: And they say: the Merciful has adopted a son; glorified is He, but they are honoured servants.

27.Mustaqim: They do not precede Him in speech and carry out His command.

28.Mustaqim: He knows what lies before them and behind them and they do not intercede except for whom it is accepted and they are anxious out of fear of Him.

29.Mustaqim: And if any of them says: I am a god besides Allah, We will punish him with hell, this is how We punish the wrongdoers.

30.Mustaqim: Do those who reject (the truth) not see that the heavens and the earth were a continuous canvas, then We separated them and made from water every living thing, do they then not believe?

31.Mustaqim: And We placed stabilisers on earth to support it with and cut paths through them so that you are guided.

32.Mustaqim: And We placed the sky as a protected ceiling whilst they turn away from Our signs.

33.Mustaqim: And He is who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon, each travels in an orbit.

34.Mustaqim: And We did not give eternity to any human before you, so when you die, will they live forever?

35.Mustaqim: Every soul will taste death, and We test them with bad and good as a trial and they return to Us.

36.Mustaqim: And when those who reject (the truth) see you, they only take you as a joke: is this the one who mentions your gods? And they reject the remembrance of the Merciful.

37.Mustaqim: Man was created impatient; I will show you My signs, so do not be in a hurry.

38.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this promise happen if you are truthful?

39.Mustaqim: If those who reject (the truth) knew the time when they cannot keep the fire off their faces nor off their backs and they will not be helped.

40.Mustaqim: But it will reach them suddenly and startle them, so they cannot avert it nor will they be given time.

41.Mustaqim: And messengers before you were made fun of, and those who laughed at them were met with what they made fun of.

42.Mustaqim: Say: who guards you night and day against the Merciful? But they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

43.Mustaqim: Or do they have gods who protect them against Us? They cannot help themselves nor are they assisted by Us.

44.Mustaqim: But We gave enjoyment to these and their fathers until they grew old. Do they not see that we reduce the earth from its ends, so will they be the winners?

45.Mustaqim: Say: I only warn you with the revelation, and the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

46.Mustaqim: And when a hint of the punishment of your Lord touches them, they say, woe to us, we were wrongdoers.

47.Mustaqim: And We set down the scales of justice on the day of resurrection so that no soul will be wronged the least, and if it is the weight of a mustard seed We will bring it out, and We are sufficient in counting.

48.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) the distinction (between right and wrong) and a light and reminder for those who beware (of Allah).

49.Mustaqim: Those who fear their Lord in secret and are anxious about the hour.

50.Mustaqim: And this is a blessed reminder which We have revealed, so do you dislike it?

51.Mustaqim: And We gave Ibrahim (Abraham) his good sense before, and We knew all about him.

52.Mustaqim: When he said to his father and his people: what are these images you are devoted to?

53.Mustaqim: They said: we found our fathers serving them.

54.Mustaqim: He said: you and your fathers were in clear error.

55.Mustaqim: They said: did you bring us the truth or are you messing about?

56.Mustaqim: He said: but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One who originated you, and I am a witness to that.

57.Mustaqim: And by Allah, I will plot against your idols after you have turned your backs.

58.Mustaqim: Then he cut them into pieces except for their chief so that they would return to him.

59.Mustaqim: They said: who did this to our gods, for he is a wrongdoer.

60.Mustaqim: They said: we heard a youth mention them, he is called Ibrahim (Abraham).

61.Mustaqim: They said: then bring him before the people so that they are witnesses.

62.Mustaqim: They said: did you do this to our gods, oh Ibrahim (Abraham)?

63.Mustaqim: He said: but this chief of theirs did it, so ask them if they speak.

64.Mustaqim: Then they turned back to themselves and said: you yourselves are the wrongdoers.

65.Mustaqim: Then they shook their heads; you know that these don´t speak.

66.Mustaqim: He said: do you then serve besides Allah what does not benefit you the least nor help you?

67.Mustaqim: Worthless is what you serve besides Allah, do you not then understand?

68.Mustaqim: They said: burn him and help your gods if you want to act.

69.Mustaqim: We said: oh fire, be coolness and peace for Ibrahim (Abraham).

70.Mustaqim: And they wanted to plot against him, but we made them the losers.

71.Mustaqim: And We rescued him and Lut (Lot) to the land which We have blessed for all the world.

72.Mustaqim: And We gave him Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya´qub (Jacob) in addition and made each of the righteous.

73.Mustaqim: And We made them into leaders who guide by Our command and revealed to them to do good and to keep up prayer and give Zakat, and they served Us.

74.Mustaqim: And Lut (Lot) We gave the ability to judge and knowledge and rescued him from the town which committed obscenities, for they were a bad and sinful people.

75.Mustaqim: And We admitted him into Our mercy, for he is of the righteous.

76.Mustaqim: And Nuh (Noah), when he called Us before and We responded to him and rescued him and his family from the tremendous distress.

77.Mustaqim: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs, for they were a bad people, so We downed them altogether.

78.Mustaqim: And Dawud (David) and Sulayman (Solomon), when they judged about the harvest, when the sheep of the people strayed into it, and We witnessed their judgement.

79.Mustaqim: And We let Sulayman (Solomon) understand it, and each of them We gave the ability to judge and knowledge, and We made the mountains and the birds subservient to glorify with Dawud (David), and this is what We did.

80.Mustaqim: And We taught him the manufacture of armour for you to protect you against your harm, so will you be grateful?

81.Mustaqim: And for Sulayman (Solomon) We made the strong wind travel by his command to the land the surroundings of which We have blessed, and We knew about everything.

82.Mustaqim: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did other work, and We guarded them.

83.Mustaqim: And Ayyub (Job), when he called his Lord: harm has befallen me and You are the most merciful of all.

84.Mustaqim: So We responded to him and removed all harm from him and gave him his family and the like of it in addition as a mercy from Us and a reminder to those who serve.

85.Mustaqim: And Isma´il (Ishmael) and Idris (Enoch) and Dhu-l-Kifl (Ezekiel), each were of the patient.

86.Mustaqim: And We admitted them into Our mercy, for they are of the righteous.

87.Mustaqim: And the one in the fish (Jonah), when he went angrily and thought that We had no control over him, then he called in the dark that there is no god but You, glorified are You, I was of the wrongdoers.

88.Mustaqim: So We responded to him and rescued him from the grief, and this is how we rescue the believers.

89.Mustaqim: And Zakariya (Zacharias), when he called his Lord: my Lord, do not leave me on my own, and you are the best of inheritors.

90.Mustaqim: So We responded to him and gave him Yahya (John) and healed his wife for him, for they strived for good deeds and called Us in hope and in awe and were humble before Us.

91.Mustaqim: And the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her of Our spirit and made her and her son a sign for all the world.

92.Mustaqim: This is your community, a single community, and I am your Lord, so serve Me.

93.Mustaqim: And they divided their affairs amongst them; each will return to Us.

94.Mustaqim: Then whoever does good work and is a believer, his effort will not be rejected and We will write it down.

95.Mustaqim: And it is forbidden for a town which We destroyed that they should come back.

96.Mustaqim: Until Ya´juj and Ma´juj (Gog and Magog) are let loose and appear from everywhere.

97.Mustaqim: And the true promise has come close, then the eyes of those who reject (the truth) will be glazed over: woe to us, we were careless about this, but we were wrongdoers.

98.Mustaqim: You and what you serve besides Allah are the fuel of hell, you will be led to it.

99.Mustaqim: If these were gods, they would not be led to it, and they will all remain in it.

100.Mustaqim: There will be sighing for them in it, yet they will not hear in it.

101.Mustaqim: Those whom We have given good before will be far removed from it.

102.Mustaqim: They will not hear its hissing and will remain in what their souls long for.

103.Mustaqim: The great terror will not worry them and the angels will welcome them: this is the day you were promised.

104.Mustaqim: On the day We roll up the sky like a scroll for writing. As We began the first creation We will bring it back, a promise upon Us, We will do it.

105.Mustaqim: And We previously wrote in the Psalms after the reminder that Our righteous servants will inherit the earth.

106.Mustaqim: In that is a declaration for people who serve.

107.Mustaqim: And We only sent you as a mercy for all the world.

108.Mustaqim: Say: it has been revealed to me that your god is a single god, so will you submit?

109.Mustaqim: Then if they turn away, say: I told you anyway, and I have no idea whether what you have been promised is close or far off.

110.Mustaqim: He knows what is said openly and knows what you hide.

111.Mustaqim: And I have no idea whether it may be a trial for you and a provision for a while.

112.Mustaqim: He said: Lord, judge with the truth! And our Lord is the Merciful, who is to be implored against what you make out.

1.Mustaqim: Oh people, beware of your Lord, for the trembling of the hour is a tremendous thing.

2.Mustaqim: On the day when you see every nursing mother neglect what she nurses and every pregnant mother drop her burden and you see people as drunk when they are not drunk, but the punishment of Allah is severe.

3.Mustaqim: And amongst people is he who argues about Allah without knowledge and follows every defiant devil.

4.Mustaqim: It has been decreed for him that whoever befriends him, he will lead him astray and guide him to the punishment of the fire.

5.Mustaqim: Oh people, if you are in doubt of the resurrection, then (consider that) We created you from soil, then from a sperm, then from an implant, then from a partly shaped piece of flesh in order to make it clear for you, and We retain in the wombs what We please until a fixed date, then We bring you out as a child, then let you reach your full strength, and amongst you is he who dies (early) and amongst you is he who ends up in the most feeble old age, so that he knows nothing after having had knowledge, and you see the earth lifeless, then when We send water onto it, it comes to life and swells and grows of every splendid species.

6.Mustaqim: This is because Allah is the truth, and He revives the dead and He is able to do anything.

7.Mustaqim: And the hour will come without doubt, and Allah will raise those in the graves.

8.Mustaqim: And amongst people is he who argues about Allah without knowledge or guidance or enlightening book.

9.Mustaqim: He turns away in order to lead away from the way of Allah. His is disgrace in this world and on the day of resurrection We make him taste the punishment of burning.

10.Mustaqim: This is for the deeds you have sent ahead and that Allah does not wrong (His) servants.

11.Mustaqim: And amongst people is he who serves Allah borderline, so if good befalls him, he is content with it, and if a trial befalls him, he turns away; he has lost the world and the hereafter - that is the clear loss.

12.Mustaqim: He calls besides Allah on what does neither harm nor benefit him - that is the extensive error.

13.Mustaqim: He calls on whose harm is more likely than his benefit - a bad protector and a bad friend.

14.Mustaqim: Allah enters those who believe and do good work into gardens through which rivers flow, for Allah does what He pleases.

15.Mustaqim: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him (His messenger) in the world and the hereafter, let him find a means to ascend the heaven and try to cut off (the help), then see if his plot removes what enrages him.

16.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed clear signs and that Allah guides whom He pleases.

17.Mustaqim: Those who believe and the Jews, the Sabeans, the Christians, the Zoroastrians and the idolaters, Allah will judge between them on the day of resurrection, for Allah is a witness to everything.

18.Mustaqim: Do you not see that whoever is in the heavens and on earth prostrates to Allah, and the sun and the moon and the stars and the mountains and the trees and the creatures and many of the people? And many deserve the punishment, and whomever Allah humiliates, nobody can honour him, for Allah does what He pleases.

19.Mustaqim: These are the two adversaries who dispute about their Lord, so those who reject (the truth), a garment of fire will be cut for them and boiling water will be poured over their heads.

20.Mustaqim: It melts what is in their bellies and their skins.

21.Mustaqim: And they will have iron chains.

22.Mustaqim: Whenever they want to escape from it due to the distress, they will be returned to it: taste the punishment of burning.

23.Mustaqim: Allah enters those who believe and do good work into gardens through which rivers flow; they are adorned there with bracelets of gold and pearls and their clothing there will be of silk.

24.Mustaqim: And they are guided to good speech and are guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

25.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) and divert from the way of Allah and the sacred mosque which We have placed for people, both the resident and the visitor - whoever wants to incline to wrongdoing there, We make him taste a painful punishment.

26.Mustaqim: And when We provided Ibrahim (Abraham) with the location of the house: do not associate anything with Me and purify My house for those who go around, and those who stand (in prayer) and those who bow in prostration.

27.Mustaqim: And announce to people the pilgrimage, they will come to you on foot and on every conveyance, they will come from every distant direction.

28.Mustaqim: In order to witness benefits for them and remember the name of Allah on known days over the domestic cattle He has provided for them, so eat of it and feed the unfortunate poor.

29.Mustaqim: Then they complete their rituals and fulfil their pledges and go round the ancient house.

30.Mustaqim: This is how it is, and whoever honours the prohibitions of Allah, it is better for him with his Lord, and you are permitted the cattle except that which has been revealed to you, so shun the abomination of idols and shun false speech.

31.Mustaqim: Sincerely devoted to Allah without associating anything with Him, and whoever associates anything with Allah, it is as if he falls out of the sky and the birds snatch him or the wind blows him to a remote place.

32.Mustaqim: This is how it is, and whoever honours the rites of Allah, it is from the awareness of the hearts.

33.Mustaqim: They contain benefits for you until a fixed date, then they are delivered to the ancient house.

34.Mustaqim: And to every community We have given a sacrifice to mention the name of Allah over that which We have provided them with from the domestic cattle, so your Lord is a single god, so submit to Him and give good news to those who are humble.

35.Mustaqim: Those who when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and those who bear patiently with what afflicts them, and those who keep up prayer and spend from what We have provided for them.

36.Mustaqim: And We have made the fattened sacrificial animals signs of worship from Allah for you, you have (much) good in them, so mention the name of Allah over them when they are lined up. Then when their sides fall, eat from them and feed those who are content and those who ask; this is how We made them of service to you so that you would be grateful.

37.Mustaqim: Neither their meat nor their blood reaches Allah, but your awareness reaches Him; this is how We made them of service to you so that you exalt Allah for having guided you, and give good news to those who do good.

38.Mustaqim: For Allah defends the believers, for Allah does not love any faithless rejecter (of the truth).

39.Mustaqim: Permission is given to those who have been fought because they have been wronged, and Allah is able to help them.

40.Mustaqim: Those who were expelled from their homes without right only because they say: our Lord is Allah. And if Allah did not repel some people by others, the monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques where Allah´s name is mentioned a lot would have been destroyed, but Allah helps those who help Him, for Allah is strong and mighty.

41.Mustaqim: Those who when We establish them on earth keep up prayer and give Zakat and command good conduct and forbid wrongdoing, and the outcome of affairs belongs to Allah.

42.Mustaqim: And if they deny you, then the people of Nuh (Noah) and ´Ad and Thamud denied before them.

43.Mustaqim: And the people of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the people of Lut (Lot).

44.Mustaqim: And the inhabitants of Madyan (Midian), and Musa (Moses) was denied, so I gave time to those who rejected (the truth), then I overtook them, and how was My rebuttal!

45.Mustaqim: And how many wrongdoing towns did We destroy, so they are abandoned in ruins, and how many dried up wells and elevated castles?

46.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on the earth with hearts that understand or ears that hear? The eyes do not go blind, but the hearts inside go blind.

47.Mustaqim: And they ask you to hasten the punishment, and Allah does not break His promise. And a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what you count.

48.Mustaqim: And how many wrongdoing towns did I give time, then I overtook them, and to Me is the journey.

49.Mustaqim: Say: oh people, I am a clear warner for you.

50.Mustaqim: So for those who believe and do good work will be forgiveness and generous provision.

51.Mustaqim: And those who strive to undermine Our signs will be the inmates of hell-fire.

52.Mustaqim: And whenever We sent a messenger or prophet before you, the devil interfered with his recitation when he recited, then Allah cancels the devil´s interference, then Allah lays down His signs, and Allah is knowing and wise.

53.Mustaqim: So that Allah makes the interference of the devil a test for those with a disease in their hearts and whose hearts are hardened, and the wrongdoers are far away (from the truth).

54.Mustaqim: And so that those who have been given knowledge know that it is the truth from your Lord, so they believe in it and their hearts are humbled towards it, and Allah guides the believers to a straight path.

55.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) will remain in doubt about it until the hour comes upon them suddenly or the punishment of an endless day reaches them.

56.Mustaqim: The kingdom on that day belongs to Allah, He judges between them, so those who believed and did good work will be in gardens of blessing.

57.Mustaqim: And those who rejected (the truth) and denied Our signs, for those will be a humiliating punishment.

58.Mustaqim: And those who migrated in the way of Allah and were then killed or died, Allah provides them with a good provision, for Allah is the best of providers.

59.Mustaqim: We let them enter from an entrance they are pleased with, and Allah is knowing and gentle.

60.Mustaqim: This is how it is, and whoever inflicts punishment comparable to what had been inflicted on him and is then overcome, Allah will help him, for Allah is lenient, forgiving.

61.Mustaqim: This is because Allah blends the night into the day and blends the day into the night and Allah hears and sees.

62.Mustaqim: This is because Allah is the truth, and whatever they call besides Him is falsehood and Allah is exalted and great.

63.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky, then the earth becomes green, for Allah is kind and informed.

64.Mustaqim: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and Allah is the rich and praiseworthy.

65.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah makes whatever is on earth of service to you, and the ship sails on the sea by His command, and He prevents the sky from falling onto the earth except by His permission, for Allah is lenient and merciful with mankind.

66.Mustaqim: And He is who gave you life, then He lets you die, then He revives you, but man rejects (the truth).

67.Mustaqim: To every community We have given a sacrifice to observe, so let them not challenge you in the matter and call to your Lord, for you are on straight guidance.

68.Mustaqim: And if they dispute with you, say: Allah knows best what you do.

69.Mustaqim: Allah judges between you on the day of resurrection with regard to what you used to differ in.

70.Mustaqim: Don´t you know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and on earth? All that is in a book, for that is easy for Allah.

71.Mustaqim: And they serve besides Allah that which no authority has been sent to them for and which they have no knowledge about, and the wrongdoers have no helper.

72.Mustaqim: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, you notice in the faces of those who reject (the truth) the dislike, they would almost attack those who are reciting Our signs to them. Say: Shall I inform you of worse than that? The fire, Allah has promised it to those who reject (the truth), and it is a bad destination.

73.Mustaqim: Oh people, a likeness has been coined for you, so listen to it: those whom you call besides Allah cannot create a fly even if they combined their efforts to do so, and if the fly takes something off them, they cannot recover it from it; week is the seeker and the one sought.

74.Mustaqim: They do not measure Allah´s true ability, for Allah is strong and mighty.

75.Mustaqim: Allah selects from the angels messengers and from people, for Allah hears and sees.

76.Mustaqim: He knows what lies before them and behind them and to Allah return all things.

77.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, bow down and prostrate and serve your Lord and do good in order to succeed.

78.Mustaqim: And strive in the way of Allah with true effort, He has chosen you and did not place any hardship on you in the religion, the persuasion of your father Ibrahim (Abraham); he called you Muslims (those who submit) before, and in this case the messenger will be a witness against you and you will be witnesses against mankind, so keep up prayer and give Zakat and hold on to Allah, He is your protector, the best protector and the best helper.

1.Mustaqim: Successful are the believers,

2.Mustaqim: Who are humble in their prayers,

3.Mustaqim: And who turn away from idle talk,

4.Mustaqim: And who give Zakat,

5.Mustaqim: And who guard their chastity,

6.Mustaqim: Except with regard to their partners and those in their possession, for then they are not to blame.

7.Mustaqim: Then if anyone desires beyond that, then those exceed the limits.

8.Mustaqim: And who look after their trust and agreements,

9.Mustaqim: And who guard their prayers,

10.Mustaqim: Those are the inheritors,

11.Mustaqim: Who inherit paradise where they will remain.

12.Mustaqim: And We created man from an extract of clay.

13.Mustaqim: Then We place it as sperm in a protective location.

14.Mustaqim: Then We shaped the sperm into an implant and shaped the implant into a piece of flesh and shaped the piece of flesh into bones and covered the bones with meat, then We bring it out as a different creation, so exalted is Allah the best of creators.

15.Mustaqim: Then after that you will die.

16.Mustaqim: Then on the day of resurrection you will be raised.

17.Mustaqim: And We created above you seven passages and We were not careless with the creation.

18.Mustaqim: And We sent water in measure from the sky and let it settle on earth, and We are able to make it disappear.

19.Mustaqim: Then We produce with it gardens of palm trees and grapes in which you have plenty of fruit and from which you eat.

20.Mustaqim: And a tree which emerges from mount Sinai, which grows oil and seasoning for those who eat.

21.Mustaqim: And there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We give you to drink from what is in their bellies and you have plenty of uses in them and you eat of them.

22.Mustaqim: And you are carried on them and on the ship.

23.Mustaqim: And We previously sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, saying: oh my people, serve Allah, you have no god other than Him, do you not beware (of Him)?

24.Mustaqim: Then the leaders of his people who rejected (the truth) said: this is only a human like you who wants to be better than you, and if Allah pleased, He would have sent angels, we never heard of this amongst our forefathers.

25.Mustaqim: He is only a  man who is possessed, so wait with him for a while.

26.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, help me against their denial.

27.Mustaqim: So We revealed to him to construct the ship before Our eyes and with Our revelation, then when Our command comes and the earth bursts open, lead into it a pair of each kind together with your family, except those of them on whom the word has gone before, and do not address Me regarding the wrongdoers, for they will be drowned.

28.Mustaqim: Then when you and those with you have boarded the ship say: praised is Allah who rescued us from the wrongdoing people.

29.Mustaqim: And say: my Lord, grant me a blessed landfall, and You are the best to grant it.

30.Mustaqim: In this are indeed signs, and We did test them as always.

31.Mustaqim: Then We raised another generation after them.

32.Mustaqim: And We sent amongst them a messenger of their own: serve Allah, you have no god other than Him, do you not beware (of Him)?

33.Mustaqim: And the leaders of his people who rejected (the truth) and denied the meeting of the hereafter and whom We had made comfortable in this life said: this is only a human like you who eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

34.Mustaqim: And if you were to obey a human like you, you would be losers.

35.Mustaqim: Does he promise you that when you die and are dust and bones, you will be brought out again?

36.Mustaqim: Most shocking is what you are promised.

37.Mustaqim: There is only this worldly life of ours, we live and we die and we will not be resurrected.

38.Mustaqim: He is only a man who has invented a lie against Allah and we do not believe him.

39.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, help me against their denial.

40.Mustaqim: He said: Soon they will come to regret.

41.Mustaqim: So the roar rightfully overtook them and We scattered them, so away with the wrongdoing people.

42.Mustaqim: Then We raised other generations after them.

43.Mustaqim: No community precedes its fixed term nor do they delay it.

44.Mustaqim: Then We send Our messengers in succession. Each time their messenger came to a community they denied him and We made them follow one another and made them history, so away with people who do not believe.

45.Mustaqim: Then We sent Musa (Moses) and his brother Harun (Aaron) with Our signs and a clear authority.

46.Mustaqim: To Pharaoh and his leaders, but they were arrogant and were proud people.

47.Mustaqim: So they said: are we going to believe two humans like us when their people serve us?

48.Mustaqim: So they denied the two and were of those to be destroyed.

49.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) the book, so that they would be guided.

50.Mustaqim: And We made the son of Maryam (Mary) and his mother a sign and lead them towards a hill with shelter and springs.

51.Mustaqim: Oh messengers, eat from the good things and do good work, I know what you do.

52.Mustaqim: And this your community is a single community, and I am your Lord, so beware of Me.

53.Mustaqim: Then they split their affairs amongst them into doctrines, each party rejoicing in what they have.

54.Mustaqim: So leave them in their misery for a while.

55.Mustaqim: Do they reckon that when We expand wealth and children for them,

56.Mustaqim: We hasten the good for them? But they don´t realise.

57.Mustaqim: Those who are humble out of fear of their Lord,

58.Mustaqim: And those who believe in the signs of their Lord,

59.Mustaqim: And those who do not associate anything with their Lord,

60.Mustaqim: And those who give what they were given and their hearts are fearful that they will return to their Lord,

61.Mustaqim: Those are racing towards the good and they are the first to achieve it.

62.Mustaqim: And We do not burden a soul beyond its capacity, and We have a record which speaks the truth and they will not be wronged.

63.Mustaqim: But their hearts are sealed against it and they have other work which they busy themselves with.

64.Mustaqim: Until when We overtake the affluent ones amongst them with the punishment, then they pray.

65.Mustaqim: Don´t pray today, for you will not be helped.

66.Mustaqim: You previously denied Our signs when they were recited to you and turned away on your heels.

67.Mustaqim: Arrogant with it, talking boldly at night.

68.Mustaqim: Do they not understand speech, or has something come to them which did not come to their forefathers?

69.Mustaqim: Or don´t they know their messenger and dislike him?

70.Mustaqim: Or do they say he is mad? But he brought them the truth, and most of them resent the truth.

71.Mustaqim: And if the truth were to follow their desires the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would be corrupted, but We brought them their reminder and they turn away from their reminder.

72.Mustaqim: Or do you ask them for a contribution, but the contribution of your Lord is better and He is the best of providers.

73.Mustaqim: And you do call them to a straight path.

74.Mustaqim: And those who do not believe in the hereafter deviate from the path.

75.Mustaqim: And if We were to have mercy on them and take away any hardship they face, they would continue to get lost in their rebellion.

76.Mustaqim: And We previously overtook them with the punishment, and they did not give in to their Lord nor humble themselves.

77.Mustaqim: Until when We open for them a door full of severe punishment, then they are left with nothing.

78.Mustaqim: And He is who arranged hearing, and eyesight and hearts for you, little thanks you give.

79.Mustaqim: And He is who spread you out on earth, and to Him will you be gathered.

80.Mustaqim: And He is who gives life and death, and His is the alternation of night and day, so will you not understand?

81.Mustaqim: But they say things similar to what the earliest communities said.

82.Mustaqim: They said: when we have died and are dust and bones, are we going to be raised again?

83.Mustaqim: We and our fathers were promised this before, these are only stories of old.

84.Mustaqim: Say: to whom belongs the earth and whoever is on it, if you know?

85.Mustaqim: They will say: to Allah. Say: so will you not take heed?

86.Mustaqim: Say: who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the great throne?

87.Mustaqim: They will say: (it belongs) to Allah. Say: so will you not beware (of Him)?

88.Mustaqim: Say: in whose hand is the ownership of everything and He gives protection and there is no protection against Him, if you know?

89.Mustaqim: They will say: (it belongs) to Allah. Say: so how are you conceited?

90.Mustaqim: But We brought them the truth, and they deny.

91.Mustaqim: Allah did not adopt a son and there is no other god with Him, otherwise every god would take what he created and they would exalt one above the other; glorified is Allah above what they make out.

92.Mustaqim: The One who knows the unseen and the apparent, so exalted is He above what they associate.

93.Mustaqim: Say: my Lord, if you show me what they have been promised,

94.Mustaqim: Then, my Lord. do not place me amongst the wrongdoing people.

95.Mustaqim: And We are able to show you what We promise them.

96.Mustaqim: Repel bad with what is better, We know best what they make out.

97.Mustaqim: And say: my Lord, I seek refuge in You from the suggestions of the devils.

98.Mustaqim: And I seek refuge in you, my Lord, that they should be present.

99.Mustaqim: Until when death reaches any of them, he says: my Lord, send me back.

100.Mustaqim: So that I do good work in what I left behind; no way, it is only something he says, and behind them is a barrier until the day of resurrection.

101.Mustaqim: Then when the horn is blown, there will be no connection between them on that day and they will not ask each other.

102.Mustaqim: So whose weight is heavy, those will be successful.

103.Mustaqim: And whose weight is light, those will have lost themselves, they will remain in hell.

104.Mustaqim: The fire will burn their faces and they will be eaten away in it.

105.Mustaqim: Were not My signs recited to you but you denied them?

106.Mustaqim: They will say: our Lord. our misfortune has overtaken us and we were people who went astray.

107.Mustaqim: Our Lord, take us out from here, then if we return, we will be wrongdoers.

108.Mustaqim: He will say: Off with you in there and do not talk to Me.

109.Mustaqim: For there was a group of My servants saying: our Lord, we believe, so forgive us and have mercy on us, and You are the best of those who have mercy.

110.Mustaqim: So you ridiculed them until they made you forget to remember Me and you laughed about them.

111.Mustaqim: Today I reward them for having had patience, for they are the winners.

112.Mustaqim: He will say: how many years did you stay on earth?

113.Mustaqim: They will say: we stayed a day or part of a day; ask those who keep count.

114.Mustaqim: He will say: you stayed only a little while if you had known.

115.Mustaqim: Did you then reckon that We created you without purpose and that you would not be brought back to Us?

116.Mustaqim: So exalted is Allah, the true king, there is no god but Him, the Lord of the noble throne.

117.Mustaqim: And whoever calls on another god alongside Allah for whom he has no proof, his reckoning is with his Lord, for those who reject (the truth) do not succeed.

118.Mustaqim: And say: my Lord, forgive and have mercy, and you are the best of those who have mercy.

1.Mustaqim: A Surah which We have revealed and made obligatory and revealed in it clear signs so you pay heed.

2.Mustaqim: The female and the male fornicator, beat each one of them with a hundred beatings and let not pity for both overcome you regarding the religion of Allah if you are believers in the last day, and let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

3.Mustaqim: The male fornicator may not marry except a female fornicator or idolatress, and the female fornicator may not be married except by a male fornicator or idolater, and it is forbidden for the believers.

4.Mustaqim: And those who accuse innocent women and then do not bring four witnesses, beat them with eighty beatings and do not ever accept evidence from them, and those are the sinful.

5.Mustaqim: Except those who repent afterwards and make amends, for Allah is forgiving, merciful.

6.Mustaqim: And those who accuse their partners and have no witnesses but themselves, the evidence of any of them will be to witness four times by Allah that he is truthful.

7.Mustaqim: And a fifth time that the curse of Allah shall be upon him if he is a liar.

8.Mustaqim: And the punishment is averted from her if she witnesses four times by Allah that he is a liar.

9.Mustaqim: And a fifth time that the anger of Allah shall be upon her if he is truthful.

10.Mustaqim: And you depend on Allah´s favour and mercy upon you and that Allah is accepting and wise.

11.Mustaqim: Those who brought the falsehood are a large group amongst you; do not consider it bad for you, it is good for you; for every man amongst them is the sin he has earned, and for the one amongst them who owns the greatest share of it is a severe punishment.

12.Mustaqim: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and women think good within themselves and say: this is a clear falsehood?

13.Mustaqim: Why did they not bring four witnesses for it? So if they did not bring the witnesses, then they are liars before Allah.

14.Mustaqim: And if it were not for the favours and mercy of Allah upon you in this world and the hereafter, a severe punishment would have afflicted you for having spread it.

15.Mustaqim: When your tongues uttered it and your mouths said things of which you had no knowledge and you considered it trivial, but with Allah it is serious.

16.Mustaqim: And why, when you heard it, did you not say: it is not for us to say this, glorified are You, this is a serious slander.

17.Mustaqim: Allah admonishes you not to return to something similar ever if you are believers.

18.Mustaqim: And Allah explains to you His signs, and Allah is knowing and wise.

19.Mustaqim: Those who love indecency to spread amongst the believers, for them is a painful punishment in this world and the hereafter, and Allah knows and you don´t know.

20.Mustaqim: And you depend on Allah´s favour and mercy upon you and that Allah is lenient and merciful.

21.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not follow in the footsteps of the devil; whoever follows in the footsteps of the devil, he commands indecency and wrongdoing, and if it were not for the favour and mercy of Allah upon you, none of you would ever be purified, but Allah purifies whom He pleases, and Allah listens and knows.

22.Mustaqim: And let not the generous and affluent amongst you stop giving to relatives and the poor and the emigrants in the way of Allah - let them be lenient and pardon; don´t you love that Allah forgives you? And Allah is forgiving and merciful.

23.Mustaqim: Those who accuse unaware innocent believing women are cursed in this world and the hereafter and for them is a severe punishment.

24.Mustaqim: On the day their tongues, hands and feet will witness against them as to what they used to do.

25.Mustaqim: On that day Allah repays them their rightful dues and they know that Allah is the clear truth.

26.Mustaqim: Bad women are for bad men and bad men for bad women, and good women are for good men and good men for good women - these are innocent of what they say, theirs is forgiveness and generous provision.

27.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you have asked for permission and greeted their inhabitants, that is better for you, so you pay heed.

28.Mustaqim: And if you do not find anyone there, then do not enter unless permission has been given to you, and if you are told to go back, go back, it is purer for you, and Allah knows what you do.

29.Mustaqim: It is no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses where there is provision for you, and Allah knows what you let on and what you hide.
