30.Mustaqim: Tell the believing men to lower their eyes and guard their chastity, that is purer for them, for Allah is informed of what they get up to.

31.Mustaqim: And tell the believing women to lower their eyes and guard their chastity and not to display their beauty except of what is apparent, and to throw their head coverings over their chests and not to display their beauty except to their husbands or their sons or their husband´s sons or their brothers or their brothers´ sons or their sisters´ sons or their womenfolk or those in their possession or the incapable amongst their male attendants or the children who are not aware of women´s nakedness, and not to stamp their feet to attract attention in spite of hiding their beauty; and repent to Allah altogether, oh you believers, in order to be successful.

32.Mustaqim: And marry those who are single from amongst you and the righteous from amongst your male and female servants; if they are poor, Allah will enrich them from His favours, and Allah is generous and knows.

33.Mustaqim: And let those who cannot find a marriage opportunity abstain until Allah enriches them from His favours. And those who want freedom of those in your possession, set them free if you know of good in them and give them of the wealth of Allah that He gave you, and do not compel your female servants to transgress if they want to be chaste, desiring the offering of this world, and if anyone compels them, then Allah is forgiving and merciful after they have been compelled.

34.Mustaqim: We have revealed to you clear signs and the example of those who went before you and an admonition for those who beware (of Allah).

35.Mustaqim: Allah is the light of the heavens and the earth; the example of His light is that of a niche in which there is a lamp; the lamp is within a glass; the glass is as if it were a bright star set ablaze by a blessed olive tree whose oil is neither from the East nor the West; its oil almost glows without fire having touched it; light upon light; Allah guides to His light whom He pleases, and Allah coins examples for people, and Allah knows everything.

36.Mustaqim: In houses Allah has permitted to be elevated and where His name is remembered, where He is glorified in the mornings and the evenings,

37.Mustaqim: By men whom neither trade nor business distracts from the remembrance of Allah and from keeping up prayer and giving Zakat; they fear a day when the hearts and eyesight will be overturned.

38.Mustaqim: So that Allah rewards them the best of their deeds and increases them from His favour, and Allah provides for whom He pleases without counting.

39.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth), their deeds are like a mirage on empty flat land which the thirsty thinks is water, until when he reaches it he finds nothing and finds Allah present who pays him his account in full, and Allah is swift in counting.

40.Mustaqim: Or like darknesses in the deep sea covered by waves with waves above, above which are clouds, darkness layered on top of each other, if he takes out his hand he can hardly see it, and to whom Allah does not give any light, he has no light.

41.Mustaqim: Do you not see that everyone in the heavens and on earth glorifies Allah, and the birds in flocks? Each know their prayers and glorifications, and Allah knows what they do.

42.Mustaqim: And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the journey.

43.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah makes clouds move, then combines them, then turns them into stacks, then you see the precipitation emerge from within, and He sends it down from the sky from towering clouds containing hailstone and afflicts with it whom He pleases and withholds it from whom He pleases; its flash of lightning almost blinds the eyes.

44.Mustaqim: Allah alternates the night and day, for in that is a lesson for those who see.

45.Mustaqim: And Allah created every creature from water; amongst them are those who crawl on their bellies, and amongst them are those who walk on two legs, and amongst them are those who walk on four. Allah creates what He pleases, for Allah is able to do anything.

46.Mustaqim: We have already revealed clear signs, and Allah guides whom He pleases to a straight path.

47.Mustaqim: And they say: we believe in Allah and the messenger and obey, then a group of them turns away after that, and they are not believers.

48.Mustaqim: And when they are called to Allah and His messenger to judge between them, a group of them are opposed to it.

49.Mustaqim: And if the right is in their favour they come to him voluntarily.

50.Mustaqim: Is there a disease in their hearts or are they in doubt or do they fear that Allah and His messenger would do them injustice? But they are the wrongdoers.

51.Mustaqim: The statement of the believers, whenever they are called to Allah and His messenger to judge between them, is that they say: we listen and we obey, and those are the successful.

52.Mustaqim: And whoever obeys Allah and His messenger and fears Allah and bewares of Him, those are the winners.

53.Mustaqim: And they swear by Allah their utmost oaths that if you commanded them, they would move out; say: don´t swear, (show) appropriate obedience, for Allah knows what you do.

54.Mustaqim: Say: obey Allah and obey the messenger, then if you turn away, then upon him is what he has been tasked with and upon you is what you have been tasked with, and if you obey him you are guided, and the duty of the messenger is only to convey clearly.

55.Mustaqim: Allah has promised the believers who do good work amongst you to make them successors on earth like He made those before you successors and to establish their religion for them, which He is content with for them, and to exchange their fear for hope. They serve Me and do not associate anything with Me. And whoever rejects (the truth) after that, those are the sinful.

56.Mustaqim: And keep up prayer and give Zakat and obey the messenger in order to receive mercy.

57.Mustaqim: Don´t think that those who reject (the truth) will escape on earth. Their abode is the fire, and it is a bad destination.

58.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, let those in your possession and those who of you who have not yet reached puberty ask your permission (to enter) on three occasions: before the prayer at daybreak and when you take off your outer garments during the mid-day heat and after the night prayer; three times of privacy for you. There is no sin for them or you outside those times if they move amongst you and you mingle. This is how Allah explains the signs to you, and Allah is knowing and wise.

59.Mustaqim: And once your children have reached puberty, they should ask permission as those before them did. This is how Allah explains His signs to you, and Allah is knowing and wise.

60.Mustaqim: And the elderly women who have no hope of marriage, it is no sin for them to take off their outer garments without displaying their beauty, and to refrain from it is better for them, and Allah listens and knows.

61.Mustaqim: There is no harm for the blind, nor is there harm for the lame, nor is there harm for the sick nor for yourselves that you eat from your houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of  your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of you sisters or the houses of you paternal uncles or the houses of your maternal uncles or the houses of your paternal aunts or the houses of your maternal aunts or of which you hold the keys or of a friend of yours; there is no sin for you to eat together or apart; so if you enter houses, offer their inhabitants a blessed good greeting from Allah; this is how Allah explains the signs for you to consider.

62.Mustaqim: For the believers are those who believe in Allah and His messenger and when they are gathered with him for some matter they do not leave until they ask his permission; those who ask your permission are the ones who believe in Allah and His messenger, so if they ask for your permission on account of some affair of theirs, then give permission to whom you please from them and ask Allah to forgive them, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.

63.Mustaqim: Do not address the messenger amongst you like you address each other. Allah knows those of you who sneak away secretly, so let those who deviate from His command watch out for a trial or painful punishment to afflict them.

64.Mustaqim: For sure to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth; He knows your situation and on the day they are returned to him He will inform them of what they did, and Allah knows everything.

1.Mustaqim: Exalted is He who revealed the distinction (between truth and falsehood) to His servant for him to be a warner to all the world.

2.Mustaqim: He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and who did not adopt a son nor does He have any partner to share in the kingdom, and He created everything and arranged it in measure.

3.Mustaqim: And they take gods besides Him who do not create anything and are themselves created, and they have no power over harm or benefit for themselves and are not in charge of death, life or the resurrection.

4.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: this is only a falsehood he invented and other people helped him with it; what they have come up with is wrong and dishonest.

5.Mustaqim: And they say: stories of old which he has written down, and they are recited to him in the mornings and evenings.

6.Mustaqim: Say: it has been revealed by Him who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth, for He is forgiving and merciful.

7.Mustaqim: And they say: what is the matter with this messenger that he eats food and walks in the market? Why was not an angel sent to him to be a warner with him?

8.Mustaqim: And why was he not given a treasure or owns a garden to eat from it. And the wrongdoers say: you only follow a deranged man.

9.Mustaqim: See how they coin likenesses for you and go astray and can´t find a way.

10.Mustaqim: Exalted is He who, if He pleases, will give you better than that: gardens through which rivers flow, and will give you castles.

11.Mustaqim: But they deny the hour, and We have promised for one who denies the hour a fire.

12.Mustaqim: When it sees them from afar, they hear its fury and hissing.

13.Mustaqim: And when they are thrown into a tight place there in which they are tied together, then they call for destruction.

14.Mustaqim: Do not call for a single destruction today, but call for many destructions.

15.Mustaqim: Say: is this better or the garden of eternity those who beware (of Allah) have been promised as their reward and destination?

16.Mustaqim: They have there whatever they please, being immortal, a promise your Lord will make good.

17.Mustaqim: And on the day He gathers them and what they serve besides Allah and says: did you lead these servants of Mine astray or did they lose the way?

18.Mustaqim: They will say: glorified are You, it was not befitting for us to take protectors besides You, but You gave them and their fathers provision until they forgot the reminder and were ruined as people.

19.Mustaqim: So they deny what you say and you can neither bring about change nor help, and whoever does wrong amongst you, We make him taste a great punishment.

20.Mustaqim: And whenever We sent messengers before you they ate food and walked in the markets, and We made some of you a test for others as to whether you are patient, and your Lord is watching.

21.Mustaqim: And those who do not look forward to meet Us say: why are not the angels sent down to us or do we see our Lord? They are arrogant in themselves and highly insulting.

22.Mustaqim: On the day they see the angels there will be no good news for the sinful and they will order them to stay put.

23.Mustaqim: And We turn to the work they did and turn it into dispersed dust.

24.Mustaqim: The inhabitants of the garden will be in the best outcome that day and the most beautiful place of rest.

25.Mustaqim: And on the day the sky, with the clouds, will be split open and the angels will come down in a descent;

26.Mustaqim: On that day the true kingdom will belong to the Merciful, and it will be a difficult day for those who rejected (the truth).

27.Mustaqim: And on the day the wrongdoer will bite his hands and say: woe to me, if only I had chosen a way with the messenger.

28.Mustaqim: Woe upon woe to me, if only I did not choose this fellow for a friend.

29.Mustaqim: He lead me astray from the reminder after it came to me, and the devil always abandons man.

30.Mustaqim: And the messenger will say: oh my Lord, my people turned away from this Qur´an.

31.Mustaqim: And likewise We arranged for every prophet an enemy from amongst the sinful, and your Lord is sufficient as a guide and helper.

32.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: why is not the Qur´an revealed to him in one go? In this manner We strengthen your heart and recite it gradually.

33.Mustaqim: And whenever they bring you an example We bring instead the truth and best explanation.

34.Mustaqim: Those who are gathered into hell on their faces, they are worst off and most astray from the way.

35.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) the book and made his brother Harun (Aaron) a deputy with him.

36.Mustaqim: And We said: go both to the people who deny Our signs, then We annihilated them completely.

37.Mustaqim: And the people of Nuh (Noah), when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made them a sign for mankind, and We promised the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

38.Mustaqim: And ´Ad and Thamud and the people around the waterhole (ar-Rass) and many generations between them.

39.Mustaqim: For each of them We coined likenesses, and each of them We destroyed completely.

40.Mustaqim: And they have come across the town on which an evil rain fell - did they not see it? But they did not hope for the resurrection.

41.Mustaqim: And when they see you, they only make fun of you: is this the one whom Allah sent as a messenger?

42.Mustaqim: He almost made us stray from our gods if we did not hold on to them. And soon will they know, when they see the punishment, who is most astray from the way.

43.Mustaqim: Have you considered him who takes as his god his desire? Are you going to protect him?

44.Mustaqim: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are like the cattle; rather they are more astray from the way.

45.Mustaqim: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shadow, and if He pleased He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun a pointer for it.

46.Mustaqim: Then We gradually reduce it towards Us.

47.Mustaqim: And He is who made the night a cover for you and sleep for rest and made the day for rising.

48.Mustaqim: And He is who sent the winds as good news in advance of His mercy, and We send clean water down from the sky.

49.Mustaqim: To revive a dead land with it, and We give it to drink to many animals and people We have created.

50.Mustaqim: And We have circulated it amongst them so that they would take heed, but most people refuse anything but rejection.

51.Mustaqim: And if We pleased, We would have raised a warner in every town.

52.Mustaqim: So do not obey those who reject (the truth) and fight them with it in a major effort.

53.Mustaqim: And He is who mingled the two bodies of water, one sweet and palatable, the other salty and unpalatable, and He placed a barrier and impassable border between them.

54.Mustaqim: And He is who created a human being from water and gave him lineage and relationships, and your Lord is powerful.

55.Mustaqim: And they serve besides Allah what neither benefits nor harms them, and the one who rejects (the truth) is openly rebellious against his Lord.

56.Mustaqim: And We only sent you as a bringer of good news and a warner.

57.Mustaqim: Say: I do not ask you for a reward for it, but whoever pleases may choose a way towards his Lord.

58.Mustaqim: And rely on the One who lives and does not die and glorify His praise, and He is sufficiently informed about the sins of His servants.

59.Mustaqim: The One who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, then He rose onto the throne, the Merciful, so ask anyone informed about Him.

60.Mustaqim: And if they are told to prostrate to the Merciful, they say: who is the Merciful, are we to prostrate to whom you command us to? and it increases their disagreement.

61.Mustaqim: Exalted is He who placed constellations in the sky and placed amongst them a light and a radiant moon.

62.Mustaqim: And He is who made the night and day alternate for anyone who wishes to take heed or give thanks.

63.Mustaqim: And the servants of the Merciful are those who walk gentle on the earth and when the ignorant address them, they say: peace.

64.Mustaqim: And those who spend the night prostrating to their Lord and standing (in prayer).

65.Mustaqim: And those who say: our Lord, avert from us the punishment of hell, for its punishment is unbearable.

66.Mustaqim: It is a bad outcome and abode.

67.Mustaqim: And those who when they spend are neither wasteful nor stingy, and the right balance is between the two.

68.Mustaqim: And those who do not call on any other god alongside Allah and do not kill anyone whom Allah has forbidden except in justice and do not fornicate, and whoever does this commits a crime.

69.Mustaqim: The punishment will be multiplied for him on the day of resurrection and he will remain in it disgraced.

70.Mustaqim: Except for him who repents and believes and does good work, for those Allah replaces their bad deeds with good deeds, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

71.Mustaqim: And whoever repents and does good, he truly repents to Allah.

72.Mustaqim: And those who do not witness falsehood and when they pass by idle talk, they pass by dignified.

73.Mustaqim: And those who when they are reminded of the signs of their Lord do not ignore them deaf and blind.

74.Mustaqim: And those who say: our Lord, make our partners and offspring pleasing to look at and make us leaders for those who beware (of You).

75.Mustaqim: Those will be rewarded a high station on account of their patience and will meet there greetings and peace.

76.Mustaqim: They will remain there, a good outcome and abode.

77.Mustaqim: Say: my Lord would not pay attention to you but for your prayer, yet you denied, so soon the inevitable will happen.

1.Mustaqim: Ta, Sin, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: These are the signs of the clear book.

3.Mustaqim: You almost kill yourself with worry that they are not believers.

4.Mustaqim: If We please, We would send a sign from the sky down to them and their necks would remain humbled by it.

5.Mustaqim: And whenever a new reminder comes to them from the Merciful, they tend to turn away from it.

6.Mustaqim: So they denied, then the news of what they used to make fun of will reach them.

7.Mustaqim: Do they not look at the earth, how many a precious species We grew on it.

8.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

9.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

10.Mustaqim: And when your Lord called Musa (Moses) to go to the wrongdoing people.

11.Mustaqim: The people of Pharaoh, as to why they do not beware (of Allah).

12.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, I fear that they deny me.

13.Mustaqim: And my chest tightens and my tongue does not loosen, so send for Harun (Aaron).

14.Mustaqim: And they hold a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me.

15.Mustaqim: He said: no way, go both with My signs, We are with you listening.

16.Mustaqim: So they both came to Pharaoh and said: we are a messenger from the Lord of all worlds.

17.Mustaqim: That you should send with us the Children of Israel.

18.Mustaqim: He said: did we not look after you amongst us as a child and you stayed amongst us some years of your life?

19.Mustaqim: And you did the deed you did and were of the ungrateful.

20.Mustaqim: He said: I did it when I was astray.

21.Mustaqim: Then I fled from you when I feared you, and my Lord granted me the ability to judge and made me of the messengers.

22.Mustaqim: And is this the favour you hold against me, that you enslaved the Children of Israel?

23.Mustaqim: Pharaoh said: and who is the Lord of all worlds?

24.Mustaqim: He said: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you are certain.

25.Mustaqim: He said to those around him: are you not listening?

26.Mustaqim: He said: your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

27.Mustaqim: He said: your messenger who has been sent to you is possessed.

28.Mustaqim: He said: the Lord of the East and the West and what is between them, if you understand.

29.Mustaqim: He said: if you take a god other than me, I will certainly imprison you.

30.Mustaqim: He said: even if I bring you something clear?

31.Mustaqim: He said: then bring it if you are truthful.

32.Mustaqim: So he threw down his staff and it became a real snake.

33.Mustaqim: And he pulled out his hand and it could be seen as white.

34.Mustaqim: The leaders around him said: this is a knowledgeable magician.

35.Mustaqim: He wants to expel you from your land with his magic, so what do you command?

36.Mustaqim: They said: defer him and his brother and dispatch mobilisers to the cities,

37.Mustaqim: To bring you every knowledgeable magician.

38.Mustaqim: Then the magicians were gathered for an appointment on a specified day.

39.Mustaqim: And the people were told: are you going to gather?

40.Mustaqim: So we can follow the magicians if they are the winners?

41.Mustaqim: And when the magicians came they said to Pharaoh: will we have a reward if we are the winners?

42.Mustaqim: He said: yes, and you will then be of the inner circle.

43.Mustaqim: Musa (Moses) said to them: throw what you can throw.

44.Mustaqim: So they threw their ropes and sticks and said: by the might of Pharaoh, we will be the winners.

45.Mustaqim: Then Musa (Moses) threw his stick, then it took over what they invented.

46.Mustaqim: Then the magicians fell prostrate.

47.Mustaqim: They said: we believe in the Lord of all worlds.

48.Mustaqim: The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

49.Mustaqim: He said: do you believe in him before I have given you permission? For sure he is your chief who taught you magic, so soon you will know: I will cut your hands and feet from opposite sides and will crucify you all.

50.Mustaqim: They said: no harm, we will turn to our Lord.

51.Mustaqim: For we hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first amongst the believers.

52.Mustaqim: And We revealed to Musa (Moses) to travel with My servants, for you will be followed.

53.Mustaqim: Then Pharaoh sent mobilisers to the cities.

54.Mustaqim: These are a small group.

55.Mustaqim: And they have angered us.

56.Mustaqim: And we are force to be reckoned with.

57.Mustaqim: So We drove them out of gardens and springs.

58.Mustaqim: And treasures and honoured dwellings.

59.Mustaqim: This is what happened, and We made the Children of Israel inherit them.

60.Mustaqim: So they pursued them in the morning.

61.Mustaqim: And when the two groups faced each other the companions of Musa (Moses) said, we have been overtaken.

62.Mustaqim: He said: no way, for my Lord is with me, He will guide me.

63.Mustaqim: Then We revealed to Musa (Moses) to strike the sea with your stick, then it parted and each part was like a great mountain.

64.Mustaqim: Then We made the others advance after that.

65.Mustaqim: And We rescued Musa (Moses) and all who were with him.

66.Mustaqim: Then We drowned the others.

67.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

68.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

69.Mustaqim: And recite to them the news about Ibrahim (Abraham).

70.Mustaqim: When he said to his father and his people: what do you serve?

71.Mustaqim: They said: we serve idols and remain devoted to them.

72.Mustaqim: He said: do they hear you when you call?

73.Mustaqim: Or benefit you or do harm?

74.Mustaqim: They said: but we found our fathers do the same.

75.Mustaqim: He said: then look at what you serve;

76.Mustaqim: You and your forefathers:

77.Mustaqim: They are an enemy to me, except for the Lord of all worlds.

78.Mustaqim: The One who created me then guided me.

79.Mustaqim: And the One who feeds me and gives me to drink.

80.Mustaqim: And if I am ill, He heals me.

81.Mustaqim: And the One who makes me die, then brings me to life.

82.Mustaqim: And the One of whom I hope that He forgives me my sins on the day of repayment.

83.Mustaqim: My Lord, grant me the ability to judge and make me join the righteous.

84.Mustaqim: And give me a truthful reputation amongst those to come.

85.Mustaqim: And make me of those who inherit the garden of blessings.

86.Mustaqim: And forgive my father, for he was of those astray.

87.Mustaqim: And do not humiliate me on the day they will be raised.

88.Mustaqim: On the day when neither wealth nor children are of benefit.

89.Mustaqim: Except for him who comes to Allah with a clean heart.

90.Mustaqim: And the garden will be brought near to those who beware (of Allah).

91.Mustaqim: And hell-fire will be presented to the transgressors.

92.Mustaqim: And they will be told: where is what you used to serve?

93.Mustaqim: Besides Allah, are they going to help you or help themselves?

94.Mustaqim: So they and the transgressors will be dumped into it.

95.Mustaqim: And all the soldiers of Iblis (the devil).

96.Mustaqim: They will say, whilst they argue there:

97.Mustaqim: By Allah, we were in clear error.

98.Mustaqim: When we equated you with the Lord of all worlds.

99.Mustaqim: And only the sinful lead us astray.

102.Mustaqim: If only we could return and be of the believers.

103.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

104.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

105.Mustaqim: The people of Nuh (Noah) denied the messengers.

106.Mustaqim: When their brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: will you not beware (of Allah)?

107.Mustaqim: For I am a reliable messenger to you.

108.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

109.Mustaqim: And I do not ask you for a reward for it, for my reward is only with the Lord of all worlds.

110.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

111.Mustaqim: They said: should we believe in you when the down and out follow you?

112.Mustaqim: He said: I have no knowledge of what they used to do.

113.Mustaqim: For their reckoning is upon my Lord, if only you realised.

114.Mustaqim: And I am not going to drive away the believers.

115.Mustaqim: For I am only a clear warner.

116.Mustaqim: They said: if you do not stop, oh Nuh (Noah), you will be stoned.

117.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, my people deny me.

118.Mustaqim: So decide clearly between me and them and rescue me and the believers with me.

119.Mustaqim: So We rescued him and those with him in the loaded ship.

121.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

122.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

124.Mustaqim: When their brother Hud said to them: will you not beware (of Allah)?

125.Mustaqim: For I am a reliable messenger to you.

126.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

127.Mustaqim: And I do not ask you for a reward for it, for my reward is only with the Lord of all worlds.

128.Mustaqim: Do you pointlessly construct a marker on every elevated place?

129.Mustaqim: And adopt fortified buildings as if you lived forever?

130.Mustaqim: And when you strike out you strike out as tyrants?

131.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

132.Mustaqim: And beware of the One who furnished you with what you know.

133.Mustaqim: Furnished you with cattle and children.

135.Mustaqim: For I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.

136.Mustaqim: They said: It is the same for us whether you caution us or do not caution us.

137.Mustaqim: For there is only the first creation.

138.Mustaqim: And we will not be resurrected.

139.Mustaqim: So they denied him and We destroyed them, for in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

140.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

142.Mustaqim: When their brother Salih said to them: will you not beware (of Allah)?

143.Mustaqim: For I am a reliable messenger to you.

144.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

145.Mustaqim: And I do not ask you for a reward for it, for my reward is only with the Lord of all worlds.

146.Mustaqim: Are you going to be left safe here?

148.Mustaqim: And plantations and palm trees with packed date clusters?

149.Mustaqim: And you carve out strong homes from the mountains?

150.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

151.Mustaqim: And do not obey the command of the wasteful.

152.Mustaqim: Those who cause corruption on earth and do not reform.

154.Mustaqim: You are only a human like us, so bring a sign if you are truthful.

155.Mustaqim: He said: this is a she-camel, she will drink and you will drink on a known day.

156.Mustaqim: And do not touch her with harm so that the punishment of a tremendous day overtakes you.

157.Mustaqim: So they bled her to death, then came to regret.

158.Mustaqim: Then the punishment overtook them, for in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

159.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

160.Mustaqim: The people of Lut (Lot) denied the messengers.

161.Mustaqim: When their brother Lut (Lot) said to them: will you not beware (of Allah)?

162.Mustaqim: For I am a reliable messenger to you.

163.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

164.Mustaqim: And I do not ask you for a reward for it, for my reward is only with the Lord of all worlds.

165.Mustaqim: Do you go for males amongst everyone?

166.Mustaqim: And leave the wives your Lord has created for you? But you are outrageous people.

167.Mustaqim: They said: if you do not stop, oh Lut (Lot), you will be expelled.

168.Mustaqim: He said: I am only describing your deeds.

169.Mustaqim: My Lord, rescue me and my family from what they do.

170.Mustaqim: So We rescued him and his family altogether.

171.Mustaqim: Except an old woman who stayed behind.

173.Mustaqim: And We let it rain on them, and it was an evil rain for those who had been warned.

174.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

175.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

176.Mustaqim: And the inhabitants of the woodlands (al-Ayka) denied the messengers.

177.Mustaqim: When Shu´ayb (Jethro) said to them: will you not beware (of Allah)?

178.Mustaqim: For I am a reliable messenger to you.

179.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah and obey me.

180.Mustaqim: And I do not ask you for a reward for it, for my reward is only with the Lord of all worlds.

181.Mustaqim: Give full measure and do not reduce it.

182.Mustaqim: And weigh with a level scale.

183.Mustaqim: And do not withhold from people their belongings and do not spread corruption on earth.

184.Mustaqim: And beware of the One who created you and the earlier creation.

186.Mustaqim: And you are only a human like us, and we consider you a liar.

187.Mustaqim: So drop on us a piece of the sky if you are truthful.

188.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord knows best what you do.

189.Mustaqim: So they denied him, then the punishment of the day of obscuration overtook them, and it was the punishment of a tremendous day.

190.Mustaqim: For in that is a sign, and most of them are not believers.

191.Mustaqim: And your Lord is the mighty and merciful.

192.Mustaqim: And it is a revelation from the Lord of all worlds

193.Mustaqim: He sent with it the trusted Spirit.

194.Mustaqim: Unto your heart, so that you would be of the warners.

196.Mustaqim: And it is in the earlier scriptures.

197.Mustaqim: Is it not a sign for them that the scholars of the Children of Israel know it?

198.Mustaqim: And had We revealed it to some foreigners,

199.Mustaqim: Then he would have read it to them, they would not have believed in it.

200.Mustaqim: This is how We let it pass through the hearts of the sinful.

201.Mustaqim: They do not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

202.Mustaqim: And it reaches them suddenly when they are not aware.

203.Mustaqim: Then they will say: will we be given time?

205.Mustaqim: Have you considered that if We give them provision for some years,

206.Mustaqim: Then what they were promised reaches them,

207.Mustaqim: The provision they were given will not benefit them?

208.Mustaqim: And We never destroyed a town unless there was a warner for it.

209.Mustaqim: A reminder, and We were not oppressors.

210.Mustaqim: And the devils do not descend with it.

211.Mustaqim: And it is not befitting for them, and they are unable to.

212.Mustaqim: For they are cut off from listening.

213.Mustaqim: So do not call on any other god with Allah, then you would be of those to be punished.

215.Mustaqim: And give comfort to the believers who follow you.

216.Mustaqim: And if they disobey you, then say: I am free of what you do.

217.Mustaqim: And rely on the mighty and merciful.

218.Mustaqim: Who sees you when you stand up.

219.Mustaqim: And when you bend amongst the prostrate.

221.Mustaqim: Shall I inform you on whom the devils descend?

222.Mustaqim: They descend on every sinful liar.

223.Mustaqim: They listen out, but most of them are liars.

224.Mustaqim: And the poets, the misguided follow them.

225.Mustaqim: Do you not see that they wander about in every valley,

226.Mustaqim: And that they say what they don´t do.

227.Mustaqim: Except those who believe and do good and remember Allah a lot and defend themselves after having been wronged, and the wrongdoers will soon know which way they will turn.

1.Mustaqim: Ta Sin. These are the signs of the reading (Qur´an) and a clear book.

2.Mustaqim: A guidance and good news for the believers.

3.Mustaqim: Those who keep up prayer and give Zakat and are certain about the hereafter.

4.Mustaqim: Those who do not believe in the hereafter, We make their deeds appeal to them, so they get lost.

5.Mustaqim: For those is the worst punishment and they will be the losers in the hereafter.

6.Mustaqim: And you have received the Qur´an from One wise and knowing.

7.Mustaqim: When Musa (Moses) said to his family: I noticed a fire, I will bring you news from there or will bring you a glowing ember so you can warm yourselves.

8.Mustaqim: Then when he reached it, he was called: blessed is who is in the fire and who surrounds it and glorified is Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

9.Mustaqim: Oh Musa (Moses), I am Allah the mighty and wise.

10.Mustaqim: And throw your stick, then when he saw it move as if it was a snake, he turned away and did not turn around; oh Musa (Moses): do not fear, the messengers have no fear in My presence.

11.Mustaqim: Except he who has done wrong, then replaces bad with good, for I am forgiving and merciful.

12.Mustaqim: And place your hand on your chest, it will come out white without harm amongst seven signs for Pharaoh and his people, for they were sinful people.

13.Mustaqim: And when Our signs reached them clearly visible they said: this is plain magic.

14.Mustaqim: And they disputed them sinfully and arrogantly whilst their own souls acknowledged them, so see what the outcome was like for the corrupters.

15.Mustaqim: And We gave Dawud (David) and Sulayman (Solomon) knowledge and they said: praised is Allah who favoured us over many of His believing servants.

16.Mustaqim: And Sulayman (Solomon) inherited from Dawud (David) and said: oh people, we were taught the speech of birds and have been given of everything, this is indeed a clear favour.

17.Mustaqim: And his soldiers from the Jinn and humans and birds were gathered before Sulayman (Solomon) and arranged into divisions.

18.Mustaqim: Until when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said: oh ants, enter your homes so that Sulayman (Solomon) and his soldiers do not crush you without realising.

19.Mustaqim: Then he smiled amused at her words and said: my Lord, grant me that I am grateful for Your blessing which You have blessed me and my parents with and that I do good work which You will be pleased with and enter me by Your mercy amongst Your righteous servants.

20.Mustaqim: Then he inspected the birds and said: how come I don´t see the hoopoe (Hudhud) or is he absent?

21.Mustaqim: I shall punish him severely or slaughter him unless he brings a clear authority.

22.Mustaqim: But he wasn´t far off and said: I discovered what you had not discovered and brought you from Sheba (Saba´) reliable information.

23.Mustaqim: I found a woman ruling over them who has been given of everything and has a mighty throne.

24.Mustaqim: And I found her people prostrate to the sun instead of Allah, and the devil made their deeds appeal to them so he diverted them from the way and they are not guided.

25.Mustaqim: That they do not prostrate to Allah who brings out what is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you disclose.

26.Mustaqim: Allah, there is no god but Him, the Lord of the mighty throne.

27.Mustaqim: He said: we shall see whether you are truthful or a liar.

28.Mustaqim: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then turn away from them and see what they come back with.

29.Mustaqim: She said: oh leaders, an honourable letter has been delivered to me.

30.Mustaqim: It is from Sulayman (Solomon) and is in the name of Allah, the Owner and Giver of Mercy.

31.Mustaqim: Do not exalt above me and come to me in submission (as Muslims).

32.Mustaqim: She said: oh leaders, advise me in the matter, I do not decide a matter unless you are witnesses.

33.Mustaqim: They said: we possess power and terrifying strength, and the matter is for you to decide, so see what you will command.

34.Mustaqim: She said: when kings enter a town they ruin it and make the most respected of it the most humiliated, and that is what they do.

35.Mustaqim: And I shall sent a gift to them, then wait what the messengers return with.

36.Mustaqim: And when it reached Sulayman (Solomon) he said: are you providing me with wealth when what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you? But you rejoice in your gift.

37.Mustaqim: Return to them, for we will come to them with soldiers they cannot face up to and will expel them humiliated and conquered.

38.Mustaqim: He said: oh leaders, who of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?

39.Mustaqim: A cunning Jinn said: I will bring it to you before you get up from your seat and I am certainly able to do that.

40.Mustaqim: The one who had knowledge of the book said: I will bring it to you in the wink of an eye; then when he saw it positioned near him he said: this is of the favour of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful, and whoever is grateful, he is grateful for his own good, and whoever is ungrateful, my Lord is rich and generous.

41.Mustaqim: He said: we will alter her throne for her to see if she is guided or of those who are not guided.

42.Mustaqim: Then when she came, she was told: is your throne like this? She said: as if it was the one. And we were given knowledge before her and had submitted (as Muslims).

43.Mustaqim: And what she used to serve besides Allah diverted her, for she belonged to people who rejected (the truth).

44.Mustaqim: She was told: enter the palace. Then when she saw it, she thought it was water and bared her legs. He said: it is a palace made of crystal. She said: my Lord, I have wronged myself and submit with Sulayman (Solomon) to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

45.Mustaqim: And to Thamud We sent their brother Salih, (saying) serve Allah, then they became two arguing factions.

46.Mustaqim: He said: oh my people, why do you hasten the bad before the good? Why don´t you ask Allah for forgiveness in order to receive mercy?

47.Mustaqim: They said: we see a bad omen in you and those with you. He said: your bad omen is with Allah, but you are being tried as a people.

48.Mustaqim: And there were nine clans in the town who caused corruption on earth and did not reform.

49.Mustaqim: They said: let´s swear by Allah that we will attack him and his family at night then say to his protector that we did not witness the destruction of his family and that we are truthful.

50.Mustaqim: And they schemed their scheme and We schemed Our scheme, and they did not realise.

51.Mustaqim: So see what the outcome of their scheme was like: We destroyed them and their people altogether.

52.Mustaqim: And these their houses are deserted because of their wrongdoing. In that is a sign for people who know.

53.Mustaqim: And We rescued those who believed and constantly bewared (of Allah).

54.Mustaqim: And Lut (Lot) when he said to his people: do you visibly go for indecency?

55.Mustaqim: Do you come to men with lust instead of women? But you are an ignorant people.

56.Mustaqim: And the reply of his people was merely that they said: expel the family of Lut (Lot) from your town for they are people who want to keep clean.

57.Mustaqim: So We rescued him and his family except his wife whom We decreed to stay behind.

58.Mustaqim: And We let it rain on them, and it was an evil rain for those who had been warned.

59.Mustaqim: Say: Allah is praised and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what you assign as partners?

60.Mustaqim: Or who created the heavens and the earth and sent water for you from the sky, so that We grow with it gardens full of splendour? You could not grow its trees! Is there a god with Allah? But they are people who turn away.

61.Mustaqim: Or who made the earth firm and made rivers run through it and made stabilisers for it and placed a barrier between the two bodies of water? Is there a god with Allah? But most of them don´t know.

62.Mustaqim: Or who responds to the distressed when he calls Him and removes the harm and makes you successors on earth? Is there a god with Allah? Little do you reflect.

63.Mustaqim: Or who guides you in the darkness on land and on sea and who sends the wind as a bringer of good news before His mercy? Is there a god with Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they assign as partners.

64.Mustaqim: Or who originates the creation then repeats it and who provides from you from the sky and the earth? Is there a god with Allah? Say: bring your proof if you are truthful.

65.Mustaqim: Say: nobody in the heavens and the earth knows the unseen except Allah and they have no idea when they will be raised.

66.Mustaqim: But does their knowledge extend to the hereafter? No, they are in doubt of it. No, they are blind to it.

67.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: when we are dust as well as our fathers, are we going to be brought back?

68.Mustaqim: We and our fathers were promised this before, these are only stories of old.

69.Mustaqim: Say: travel on the earth, then see what the outcome was like for the sinful.

70.Mustaqim: And do not worry about them nor be uptight about what they are scheming.

71.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this promise happen if you are truthful?

72.Mustaqim: Say: maybe some of what you hasten will befall you quickly.

73.Mustaqim: And your Lord is full of generosity towards people, but most of them give no thanks.

74.Mustaqim: And your Lord knows what they hide inside and what they disclose.

75.Mustaqim: And there is nothing hidden in the sky or on earth but it is in a clear record.

76.Mustaqim: This Qur´an relates to the Children of Israel most of what they differ in.

77.Mustaqim: And it is a guidance and mercy for the believers.

78.Mustaqim: Your Lord decides between them by His judgement and He is the mighty and knowing.

79.Mustaqim: So rely on Allah, for you are upon the clear truth.

80.Mustaqim: For you cannot make the dead hear and cannot make the deaf hear when they turn away.

81.Mustaqim: And you will not guide the blind away from their error. You can only make those hear who believe in Our signs and submit (as Muslims).

82.Mustaqim: And when the word against them comes to pass We bring out a creature from the earth for them to speak to them that mankind were not sure about Our signs.

83.Mustaqim: And on the day We gather a portion from each community of those who denied Our signs and arrange them into divisions.

84.Mustaqim: Until when they come, He will say: did you deny My signs without grasping them in knowledge, or what did you do?

85.Mustaqim: And the word against them comes to pass on account of their wrongdoing, so they cannot speak.

86.Mustaqim: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest in and the day to see? In that are signs for people who listen.

87.Mustaqim: And on the day the horn is blown, whoever is in the heavens and on earth is terrified except whom Allah pleases, and all come to Him in submission.

88.Mustaqim: And you will see the mountains, which you consider solid, disperse like the clouds. This is the design of Allah who perfected everything, for He knows what you do.

89.Mustaqim: Whoever brings a good deed will have better than it, and they will be safe from the terror of that day.

90.Mustaqim: And whoever brings a bad deed, their faces will be thrown into the fire. Are you being punished except for what you did?

91.Mustaqim: I have only been commanded to serve the Lord of this land which He has made sacred, and everything belongs to Him, and I have been commanded to be the first to submit (as Muslim).

92.Mustaqim: And to recite the Qur´an; so whoever wants to be guided, is guided for his own good, and to whoever goes astray say: I am only a warner.

93.Mustaqim: Say: Allah is praised, He will show you His signs so that you know them, and my Lord is not unaware of what you do.

1.Mustaqim: Ta, Sin, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: These are the signs of the clear book.

3.Mustaqim: We recite to you in truth of the information about Musa (Moses) and Pharaoh for people who believe.

4.Mustaqim: Pharaoh exalted on earth and turned its people into factions, a group of whom he oppressed, slaughtering their sons and sparing their women, for he was of the corrupters.

5.Mustaqim: And We wanted to show favour to those who were oppressed on earth and make them leaders and make them the inheritors.

6.Mustaqim: And to establish them on earth and show Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers from them what they were afraid of.

7.Mustaqim: And We revealed to the mother of Musa (Moses) to suckle him, then when you fear for him, throw him into the river and do not fear nor worry, for We will return him to you and make him of the messengers.

8.Mustaqim: Then the family of Pharaoh picked him up so he would be an enemy and worry for them, for Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were guilty.

9.Mustaqim: And the wife of Pharaoh said: a comfort for my eyes and yours, do not kill him, maybe he will benefit us or we will adopt him as a son, and they did not realise.

10.Mustaqim: And the heart of the mother of Musa (Moses) became empty and she almost disclosed him had We not made her heart firm so that she would be of the believers.

11.Mustaqim: So she said to his sister, go after him, then she saw him from the side-lines whilst they did not realise.

12.Mustaqim: And We had forbidden to him wet-nurses before, so she said: shall I point you to the people of a house who will take care of him for you and be sincere to him?

13.Mustaqim: So We returned him to his mother so that her eyes would be comforted and she would not worry and would know that the promise of Allah is true, but most of them don´t know.

14.Mustaqim: And when he attained his full strength and stature We gave him the ability to judge and knowledge and this is how We reward those who do good.

15.Mustaqim: And he entered the town when its inhabitants were unaware and found there two men fighting, one from his faction and one from his enemies; then the one from his faction asked for his assistance against the one from his enemies, so Musa (Moses) hit him and finished him off. He said: this is from the devil´s work, for he is a clear misleading enemy.

16.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, I have wronged myself, so forgive me. Then He forgave him, for He is forgiving and merciful.

17.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, because you have favoured me I will not support the sinful.

18.Mustaqim: Then he became fearful and apprehensive in the town when the one who had sought his help the day before called out for his help. Musa (Moses) said to him: you are a clear hothead.

19.Mustaqim: Then when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to them both he said: oh Musa (Moses), do you want to kill me like you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant on earth and don´t want to be of the reformers.

20.Mustaqim: And a man came running from the other end of town, saying: oh Musa (Moses), the leaders are commanding to kill you, so leave, I am sincere to you.

21.Mustaqim: So he left from there fearful and apprehensive and said: my Lord, rescue me from the wrongdoing people.

22.Mustaqim: Then when he faced towards Madyan (Midian) he said: maybe my Lord will guide me to the level way.

23.Mustaqim: And when he arrived at the water of Madyan (Midian) he found a community of people there who watered (their flocks) and found besides them two women staying away. He said: what is the matter with you? They said: we will not water (our flock) until the shepherds have gone, and our father is an old man.

24.Mustaqim: So he watered them for them, then turned towards the shade and said: my Lord, I am in need of any good you may send to me.

25.Mustaqim: Then one of them came walking shyly and said: my father calls you to pay you a reward for having watered (our flock) for us. Then when he came and related to him the story he said: do not fear, you have been rescued from the wrongdoing people.

26.Mustaqim: One of them said: oh my father, hire him, for the best you can hire is the strong and trusted.

27.Mustaqim: He said: I want to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you on condition that you work for me for eight seasons, but if you complete ten then that is up to you, and I do not want to overburden you, you will, if Allah pleases, find me of the righteous.

28.Mustaqim: He said: that is between me and you, whichever of the two terms I complete, there shall be no enmity against me, and Allah is a guardian over what we say.

29.Mustaqim: Then when Musa (Moses) had completed the term and travelled with his family, he noticed on the side of the mountain a fire. He said to his family: wait, I noticed a fire, maybe I bring you news from there or a burning log from the fire so you can warm yourselves.

30.Mustaqim: Then when he reached it he was called from the right side of the valley at the blessed location of the tree: oh Musa (Moses), I am Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

31.Mustaqim: And throw your stick, then when he saw it move as if it was a snake, he turned away and did not turn around; oh Musa (Moses): come close and do not fear, for you are safe.

32.Mustaqim: Insert  your hand onto your chest, it will come out white without harm, and bring your arms together (over your chest) to calm your fear. So these are two proofs from your Lord for Pharaoh and his leaders, for they are sinful people.

33.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, I killed someone from them and fear that they will kill me.

34.Mustaqim: And my brother Harun (Aaron) is more eloquent in speech than me, so send him with me in support to confirm me, for I fear that they will deny me.

35.Mustaqim: He said: We will strengthen your support with your brother and give you both authority, so they will not get to you; with Our signs you both and those who follow you will be the winners.

36.Mustaqim: Then when Musa (Moses) came to them with Our clear signs they said: this is only invented magic and we have not heard this from our forefathers.

37.Mustaqim: And Musa (Moses) said: my Lord knows best who comes with the guidance from Him and to whom belongs the final abode, for the wrongdoers do not succeed.

38.Mustaqim: And Pharaoh said: oh leaders, I do not know any other god for you than myself, so supply me, oh Haman, with clay and build me a structure from which to ascend to the god of Musa (Moses), for I consider him a liar.

39.Mustaqim: And he and his soldiers were arrogant on earth without right and thought that they would not return to Us.

40.Mustaqim: So We overtook him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea, then see what the outcome of the wrongdoers was like.

41.Mustaqim: And We made them leaders calling to the fire and on the day of resurrection they will not be helped.

42.Mustaqim: And We had them followed by a curse, and on the day of resurrection they are amongst the despised.

43.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) the book, after having destroyed the earlier generations, as clear evidence for mankind and a guidance and mercy so that they might reflect.

44.Mustaqim: And you were not on the Western side when We decided the matter for Musa (Moses) and you were not of the witnesses.

45.Mustaqim: But We raised generations until the time seemed too long for them; and you did not live amongst the inhabitants of Madyan (Midian) to recite to them Our signs, but We sent others.

46.Mustaqim: And you were not on the side of the mountain when We called, but it is a mercy from your Lord in order for you to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so that they reflect.

47.Mustaqim: So that when an affliction befalls them on account of what they have sent ahead they cannot say: our Lord, why did You not send a messenger to us so we could follow Your signs and be of the believers?

48.Mustaqim: Then when the truth from Us came to them they said: why hasn´t he been given the like of what Musa (Moses) was given? Did they not reject what Musa (Moses) had been given before, saying: two magicians supporting each other, and saying: we reject each of them.

49.Mustaqim: Say: then bring a book from Allah which is more guided than those two, and I will follow it, if you are truthful.

50.Mustaqim: Then if they do not respond to you, then know that they only follow their desires, and who is more astray than he who follows his desire without guidance from Allah, for Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

51.Mustaqim: And We made the word reach them continuously so that they might reflect.

52.Mustaqim: Those to whom We gave the book before believe in it.

53.Mustaqim: And when it is recited to them they say: we believe in it, for it is the truth from our Lord, we submitted (as Muslims) before.

54.Mustaqim: Those will be given their reward twice on account of having had patience and warding off bad with good and spending of what We provided them with.

55.Mustaqim: And if they hear idle talk, they turn away from it and say: our work is for us and your work is for you, peace be with you, we do not seek the ignorant.

56.Mustaqim: For you do not guide whom you love but Allah guides whom He pleases, and He knows best who is guided.

57.Mustaqim: And they say: if we follow the guidance with you we will be forced out from our land. Did We not establish for them a safe sanctuary where fruit of all kinds arrives as provision from Us, but most of them don´t know.

58.Mustaqim: And how many a town have We destroyed which took pride in its living standards, so these are their homes which were not inhabited after them except a little, and We were the inheritors.

59.Mustaqim: And your Lord never destroys a town until he raises in its midst a messenger who recites to them Our signs, and We never destroy towns unless their inhabitants are wrongdoers.

60.Mustaqim: And whatever you have been given is the provision of the life of the world and its adornment, and what is with Allah is better and more lasting, do you not then understand?

61.Mustaqim: Is he whom We have given a good promise and he achieves it like the one whom We have given provision in the life of the world, then on the day of resurrection he is of those summoned?

62.Mustaqim: And on the day He calls them and says: where are My associates whom you claimed?

63.Mustaqim: Those against whom the word comes to pass will say: our Lord, these are the ones whom we lead astray, we lead them astray just as we were astray, we disown them before You, they did not serve us.

64.Mustaqim: And it will be said: call your associates, so they call them but they will not respond to them, and they see the punishment - if only they were guided.

65.Mustaqim: And on the day He calls them, then will say: how did you respond to the messengers?

66.Mustaqim: And they will be blind to any information on that day and will not ask each other.

67.Mustaqim: So whoever repents and believes and does good, he will likely be successful.

68.Mustaqim: And your Lord creates what He pleases and chooses, they do not have a choice, glorified is Allah and exalted above what they associate.

69.Mustaqim: And your Lord knows what they hide inside and what they disclose.

70.Mustaqim: And He is Allah, there is no god but Him, He is praised in this world and the next, and His is the judgement and to Him you will return.

71.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered if Allah made the night continuous for you until the day of resurrection, what god other than Allah would bring you light? Do you not then listen?

72.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered if Allah made the day continuous for you until the day of resurrection, what god other than Allah would bring you a night to rest in? Do you not then see?

73.Mustaqim: And of His mercy He made for you the night and the day so that you rest in it and seek of His favours and so that you are grateful.

74.Mustaqim: And on the day He calls them and says: where are My associates whom you claimed?

75.Mustaqim: And We take a witness from each community, then say: bring your proof, then they know that the truth belongs to Allah and what they used to invent deserts them.

76.Mustaqim: Qarun (Korah) was of the people of Musa (Moses) but transgressed against them, and We gave him treasures whose keys weighed down a strong camel, when his people said to him: do not show off, Allah does not love the show-offs.

77.Mustaqim: And seek with that what Allah has given you the abode of the hereafter and do not forget your share of this world and do good like Allah has done good to you and do not seek corruption on earth, for Allah does not love the corrupters.

78.Mustaqim: He said: I was given it on account of my own knowledge. Did he not know that Allah destroyed generations before him who had greater strength and larger numbers than him? And the sinful will not be questioned about their sins.

79.Mustaqim: So he came out to his people in his adornments. Those who wanted the life of the world said: if only we had like what Qarun (Korah) has been given, for he is full of good fortune.

80.Mustaqim: Those who were given knowledge said: woe to you, the reward of Allah is better for those who believe and do good, and only the patient achieve it.

81.Mustaqim: Then We made the earth collapse with him and his house, and there was no detachment to help him besides Allah and he was not being helped.

82.Mustaqim: And those who wished for his place the day before started saying: wow, Allah expands the provision for whom He pleases of His servants and tightens it, and if Allah had not bestowed favours on us, He would have made (the earth) collapse with us, wow, those who reject (the truth) do not succeed.

83.Mustaqim: This is the abode of the hereafter which We made for those who do not seek arrogance nor corruption on earth, and the outcome is for those who beware (of Allah).

84.Mustaqim: Whoever brings a good deed, he will receive better than it, and whoever brings a bad deed, those who do bad will only be punished for what they did.

85.Mustaqim: The One who prescribed the Qur´an for you will return you to the promised place. Say: my Lord knows best who brings the guidance and who is in clear error.

86.Mustaqim: And you could not hope that the book would be given to you except as a mercy from your Lord, so do not provide support to those who reject (the truth).

87.Mustaqim: And let them not divert you from the signs of Allah after they were revealed to you and call upon your Lord and do not be of the idolaters.

88.Mustaqim: And do not call with Allah on any other god, there is no god but Him, everything will be destroyed except His presence, His is the judgement and to Him you will return.

1.Mustaqim: Alif, Lam, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: Do people think that they will be left alone saying: we believe, and will not be tested?

3.Mustaqim: We tested those before them, so that Allah knows those who are truthful and knows the liars.

4.Mustaqim: Or do those who do bad think that they will precede Us? Bad is how they judge.

5.Mustaqim: Whoever hopes to meet Allah, Allah´s appointed time will come, and He listens and knows.

6.Mustaqim: And whoever makes an effort, makes an effort for his own good, for Allah is independent of all the worlds.

7.Mustaqim: And those who believe and do good work, We cancel their bad deeds and reward them for the best of what they used to do.

8.Mustaqim: And We instructed man to be kind to his parents, and if they argue with you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them. To Me is your return, then I will inform you of what you used to do.

9.Mustaqim: And those who believe and do good work, We will enter them amongst the righteous.

10.Mustaqim: And amongst people is he who says: we believe in Allah, then when he is harmed because of Allah he makes out the trials of people as the punishment of Allah, and if a victory comes from your Lord, he will say: we were with you. Does not Allah know best what everyone keeps inside?

11.Mustaqim: And Allah will surely know those who believe and will surely know those who pretend.

12.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say to the believers: follow our way and we will carry your shortcomings, yet they carry none of their shortcomings, for they are liars.

13.Mustaqim: And they will carry their burdens and other burdens with them, and they will be asked on the day of resurrection about what they used to invent.

14.Mustaqim: And We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, then he stayed amongst them a thousand years minus fifty years, then the floods took them whilst they were wrongdoers.

15.Mustaqim: And We rescued him and his companions in the ship and made it a sign for all the worlds.

16.Mustaqim: And Ibrahim (Abraham), when he said to his people: serve Allah and beware of Him, that is better for you if you knew.

17.Mustaqim: For you serve besides Allah idols and create a falsehood; those whom you serve besides Allah do not control provision for you, so seek provision with Allah and serve Him and thank Him; to Him you will return.

18.Mustaqim: And if you deny, then communities before you already denied, and the duty of the messenger is only to convey clearly.

19.Mustaqim: Do they not see how Allah initiates the creation then repeats it? For that is easy for Allah.

20.Mustaqim: Say: travel on earth and see how He initiated the creation, then Allah brings about the final existence, for Allah is able to do anything.

21.Mustaqim: He punishes whom He pleases and has mercy on whom He pleases, and to Him will you be brought back.

22.Mustaqim: And you will not escape on earth nor the sky, and you have besides Allah no protector nor helper.

23.Mustaqim: And those who reject Our signs and the meeting with Him, those despair of My mercy and for those is a painful punishment.

24.Mustaqim: But the answer of his people was only that they said: kill him or burn him, so Allah rescued him from the fire, for in that are signs for people who believe.

25.Mustaqim: He said: you have between yourselves adopted idols besides Allah in this world whom you love, then on the day of resurrection you will reject each other and curse each other, and your abode is the fire and you will not be helped.

26.Mustaqim: Then Lut (Lot) believed in him and said: I will migrate towards my Lord, for He is the mighty and wise.

27.Mustaqim: And We bestowed on him Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya´qub (Jacob) and placed amongst his descendants the prophethood and the book and gave him his reward in this world, and in the hereafter he is amongst the righteous.

28.Mustaqim: And Lut (Lot) when he said to his people: you bring an indecency no-one in the whole world has preceded you with!

29.Mustaqim: For you come to men and cut off the way and come up with what is objectionable in your meetings, but the answer of his people was only that they said: bring us Allah´s punishment if you are truthful.

30.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, help me against the corrupt people.

31.Mustaqim: And when Our messengers came to Ibrahim (Abraham) with the good news, they said: we will destroy the inhabitants of this town, for its inhabitants are wrongdoers.

32.Mustaqim: He said: but Lut (Lot) is in there. They said: we know best who is in there, we will rescue him and his family except his wife who is of those who stay behind.

33.Mustaqim: And when Our messengers came to Lut (Lot), he was concerned and uneasy about them. They said: do not fear nor worry, for we will rescue you and your family except your wife who is of those who stay behind.

34.Mustaqim: We shall send down on the inhabitants of this town a punishment from the sky because of their excesses.

35.Mustaqim: And We left a clear sign of it for people who understand.

36.Mustaqim: And to Madyan (Midian) (We sent) their brother Shu´ayb (Jethro) who said: oh my people, serve Allah and hope for the last day and do not spread corruption on earth.

37.Mustaqim: But they denied, so the earthquake overtook them and they were found face down in their houses in the morning.

38.Mustaqim: And ´Ad, and Thamud, as is apparent to you from their homes, and the devil made their deeds appeal to them, so he diverted them from the way whilst they were aware of it.

39.Mustaqim: And Qarun (Korah) and Pharaoh and Haman, and Musa (Moses) came to them with clear proofs but they were arrogant on earth but did not get ahead.

40.Mustaqim: And each did We overtake due to his sin, so of them is on whom We sent a storm, and of them is whom the roar overtook, and of them is with whom We made the earth collapse, and of them is whom We drowned, and Allah did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

41.Mustaqim: The likeness of those who adopt protectors besides Allah is that of the spider adopting a dwelling, and the most feeble of dwellings is the dwelling of the spider if they only knew.

42.Mustaqim: Allah knows whatever they call upon besides Him, and He is mighty and wise.

43.Mustaqim: And these are the likenesses We coin for people, and only those with knowledge understand them.

44.Mustaqim: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth, for in that is a sign for the believers.

45.Mustaqim: Recite what has been revealed to you of the book and keep up prayer, for prayer prevents indecency and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater, and Allah knows what you do.

46.Mustaqim: And do not argue with the people of the book except with what is better, except for the wrongdoers amongst them, and say: we believe in that which has been revealed to us and which has been revealed to you, and our Lord and your Lord is one, and we submit to Him (as Muslims).

47.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed to you the book, and the ones to whom we gave the book believe in it, and of those there is who believes in it, and only those who reject (the truth) object to Our signs.

48.Mustaqim: And you did not recite from a book before nor write it with your own hand, otherwise the ignorant would have doubted.

49.Mustaqim: But they are clear signs in the hearts of those who were given knowledge, and only the wrongdoers object to Our signs.

50.Mustaqim: And they say: why were not signs sent down to him from his Lord? Say: the signs are with Allah, and I am only a plain warner.

51.Mustaqim: Is it not sufficient for them that We revealed to you the book which is recited to them, for in that is indeed a mercy and reminder for people who believe.

52.Mustaqim: Say: Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you, He knows what is in the heavens and on earth, and those who believe in falsehood and reject Allah, those are the losers.

53.Mustaqim: And they ask you to hasten the punishment, and if it was not a fixed date, the punishment would have reached them, and it will reach them suddenly when they are not aware.

54.Mustaqim: They ask you to hasten the punishment, and hell surrounds those who reject (the truth).

55.Mustaqim: On the day the punishment covers them from above and from below them and He will say: taste what you were used to do.

56.Mustaqim: Oh My servants who believe, My earth is spacious, so serve Me.

57.Mustaqim: Every soul will taste death, then you will return to Us.

58.Mustaqim: And those who believe and do good, We will arrange chambers for them in the garden (of paradise) through which rivers flow where they will remain; blessed is the reward of those who work.

59.Mustaqim: Those who were patient and relied on their Lord.

60.Mustaqim: And how many a creature does not carry its provision; Allah provides for it and for you, and He listens and knows.

61.Mustaqim: And if you were to ask them who created the heavens and the earth and made the sun and the moon of service, they would say: Allah. So where to are they diverted?

62.Mustaqim: Allah expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, for Allah knows everything.

63.Mustaqim: And if you were to ask them who sent down water from the sky to revive with it the earth after its death, they would say: Allah. Say: Allah is praised. But most of them do not understand.

64.Mustaqim: And this worldly life is only pastime and play, and the abode of the hereafter is the real life, if only they knew.

65.Mustaqim: And when they board the ship they call Allah making their religion sincere for Him, then when We rescue them to land, they associate (others with Him).

66.Mustaqim: So that they reject that which We gave them and in order to enjoy it for a while, but they will soon know.

67.Mustaqim: Do they not see that We have made a safe sanctuary whilst people are attacked all around them? Do they then believe in falsehood and reject the blessings of Allah?

68.Mustaqim: And who is more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah or denies the truth when it reaches him? Is not in hell a home for those who reject (the truth)?

69.Mustaqim: And those who strive for Us, We will guide them Our ways, and Allah is with those who do good.

1.Mustaqim: Alif, Lam, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: The Romans have been defeated.

3.Mustaqim: In the nearside land, and they will after their defeat be victorious.

4.Mustaqim: In a few years. To Allah belongs the matter before and after, and on that day the believers will rejoice.

5.Mustaqim: In the victory of Allah. He gives victory to whom He pleases and He is mighty and merciful.

6.Mustaqim: A promise from Allah. Allah does not break His promise, but most people don´t know.

7.Mustaqim: They know the apparent of the life of this world and are careless of the hereafter.

8.Mustaqim: Do they not reflect about themselves? Allah did not create what is in the heavens and on earth and what is between them except with truth and for a fixed term, but many people reject the meeting with their Lord.

9.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on earth and see what the outcome of those before them was? They were stronger than them in power and made their mark on the earth and cultivated it more than these cultivated it, and their messengers came to them with clear proofs, so Allah did not wrong them but they wronged themselves.

10.Mustaqim: Then the outcome of those who did bad was bad for that they denied the signs of Allah and made fun of them.

11.Mustaqim: Allah initiates the creation, then repeats it, then you will return to Him.

12.Mustaqim: And on the day the hour happens, the sinful will despair.

13.Mustaqim: And they will have no mediator from their associates and will reject their associates.

14.Mustaqim: And on the day the hour happens, on that day they will be separated.

15.Mustaqim: As for those who believed and did good work, they will be settled happily in the garden.

16.Mustaqim: And as for those who rejected (the truth) and denied Our signs and the meeting of the hereafter, those will be presented for punishment.

17.Mustaqim: So glorified is Allah when you enter the night and when you get up in the morning.

18.Mustaqim: And He is praised in the heavens and on earth and in the afternoon and when you reach mid-day.

19.Mustaqim: He brings out the living from the dead and brings out the dead from the living and revives the earth after its death, and likewise you will be brought out.

20.Mustaqim: And of His signs is that He created you from soil, then you spread out as humans.

21.Mustaqim: And of His signs is that he created for you partners from amongst yourselves to find rest in them, and He placed love and mercy between you, for in that are signs for people who reflect.

22.Mustaqim: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the difference in your languages and colours, for in that are signs to those who know.

23.Mustaqim: And of His signs is your sleep at night and in the day and that you seek of His favours, for in that are signs for people who listen.

24.Mustaqim: And of His signs He shows you the lightning in fear and hope and sends down from the sky water, then revives with it the earth after its death, for in that are signs for people who understand.

25.Mustaqim: And of His signs is that the sky and the earth function by His command, then when He calls you with a call from the earth, you will be brought out.

26.Mustaqim: And to Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, everything is submissive to Him.

27.Mustaqim: And He is who initiates the creation, then repeats it, and this is most easy for Him, and His are the most exalted attributes in the heavens and on earth and He is the mighty and wise.

28.Mustaqim: Allah coins a likeness for you of yourselves: do those in your possession share what We have provided you with to the extent that you are equal in it and you fear them as you fear each other? This is how Allah explains the signs for people who understand.

29.Mustaqim: But the wrongdoers follow their own desires without knowledge, so who will guide whom Allah lets go astray? And they have no helpers.

30.Mustaqim: So turn your face to this religion sincerely devoted; the natural disposition upon which Allah created people. There is no changing the creation of Allah. That is the upright religion, but most people do not know.

31.Mustaqim: Repent to Him and beware of Him and keep up prayer and do not be of the idolaters.

32.Mustaqim: Of those who divide their religion and are factions, each party rejoicing in what they have.

33.Mustaqim: And when harm befalls people, they call their Lord, repenting to Him, then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, a group of them associate (others) with Allah.

34.Mustaqim: So that they reject that which We gave them, then enjoy it for a while, you will soon know.

35.Mustaqim: Or did We send an authority to them, someone who tells them of that which they associate?

36.Mustaqim: And when We let people taste mercy, they rejoice in it, and when something bad afflicts them on account of what they have sent ahead, they are depressed.

37.Mustaqim: Do they not see that Allah expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, for in that are signs for people who believe.

38.Mustaqim: So give the relatives their due and the poor and the traveller, that is better for those who want to please Allah, and those are the successful.

39.Mustaqim: And whatever you give in interest to increase the wealth of people, it does not increase with Allah, and whatever you give in Zakat, seeking to please Allah, those are the ones who achieve growth.

40.Mustaqim: Allah is who created you, then provided for you, then lets you die, then revives you. Is there any of your associates who does anything of that? Glorified and exalted is He above what they associate.

41.Mustaqim: Corruption is becoming apparent on land and on sea on account of what people have brought about, so that He makes them taste some of what they have done so that they return.

42.Mustaqim: Say: travel on earth and see what the outcome was like for those before, most of them were idolaters.

43.Mustaqim: So turn your face to the upright religion before a day comes when there is no turning back from Allah. On that day they will be parted.

44.Mustaqim: Who rejected (the truth), his rejection is upon him, and who did good, they paved the way for themselves.

45.Mustaqim: So that Allah rewards those who believe and do good work from His favours, for He does not love those who reject (the truth).

46.Mustaqim: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good news and to let you taste of His mercy and for the ship to sail by His command and for you to seek of His blessings and so that you would be grateful.

47.Mustaqim: And We sent messengers before you to their people and they brought them clear proofs, then We took revenge on those who sinned, and it is a duty upon Us to help the believers.

48.Mustaqim: Allah is who sends the winds, then they promote the clouds, then He spreads them in the sky as He pleases, and He darkens them and you see precipitation emerge from within, then when He afflicts with it whom He pleases of His servants, they rejoice.

49.Mustaqim: When before it was sent down on them they were in despair.

50.Mustaqim: So look at the effects of the mercy of Allah, how He revives the earth after its death, for likewise the dead will be revived, and He is able to do anything.

51.Mustaqim: And if We send a wind and they see it turn yellow, they will still reject (the truth) after that.

52.Mustaqim: For you cannot make the dead hear and cannot make the deaf hear when they turn away.

53.Mustaqim: And you will not guide the blind away from their error. You can only make those hear who believe in Our signs and submit (as Muslims).

54.Mustaqim: Allah is who created you weak, then gave strength after weakness, then gave weakness and grey hair after strength, and He creates what He pleases and He is the knowing and powerful.

55.Mustaqim: And on the day the hour happens, the sinful will swear that they did not stay longer than an hour, this is how they were diverted.

56.Mustaqim: And those who were given knowledge and belief will say: you stayed in accordance with the decree of Allah until the day of resurrection, so this is the day of resurrection, but you did not know.

57.Mustaqim: So on that day their excuses do not benefit the wrongdoers nor will they be allowed redress.

58.Mustaqim: And We have coined in this Qur´an all kinds of likenesses for people, and if you were to bring them a sign, those who reject (the truth) would say: you are only making it up.

59.Mustaqim: This is how Allah imprints on the hearts of those who do not know.

60.Mustaqim: So have patience, for the promise of Allah is true, and let not those who are unsure distract you.

1.Mustaqim: Alif, Lam, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: These are the signs of the wise book.

3.Mustaqim: A guidance and mercy for those who do good.
