4.Mustaqim: Those who keep up prayer and give Zakat and are certain about the hereafter.

5.Mustaqim: They are the ones who follow the guidance from their Lord, and they are the ones who will succeed.

6.Mustaqim: And among people is he who acquires idle talk to divert from the way of Allah without knowledge and makes fun of it; for those is a humiliating punishment.

7.Mustaqim: And when Our signs are recited to him he turns away arrogantly as if he didn´t hear them, as if there was a weight upon his ears, so announce to him a painful punishment.

8.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, for them are gardens of blessing.

9.Mustaqim: They remain there, a true promise of Allah, and He is the mighty and wise.

10.Mustaqim: He created the heavens without supports that you can see and placed stabilisers on earth so it doesn´t shake you up and spread on it all kinds of creatures, and We send water from the sky, then We grow on it every precious species.

11.Mustaqim: This is the creation of Allah, so show me what those besides Him created! But the wrongdoers are in clear error.

12.Mustaqim: And We gave Luqman the wisdom to be grateful to Allah, and whoever is grateful to Allah is grateful to himself, and whoever is ungrateful, Allah is rich and praiseworthy.

13.Mustaqim: And when Luqman said to his son, admonishing him: my dear son, do not associate anything with Allah, for this association is a great wrongdoing.

14.Mustaqim: And We instructed man regarding his parents - his mother carried him with increasing weakness, and his weaning took two years: be grateful to Me and to your parents, to Me is the journey.

15.Mustaqim: And if they argue with you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them, and accompany them in this world with good conduct and follow the way of whoever turns to Me, then your return is to Me and I will inform you of what you did.

16.Mustaqim: Oh my dear son, if there is the weight of a mustard seed inside a rock or in the heavens or on earth, Allah will bring it out, for Allah is kind and informed.

17.Mustaqim: Oh my dear son, keep up prayer and command good conduct and forbid wrongdoing and be patient with what befalls you, for that is one of the firmest things (to do).

18.Mustaqim: And do not brush off people and do not walk carelessly on earth, for Allah does not love an arrogant show-off.

19.Mustaqim: And be measured in your walk and subdue your voice, for the most disliked of voices is the voice of the donkey.

20.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah made subservient to you what is in the heavens and what is on earth and showered upon you His blessings openly and secretly? And among people is who argues about Allah without knowledge or guidance or enlightening book.

21.Mustaqim: And when they are told to follow what Allah has revealed they say: No, we follow what we found our ancestors doing. What if the devil calls them to the punishment of the fire?

22.Mustaqim: And whoever submits his orientation towards Allah and does good, he has held on to a reliable link, and to Allah belongs the outcome of things.

23.Mustaqim: And whoever rejects (the truth), do not worry about his rejection; their return is to Us, then We inform them about what they did, for Allah knows what is kept inside.

24.Mustaqim: We give them provision for a while, then force them towards an unrelenting punishment.

25.Mustaqim: And if you were to ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they would say: Allah. Say: praised is Allah, but most of them don´t know.

26.Mustaqim: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, for Allah is the rich and praiseworthy.

27.Mustaqim: And if all the trees on earth were pens and he would expand the sea with another seven seas (as ink), the words of Allah would not run out, for Allah is mighty and wise.

28.Mustaqim: Your creation and resurrection is only like that of a single soul, for Allah hears and sees.

29.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah blends the night into the day and blends the day into the night and made subservient the sun and the moon, each floats up to a fixed term, and that Allah is informed of what you do?

30.Mustaqim: This is because Allah is the truth, and whatever they call besides Him is falsehood and Allah is exalted and great.

31.Mustaqim: Do you not see that the ship sails on the sea with the blessings of Allah so that He shows you of His signs, for in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

32.Mustaqim: And when the waves cover them like darkness, they call Allah, making their religion sincere for Him, then when He rescues them onto land, there is the wavering among them, and only every faithless rejecter objects to Our signs.

33.Mustaqim: Oh people, beware of your Lord and fear a day when a father cannot save his son nor a son save his father in the least, for the promise of Allah is true, so let not the life of the world mislead you nor let passing provisions mislead you about Allah.

34.Mustaqim: For with Allah is the knowledge of the hour, and He sends down the rain, and He knows what is in the wombs, and no soul has an idea what it will earn the next day, and no soul has an idea on which land it will die, for Allah knows and is informed.

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Mustaqim: Alif, Lam, Mim.

2.Mustaqim: A revelation of the book without doubt from the Lord of all worlds.

3.Mustaqim: Or do they say he has invented it? But it is the truth from your Lord in order for you to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, for them to be guided.

4.Mustaqim: Allah is who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, then He rose onto the throne, you have neither protector nor mediator besides Him, do you not then reflect?

5.Mustaqim: He directs the command from the heaven to the earth, then it ascends to Him within a day whose measure is a thousand years of your counting.

6.Mustaqim: That is the One who knows the unseen and the apparent, the mighty, the merciful.

7.Mustaqim: The One who beautified everything He created and originated the creation of man from clay.

8.Mustaqim: Then He made his descendants from an extract of insignificant fluid.

9.Mustaqim: Then He shaped him and breathed into him of His spirit and gave you hearing and eyesight and hearts, little thanks do you give.

10.Mustaqim: And they say: once we got lost in the earth, are we going to be in a new creation? But they reject the meeting with their Lord.

11.Mustaqim: Say: the angel of death who has been entrusted with you will take you away, then you will return to your Lord.

12.Mustaqim: And if you could see when the sinful will hang their heads low before their Lord: our Lord, look at us and listen to us and send us back, we will do good, for we are certain.

13.Mustaqim: And if We pleased, We would give each soul its own guidance, but the word from Me has come to pass that I will fill hell with the Jinn and humans altogether.

14.Mustaqim: So taste (it) on account of having forgotten the meeting of this day of yours, for We have forgotten you, and taste the punishment of eternity on account of what you did.

15.Mustaqim: Those believe in Our signs who when they are reminded by them fall prostrate and glorify the praise of their Lord and are not arrogant.

16.Mustaqim: They abstain from resting to call their Lord in fear and hope and spend of what We have provided them with.

17.Mustaqim: For no soul knows what comfort is hidden for them as reward for what they used to do.

18.Mustaqim: Is then the believer like the sinful? They are not the same.

19.Mustaqim: As for those who believe and do good work, their accommodation is in gardens as a gift for what they used to do.

20.Mustaqim: And as for those who were sinful, their accommodation is the fire; each time they want to leave it they are returned to it and are told: taste the punishment of the fire that you used to deny.

21.Mustaqim: And We will let them taste the lesser punishment before the greater punishment so that they turn back.

22.Mustaqim: And who is more wrong than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, then turns away from them, for We will take revenge on the sinful.

23.Mustaqim: And We gave the book to Musa (Moses), so have no doubt about the meeting with him, and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.

24.Mustaqim: And We made from them leaders to guide by Our command as they were patient and were certain about Our signs.

25.Mustaqim: For your Lord will judge between them on the day of resurrection regarding what they used to differ in.

26.Mustaqim: Are they not guided by how many generations We destroyed before them in whose homes they walk? In this are signs, will they then not listen?

27.Mustaqim: Do they not see that We give the dry earth water to drink, then We bring out vegetation with it from which their cattle and they themselves eat, so do they not look?

28.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this victory happen if you are truthful?

29.Mustaqim: Say: on the day of victory their belief will not benefit those who rejected (the truth) and they will not be given time.

30.Mustaqim: So turn away from them and wait, for they are waiting.

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, beware of Allah and do not obey those who reject (the truth) and the pretenders, for Allah is knowing and wise.

2.Mustaqim: And follow that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, for Allah is informed of what you do.

3.Mustaqim: And rely on Allah, and Allah is sufficient as a protector.

4.Mustaqim: And Allah did not give any man two hearts inside him, and He did not make the wives whom you divorce by likening them to your mothers your mothers, and He did not make your adopted children your children; that is what you say with your mouths, and Allah tells the truth and He guides the way.

5.Mustaqim: Call them after their fathers, it is more just before Allah, and if you don´t know their fathers, then they are your brothers in religion and your protégés, and there is no sin upon you in your mistakes but in what your hearts intend, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

6.Mustaqim: The prophet is more protective of the believers than they are themselves and his wives are their mothers, and relatives are mutual protectors of each other in the book of Allah, before the believers and the emigrants, but you should treat your protégés well; this is laid down in the book.

7.Mustaqim: And when We took of the prophets their promise and of you and Nuh (Noah), Ibrahim (Abraham), Musa (Moses), ´Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary), and We took a binding promise of them.

8.Mustaqim: So that He will ask the truthful about their truthfulness, and He has promised to those who reject (the truth) a painful punishment.

9.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, remember the blessings of Allah upon you when fighters reached you and We sent against them a wind and fighters you did not see, and Allah sees what you do.

10.Mustaqim: When they came upon you from above and below and when your eyesight faded and you lost heart and had second thoughts about Allah.

11.Mustaqim: There the believers were tested and shaken severely.

12.Mustaqim: And when the pretenders and those with a disease in their hearts said: Allah and His messenger only promised us an illusion.

13.Mustaqim: And when a party from them said: oh inhabitants of Yathrib, you have no foothold so turn back, and a group from them asked the prophet to be excused saying: our houses are unprotected, but they were not unprotected, they only wanted to flee.

14.Mustaqim: And if they had been overrun and been asked into temptation (to rebel), they would have done so and hesitated only little.

15.Mustaqim: And they had previously promised Allah that they would not turn their backs, and the promise to Allah will be asked about.

16.Mustaqim: Say: fleeing will not benefit you when you flee from death or fighting and then only enjoy it a little.

17.Mustaqim: Say: who will protect you against Allah if He wants harm for you or mercy? And they will not find besides Allah any protector or helper.

18.Mustaqim: Allah already knows those of you who cause a hindrance and those who say to their brothers: come, join us, when they rarely show courage themselves.

19.Mustaqim: They are jealous of you, and at times of fear you see them look at you, their eyes turning like one whom death has overtaken; then when the fear passes, they scald you with a harsh tongue, greedy for the benefit. Those do not believe, so Allah has frustrated their efforts, and that is easy for Allah.

20.Mustaqim: They think that the allies had not gone, and if the allies came, they wish they could hide amongst the desert Arabs asking for news about you, and if they were amongst you, they would not fight much.

21.Mustaqim: You have in the messenger of Allah a beautiful example for whoever hopes for Allah and the last day and remembers Allah a lot.

22.Mustaqim: And when the believers saw the allies, they said: this is what Allah and His messenger promised us, and Allah and His messenger were truthful, and it only increases them in belief and submission.

23.Mustaqim: Amongst the believers are men who are true to what they promised Allah, and amongst them is he who has discharged his obligation, and amongst them is he who waits, and they did not change the least.

24.Mustaqim: So that Allah rewards the truthful for their truthfulness and punishes the pretenders if He pleases or turns back to them, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.

25.Mustaqim: And that Allah turns back those who reject (the truth) with their anger, not having gained any benefit, and Allah is sufficient for the believers in battle, and Allah is strong and mighty.

26.Mustaqim: And He made those of the people of the book who had assisted them come down from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts; you killed a group and took a group captive.

27.Mustaqim: And He made you inherit their land and homes and wealth as well as land you never passed before, and Allah is able to do anything.

28.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, say to your wives: if you desire the life of this world and its ornaments, then come, I will give you provision and let you go in a nice way.

29.Mustaqim: And if you desire Allah and His messenger and the abode of the hereafter, then Allah has promised those who do good among you an immense reward.

30.Mustaqim: Oh women of the prophet, whoever of you commits a clear indecency, the punishment will be doubled for her, and that is easy for Allah.

31.Mustaqim: And whoever of you is content with Allah and His messenger and does good, We give her her reward twice and have promised her a dignified provision.

32.Mustaqim: Oh women of the prophet, you are not like any other woman, if you beware (of Allah), then be not too accommodating in speech so that he in whose heart there is a disease takes hope, and speak appropriately.

33.Mustaqim: And remain in your homes and do not show off like in the early days of ignorance and keep up prayer and give Zakat and obey Allah and His messenger. Allah wants to avert any disgrace from you, oh members of the household, and purify you completely.

34.Mustaqim: And remember what is being recited in your homes of the signs of Allah and the wisdom, for Allah is kind and informed.

35.Mustaqim: For men and women who submit (as Muslims), and men and women who believe, and men and women who are humble, and men and women who are truthful, and men and women who are patient, and men and women who are devote, and men and women who are charitable, and men and women who fast, and men and women who guard their chastity, and men and women who remember Allah often, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a tremendous reward.

36.Mustaqim: And it is not befitting for a believing man or woman that, when Allah and His messenger have decided a matter, they should have a choice in the matter; and whoever disobeys Allah and His messenger has clearly gone astray.

37.Mustaqim: And when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and whom you had favoured: hold on to your wife and beware of Allah, and you concealed within you what Allah will disclose and feared people when Allah has more right to be feared; so when Zayd had parted from her, We married her to you so that there would be no sin upon the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons when they have parted from them, and Allah´s command comes to pass.

38.Mustaqim: There is no blame on the prophet in what Allah has prescribed for him, the custom of Allah amongst those who went before, and Allah´s command is a firm decree.

39.Mustaqim: Those who convey the messages of Allah and fear Him and fear nobody except Allah, and Allah is sufficient for keeping count.

40.Mustaqim: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men but the messenger of Allah and the seal of the prophets, and Allah knows all things.

41.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, remember Allah often.

42.Mustaqim: And glorify Him in the mornings and evenings.

43.Mustaqim: He is who sends blessings on you, and so do His angels, in order to bring you out of darkness to the light, and He is merciful with the believers.

44.Mustaqim: Their greeting on the day they meet Him will be peace, and He has promised them a generous reward.

45.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, We have sent you as a witness, bringer of good news and warner.

46.Mustaqim: And one who calls to Allah and a radiant light.

47.Mustaqim: And give good news to the believers that they will have great favours from Allah.

48.Mustaqim: And do not obey those who reject (the truth) and the pretenders and ignore their harm and rely on Allah, and Allah is sufficient as a protector.

49.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, if  you marry believing women and then divorce them before touching them, then there is no waiting period for them to count, so give them provision and release them in a nice way.

50.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, We have made permissible for you your wives whom you have given their dues and those in your possession from the captives Allah has given you, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and maternal aunts who migrated with you, and any believing woman who wants to give herself to the prophet if the prophet wants to marry her - exclusively for you and not the believers, We know what We have prescribed for them regarding their wives and those in their possession - so that there will be no blame on you, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

51.Mustaqim: Let be whom you please and draw close to you whom you please, and if you desire one whom you have set aside, it is no sin for you; that is more likely to give them comfort and not to make them worry and let them be content with what you have given each of them, and Allah knows what is in your hearts, and Allah is knowing and gentle.

52.Mustaqim: No further women are permitted to you after that, nor that you replace them with other wives, even if you like their beauty, except for those in your possession, and Allah watches over everything.

53.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not enter the homes of the prophet except after having been given permission for food and without waiting around for it, but if you have been called, then enter, and once you have eaten, then disperse without socialising in talk, for that troubles the prophet but he is shy of you, yet Allah is not shy of the truth. And if you ask them (his wives) for provision, then ask them from behind a curtain, that is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not befitting for you to trouble the prophet nor to ever marry his wives after him, for that would be a serious matter with Allah.

54.Mustaqim: If you disclose something or hide it, Allah knows everything.

55.Mustaqim: There is no sin upon them regarding their fathers, sons, brothers, brothers´ sons, sisters´ sons nor their womenfolk and those in their possession; and beware of Allah, for Allah is a witness to everything.

56.Mustaqim: Allah and His angels send blessings upon the prophet; oh you believers, send blessings upon him and abundant peace.

57.Mustaqim: Those who insult Allah and the prophet, Allah has cursed them in this world and the hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

58.Mustaqim: And those who insult the believing men and women without cause are guilty of slander and clear sin.

59.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, tell your wives, daughters and the women of the believers to draw their outer garments around them, that makes it more likely for them to be recognised and not molested, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

60.Mustaqim: If the pretenders and those with a disease in their hearts and those who spread rumours in Madinah do not stop, We will let you deal with them, then they will not remain in your neighbourhood for long.

61.Mustaqim: They will be cursed, wherever they are found they will be captured and killed.

62.Mustaqim: The custom of Allah with those who went before, and you will not find a change in the custom of Allah.

63.Mustaqim: People ask you about the hour, say: knowledge of it is with Allah, and how can you tell whether the hour might be near.

64.Mustaqim: Allah has cursed those who reject (the truth) and prepared a flame for them.

65.Mustaqim: They will remain in it forever; they will not find a protector nor helper.

66.Mustaqim: On the day their faces will be flung into the fire they will say: woe to us, we should have obeyed Allah and obeyed the messenger.

67.Mustaqim: And they will say: our Lord, we obeyed our masters and chiefs, so they lead us astray from the path.

68.Mustaqim: Our Lord, give them twice the punishment and curse them with a mighty curse.

69.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not be like those who insulted Musa (Moses), so Allah cleared him of what they said and he was respected before Allah.

70.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, beware of Allah and talk within limits.

71.Mustaqim: He will improve your work and forgive you your sins, and whoever obeys Allah and His messenger has achieved ultimate success.

72.Mustaqim: We presented the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they refused to bear it and were apprehensive about it, and man bore it, for he was transgressing and foolish.

73.Mustaqim: In order for Allah to punish the male and female pretenders and idolaters and for Allah to turn in acceptance to the male and female believers, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

1.Mustaqim: Praised is Allah to whom belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and He is praised in the hereafter and He is wise and informed.

2.Mustaqim: He knows what enters the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the sky and what ascends through it, and He is merciful and forgiving.

3.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: the hour will not come upon us. Say: but no, by my Lord, it will come upon you. He knows the unseen; not the weight of a tiny speck escapes Him in the heavens and on earth, nor what is smaller than that nor what is bigger, but it is in a clear record.

4.Mustaqim: So that He rewards those who believe and do good work, theirs will be forgiveness and generous provision.

5.Mustaqim: And those who strive to obscure Our signs, theirs is a punishment of painful affliction.

6.Mustaqim: And those who were given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth and guides to the path of the mighty and praiseworthy.

7.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: shall we direct you to a man who informs you that once you are totally disintegrated you will be in a new creation.

8.Mustaqim: Has he invented a lie against Allah or is he mad? But those who do not believe in the hereafter are in punishment and extensive error.

9.Mustaqim: Do they not see the sky and earth before and behind them? If We pleased, We could make the earth swallow them up or drop a piece of the sky on them. In that is a sign for every repenting servant.

10.Mustaqim: And We gave Dawud (David) favours from Us: oh mountains, and oh birds, echo his worship; and We made the iron pliable for him.

11.Mustaqim: So that you make (protective) garments and design them well; and do good work, for I see what you do.

12.Mustaqim: And to Sulayman (Solomon) (We subjected) the wind - it took a month to go and a month to return - and We let a spring of brass flow for him, and (subjected) of the Jinn who worked in front of him with the permission of his Lord, and any of them who defies Our command, We make him taste the punishment of the fire.

13.Mustaqim: They make for him whatever he wants of elevated structures, statues, large watering basins and permanent cooking vessels: be grateful, oh family of Dawud (David), and few of My servants are grateful.

14.Mustaqim: Then when We decreed death for him, only the earth worms who ate his staff pointed them to his death, so when it fell apart, it became clear to the Jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in the humiliating punishment.

15.Mustaqim: There was a sign for Saba´ (Sheba) in their homes: gardens both on the right and the left, eat from the provision of your Lord and thank Him, a good land and a forgiving Lord.

16.Mustaqim: But they turned away, so We sent against them a flood from the dam and replaced both their gardens with gardens of bitter food and tamarisk and some cedar trees.

17.Mustaqim: This is how We punished them for having been ungrateful, and do We not only punish the ungrateful?

18.Mustaqim: And We placed between them and the towns We had blessed clearly visible towns and facilitated travel between them: travel there night and day safely.

19.Mustaqim: But they said: our Lord, extend our journeys, and they wronged themselves, so We made them history and scattered them completely; for in this are signs for everyone who is patient and grateful.

20.Mustaqim: And Iblis (the devil) made his thought about them come true and they followed him except a group of the believers.

21.Mustaqim: And he had no authority over them other than that We would tell apart who believes in the hereafter from who is in doubt of it, and your Lord is keeper of everything.

22.Mustaqim: Say: call those whom you claim besides Allah, they do not own the weight of a tiny speck in the heavens nor on earth and they have no share in them and He does not take any support from them.

23.Mustaqim: And intercession does not benefit with Him except for whom permission has been given, until when their hearts have calmed down they say: what did your Lord say? They say: the truth, and He is the exalted and great.

24.Mustaqim: Say: who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? Say: Allah, and we or you are either upon guidance or in clear error.

25.Mustaqim: Say: you will not be asked about what we have committed and we will not be asked about what you do.

26.Mustaqim: Say: our Lord will bring us together, then He will judge between us in truth, and He is the knowing judge.

27.Mustaqim: Say: show me those you have attached to Him as partners, but no, He is Allah the mighty and wise.

28.Mustaqim: And We have only sent you as a bringer of good news and warner to all of mankind, but most people don´t know.

29.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this promise happen if you are truthful?

30.Mustaqim: Say: you have an appointed day which you cannot hold back by an hour nor bring forward.

31.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: we will not believe in this Qur´an nor that which came before it, and if you saw the wrongdoers standing before their Lord, some of them responding to others, with those who were weak saying to those who were arrogant: if it had not been for you we would have been believers.

32.Mustaqim: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were weak: did we prevent you from the guidance after it reached you? But you were sinners.

33.Mustaqim: And those who were weak will say to those who were arrogant: but the (constant) scheming night and day when you commanded us to reject Allah and set up partners for Him. And they start regretting when they see the punishment, and We have placed cuffs around the necks of those who reject (the truth), are they punished for anything other than what they did?

34.Mustaqim: And never have We sent a warner to a town but its affluent people said: we reject what you were sent with.

35.Mustaqim: And they said: we have more wealth and children and we will not be punished.

36.Mustaqim: Say: my Lord expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, but most people don´t know.

37.Mustaqim: And it is not your wealth or children which bring you closer to Us, but whoever believes and does good work, those will be rewarded twice for what they did and will be safe in chambers.

38.Mustaqim: And those who strive to undermine Our signs will be presented for punishment.

39.Mustaqim: Say: my Lord expands the provision for whom of His servants He pleases and tightens it, and whatever you spend, He replaces it, and He is the best provider.

40.Mustaqim: And on the day He gathers them all, He will then say to the angels: did these serve you?

41.Mustaqim: They will say: glorified are You, You are our protector without them, but they served the Jinn, most of them believed in them.

42.Mustaqim: So today they cannot benefit nor harm each other, and We will say to the wrongdoers: taste the punishment of the fire which you used to deny.

43.Mustaqim: And when Our clear signs are recited to them they say: this is only a man who wants to divert you from what your forefathers served. And they say: this is only a falsehood he invented. And those who reject the truth say when it comes to them: this is only plain magic.

44.Mustaqim: And We did not give them a book which they study nor did We send a warner to them before you.

45.Mustaqim: And those before them denied, and they did not even achieve a tenth of what We had given them, so they denied My messenger, and how was My rebuttal!

46.Mustaqim: Say: I only admonish you with one thing: that you stand before Allah together or alone and reflect: there is no madness in your companion, for he is only a warner to you of a pending severe punishment.

47.Mustaqim: Say: I did not ask any reward from you, but it is for you, for my reward is only upon Allah and He is a witness to everything.

48.Mustaqim: Say: my Lord pronounces the truth, He knows the unseen.

49.Mustaqim: Say: the truth has come and falsehood does not bring about or confirm anything.

50.Mustaqim: Say: if I go astray, then I go astray at my own loss, and if I am guided, then due to what my Lord has revealed to me, for He listens and is near.

51.Mustaqim: And if you saw when they are terror-stricken without escape and taken from nearby.

52.Mustaqim: And they say: we believe in it, and to where will they return from afar?

53.Mustaqim: And they rejected it before and made predictions about the unseen from afar.

54.Mustaqim: And they are prevented from what they wanted just like it happened to their kind before, for they were in severe doubt.

1.Mustaqim: Allah is praised, the originator of the heavens and the earth who made the angels messengers with two, three and four wings. He increases in creation what He pleases, for Allah is able to do anything.

2.Mustaqim: When Allah opens up mercy for people, nobody can withhold it, and when He withholds it, nobody after Him can send it, and He is mighty and wise.

3.Mustaqim: Oh people, remember the blessings of Allah upon you. Is there a creator other than Allah who provides for you from the sky and the earth? There is no god but Him, so where to are you diverted?

4.Mustaqim: And if they deny you, then messengers before you were previously denied, and to Allah return all things.

5.Mustaqim: Oh people, Allah´s promise is true, so let not the life of the world mislead you and let not passing provisions mislead you about Allah.

6.Mustaqim: For the devil is an enemy to you, so treat him as an enemy, for he calls his party to be amongst the inmates of the fire.

7.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do good work will have forgiveness and a great reward.

8.Mustaqim: So what about him whose bad work appeals to him and he regards it as good? For Allah lets go astray whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases. So do not trouble yourself about them, for Allah knows what they get up to.

9.Mustaqim: And  Allah is who sends the winds, then they promote the clouds, then We direct them to a dead land and revive the earth with it after its death; like that will be the resurrection.

10.Mustaqim: Whoever seeks strength, all strengths belongs to Allah, He supports the good word and elevates the righteous deed. And those who scheme bad deeds, for them is a severe punishment and their scheme is ruined.

11.Mustaqim: And Allah created you from soil, then from a sperm, then made you into pairs; and no female carries nor gives birth but with His knowledge, and nobody grows old or has his age reduced but it is in a record, for that is easy for Allah.

12.Mustaqim: And the two bodies of water are not the same: this one is sweet and palatable and can be drunk, and this is salty and unpalatable. And of each you eat fresh meat and extract jewellery which you wear. And you see the ship cut through them so that you seek of His bounty and that you would be grateful.

13.Mustaqim: He blends the night into the day and blends the day into the night and made subservient the sun and the moon, each floats for a fixed term. That is Allah your Lord, His is the kingdom, and those you call besides Him do not own even the skin on a date stone.

14.Mustaqim: When you call them, they do not hear your call, and if they heard it, they would not respond to you, and on the day of resurrection they will reject your idolatry, and only one who is informed can give you information.

15.Mustaqim: Oh people, you are the poor in the sight of Allah, and Allah is rich and praiseworthy.

16.Mustaqim: If He pleases, He can remove you and bring a new creation.

17.Mustaqim: And that is not difficult for Allah.

18.Mustaqim: And no-one burdened will carry another´s burden, and if someone weighed down asks for it to be lifted, nothing of it will be lifted, not even by a relative; for you warn only those who fear their Lord in secret and keep up prayer, and whoever purifies himself, purifies himself for his own good, and to Allah is the journey.

19.Mustaqim: And the blind and the seeing are not the same.

20.Mustaqim: Nor the darkness and the light.

21.Mustaqim: Nor the shade and the full heat.

22.Mustaqim: Nor are the living and the dead the same, for Allah makes whom He pleases listen, and you cannot make those in the graves listen.

23.Mustaqim: For you are only a warner.

24.Mustaqim: For We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good news and a warner, and there has not been a community without a warner amongst them.

25.Mustaqim: And if they deny you, then those before them already denied; their messengers came to them with clear proofs and with the scriptures and with the enlightening book.

26.Mustaqim: Then I overtook those who rejected (the truth), and how was My rebuttal!

27.Mustaqim: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky, then We make fruit of different colours grow with it. And of the mountains there are white and red streaks, of different colours, and raven black.

28.Mustaqim: And of the people and the animals and the cattle there are also different colours. Only those with knowledge amongst His servants fear Allah, for Allah is mighty and forgiving.

29.Mustaqim: Those who recite the book of Allah and keep up prayer and spend of what We have provided them with secretly and openly hope for a trade which does not diminish.

30.Mustaqim: So that Allah will repay them their reward and give them increase from His bounty, for He forgives and appreciates.

31.Mustaqim: And what We have revealed to you of the book is the truth, confirming what came before, for Allah is informed of and sees His servants.

32.Mustaqim: Then We gave the book as an inheritance to those of Our servants We chose, but amongst them is he who wrongs himself, and amongst them is he who is half-hearted, and amongst them is he who moves forward with good deeds by the permission of Allah - that is the great blessing.

33.Mustaqim: The gardens of Eden which they will enter, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing there will be of silk.

34.Mustaqim: And they will say: praised is Allah who took the worry from us, for our Lord forgives and appreciates.

35.Mustaqim: Who permitted us the lasting abode by His blessing, no hardship afflicts us there and no exhaustion afflicts us there.

36.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth), theirs is the fire of hell, it will not be terminated for them so that they die, and its punishment will not be lightened for them - this is how We reward every rejecter (of the truth).

37.Mustaqim: And they will scream there: our Lord, take us out, we will do good work other than what we used to do. Did We not give you enough life to reflect, should anybody have wanted to, and the warner came to you? So taste, for there is no helper for the wrongdoers.

38.Mustaqim: For Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth, for He knows what is kept inside.

39.Mustaqim: He is who made you successors on earth, so whoever rejects (the truth), his rejection is upon himself, and their rejection only increases those who reject in being detestable before their Lord, and their rejection only increases those who reject in loss.

40.Mustaqim: Say: Look at your associates whom you call besides Allah; show me what they have created of the earth, or do they have a share in the heavens, or have We given them a book and they follow evidence from it? But the wrongdoers only promise each other an illusion.

41.Mustaqim: Allah prevents the heavens and the earth from disintegrating, and if they disintegrated, nobody after Him could stop them, for He is gentle and forgiving.

42.Mustaqim: And they swear by Allah their utmost oaths that if a warner came to them they would be better guided than any other community, then when a warner comes to them, it only increases their disagreement.

43.Mustaqim: Arrogant on earth and scheming evil, and evil scheming only overtakes its owners; so do they wait but for the example of the earliest communities? For you will not find in the custom of Allah any change, and you will not find in the custom of Allah any alteration.

44.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on earth and see what the outcome was like for those before them, and they were stronger than them in power? And nothing escapes Allah in the heavens nor on earth, for He is knowing and able.

45.Mustaqim: And if Allah held people to account for what they committed (on earth), He would not leave a single creature on its back, but He gives them time until a fixed date, then when their date comes, then Allah did watch His servants.

1.Mustaqim: Ya Sin.

2.Mustaqim: By the wise Qur´an.

3.Mustaqim: You are one of the messengers.

4.Mustaqim: On a straight path.

5.Mustaqim: A revelation from the mighty and merciful.

6.Mustaqim: To warn people whose fathers had not been warned and they were careless.

7.Mustaqim: The word has already come to pass against most of them, so they don´t believe.

8.Mustaqim: For We have placed cuffs around their necks and they reach up to their chins so they are stiffened.

9.Mustaqim: And We placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them and sealed them in, so they don´t see.

10.Mustaqim: It makes no difference to them whether you warn them or warn them not, they will not believe.

11.Mustaqim: For you warn only who follows the reminder and fears the Merciful in secret, so give him good news of forgiveness and a generous reward.

12.Mustaqim: For We revive the dead and record what they have sent ahead and their traces, and We list everything in a clear ledger.

13.Mustaqim: And coin for them the likeness of the inhabitants of the town when the messengers came to it.

14.Mustaqim: When We sent two to them but they denied them, so We added a third, and they said: we have been sent to you.

15.Mustaqim: They said, you are only humans like us, and the Merciful has not sent anything, for you are only lying.

16.Mustaqim: They said: our Lord knows that we were indeed sent to you.

17.Mustaqim: And our duty is only to convey clearly.

18.Mustaqim: They said: we see a bad omen in you, if you do not stop we will stone you and a painful punishment from us will afflict you.

19.Mustaqim: They said: your bad omen is with you once you have been reminded, but you are wasteful people.

20.Mustaqim: And a man came running from the far end of the town saying: oh my people, follow the messengers.

21.Mustaqim: Follow those who do not ask you for a reward and are guided.

22.Mustaqim: And how should I not serve the One who originated me and you return to Him?

23.Mustaqim: Should I take gods besides Him? If the Merciful wants harm for me, their intercession does not benefit me the least and they don´t save me.

24.Mustaqim: I would then be in clear error.

25.Mustaqim: I surely believe in your Lord, so listen to me.

26.Mustaqim: He was told: enter the garden (of paradise); he said: if only my people knew.

27.Mustaqim: How my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honoured.

28.Mustaqim: And We did not send soldiers from the sky against his people after him, and We never send them.

29.Mustaqim: For it was only a single scream and they were extinct.

30.Mustaqim: What loss for My servants: never does a messenger reach them but they make fun of him.

31.Mustaqim: Do they not see how many towns We destroyed before them and that they do not return to them?

32.Mustaqim: And that they will altogether be presented before Us?

33.Mustaqim: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We revive it and grow from it seed crops from which they eat.

34.Mustaqim: And We place gardens of palm trees and grapes on it and make springs gush out from it.

35.Mustaqim: So that they eat from its fruit whilst they did not produce it themselves. Will they not be grateful?

36.Mustaqim: Glorified is He who created all pairs of that which the earth grows and of themselves and of what they do not (yet) know.

37.Mustaqim: And a sign for them is the night. We remove the day from it and they are in darkness.

38.Mustaqim: And the sun travels to its destination, that is the arrangement of the mighty and knowing.

39.Mustaqim: And for the moon We have arranged phases until it returns like a withered palm leaf.

40.Mustaqim: It is not befitting for the sun to overtake the moon nor for the night to precede the day, and each travels in an orbit.

41.Mustaqim: And a sign for them is that We carried their descendants on the laden ship.

42.Mustaqim: And created something similar for them which they board.

43.Mustaqim: And if We please, We drown them, and there will be no one to call for help and they will not be saved.

44.Mustaqim: Except by a mercy from Us and as a provision for a while.

45.Mustaqim: And when they are told: beware of what is ahead of you and what is behind you so that you find mercy;

46.Mustaqim: And whenever one of the signs of their Lord comes to them, they tend to turn away from it.

47.Mustaqim: And when they are told: spend of what Allah has provided you with, those who reject (the truth) say to those who believe: should we feed whom Allah would have fed if He pleased? You are surely in clear error.

48.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this promise happen if you are truthful?

49.Mustaqim: They are only waiting for a single scream to overtake them, yet they argue.

50.Mustaqim: Then they cannot raise a warning nor return to their families.

51.Mustaqim: And the horn will be blown and they will stream to their Lord from the graves.

52.Mustaqim: They will say: woe to us, who has dispatched us from our resting place? This is what the Merciful did promise and the messengers were truthful.

53.Mustaqim: For it was only a single scream and they all are presented before Us.

54.Mustaqim: Then today no soul will be wronged the least and you will only be rewarded for what you did.

55.Mustaqim: The inhabitants of the garden will be happily busy today.

56.Mustaqim: They and their partners will be reclining on couches in the shade.

57.Mustaqim: They will have fruit there and have whatever they ask for.

58.Mustaqim: Peace offered by a merciful Lord.

59.Mustaqim: And keep away today oh sinners.

60.Mustaqim: Did I not take your promise, oh children of Adam, not to serve the devil, for he is a clear enemy to you?

61.Mustaqim: And to serve Me, that is a straight path?

62.Mustaqim: And he had already led astray a large group of you, so did you not understand?

63.Mustaqim: This is hell which you were promised.

64.Mustaqim: Enter it today on account of having rejected (the truth).

65.Mustaqim: Today We seal their mouths, and their hands will talk to Us and their feet will give evidence of what they used to commit.

66.Mustaqim: And if We pleased We would have obliterated their eyesight, so they search for a path but how can they see?

67.Mustaqim: And if We pleased We would have frozen them on the spot, so they could neither go forward nor back.

68.Mustaqim: And whomever We give long life, We reverse his development, so do they not understand?

69.Mustaqim: And We did not teach him poetry, nor would it befit him, for it is only a reminder and a clear reading (Qur´an).

70.Mustaqim: To warn whoever is alive and so that the word comes to pass against those who reject (the truth).

71.Mustaqim: Do they not consider that We created for them from Our handiwork cattle, so they own it?

72.Mustaqim: And We made them submissive to them, and they are carried by them and they eat from them.

73.Mustaqim: And they have benefits and drink from the, so are they not grateful?

74.Mustaqim: And they adopt gods besides Allah so they would help them.

75.Mustaqim: They cannot help them but they are ever ready to defend them.

76.Mustaqim: So do not worry about what they say, for We know what they conceal and what they disclose.

77.Mustaqim: Does man not see that We created him from a sperm, then he argues openly.

78.Mustaqim: And he coins a likeness for Us and forgets his creation; he says: who will revive the bones when they decayed?

79.Mustaqim: Say: the One who brought them into existence the first time will revive them, and He knows all creation.

80.Mustaqim: The One who gave you fire from a green tree, so that you kindle with it.

81.Mustaqim: Is not the One who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? For sure, He is the knowing creator.

82.Mustaqim: For His command whenever He wants something is to say to it: Be, then it is.

83.Mustaqim: So glorified is the One in whose hand rests the kingdom of everything and to whom you will return.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Mustaqim: By those lined up in rows.

2.Mustaqim: And those holding back.

3.Mustaqim: And those reciting the reminder.

4.Mustaqim: Your god is indeed one.

5.Mustaqim: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them and the Lord of the sunrises.

6.Mustaqim: We have adorned the heaven of this world with the adornment of stars.

7.Mustaqim: And a protection against every rebellious devil.

8.Mustaqim: They cannot listen to the highest counsel and are pelted from every side.

9.Mustaqim: Chased away, and theirs is a lasting punishment.

10.Mustaqim: Except for one who tries to do so by stealth, then a bright shooting star pursues him.

11.Mustaqim: So ask them, are they stronger in creation or whom else We created, for We created them from sticky clay.

12.Mustaqim: Yet you are amazed and they make fun.

13.Mustaqim: And when they are reminded they do not remember.

14.Mustaqim: And when they see a sign they belittle it.

15.Mustaqim: And say: this is only plain magic.

16.Mustaqim: When we have died and are dust and bones, are we going to be raised again?

17.Mustaqim: Or our forefathers?

18.Mustaqim: Say: yes, and you will be submissive.

19.Mustaqim: For it will be a single shout and they will see.

20.Mustaqim: And they will say: woe to us, this is the day of repayment.

21.Mustaqim: This is the day of division which you used to deny.

22.Mustaqim: Gather the wrongdoers and their partners and all that they served,

23.Mustaqim: Besides Allah, and guide them to the path of hell-fire.

24.Mustaqim: And arrest them, for they will be questioned.

25.Mustaqim: What is the matter with you that you don´t help each other?

26.Mustaqim: But today they have surrendered.

27.Mustaqim: And some of them approach others, asking each other,

28.Mustaqim: Saying: you came to us (claiming to be) from the right.

29.Mustaqim: They say: but you were not believers.

30.Mustaqim: And we had no authority over you, but you were transgressing people.

31.Mustaqim: So the word of our Lord came to pass for us that we had to taste it.

32.Mustaqim: And we led you astray for we were astray.

33.Mustaqim: So today they will share in the punishment.

34.Mustaqim: For this is how We deal with the sinners.

35.Mustaqim: When they are told that there is no god but Allah they are arrogant.

36.Mustaqim: And they say: are we going to abandon our gods for a possessed poet?

37.Mustaqim: But he brought the truth and the messengers were right.

38.Mustaqim: You will taste the painful punishment.

39.Mustaqim: And you will only be punished for what you did.

40.Mustaqim: Except the sincere servants of Allah.

41.Mustaqim: For them is a known provision.

42.Mustaqim: Fruit, and they will be honoured.

43.Mustaqim: In gardens of blessings.

44.Mustaqim: They will face each other happily.

45.Mustaqim: They will be waited upon with a cup of flowing beverage.

46.Mustaqim: White (in colour), delicious to drink.

47.Mustaqim: With no harmful effect in it nor will they be drained by it.

48.Mustaqim: And with them will be exclusive women of rare beauty.

49.Mustaqim: As if they were hidden white pearls.

50.Mustaqim: Then some of them approach others, asking each other.

51.Mustaqim: A speaker amongst them says: I had a friend.

52.Mustaqim: Who said: are you confirming the truth of this?

53.Mustaqim: That when we have died and are dust and bones, are we going to be judged?

54.Mustaqim: He says: do you want to take a look?

55.Mustaqim: Then he looks and sees him in the midst of hell-fire.

56.Mustaqim: He says: by Allah, he almost ruined me.

57.Mustaqim: And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I would have been called to account.

58.Mustaqim: So we will not die?

59.Mustaqim: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished.

60.Mustaqim: For this is the ultimate success.

61.Mustaqim: For the like of this should everybody work.

62.Mustaqim: Is this a better reward or the tree of Zaqqum?

63.Mustaqim: For We made it a trial for the wrongdoers.

64.Mustaqim: It is a tree which grows from the base of hell-fire.

65.Mustaqim: Its fruit is like the heads of devils.

66.Mustaqim: Then they will be eating from it and filling their stomachs with it.

67.Mustaqim: Then they will have a cocktail of boiling water on top of it.

68.Mustaqim: Then they will be returned to hell-fire.

69.Mustaqim: For they found their fathers astray.

70.Mustaqim: Then they eagerly followed into their footsteps.

71.Mustaqim: And most of the earliest communities before them went astray.

72.Mustaqim: And We did send warners amongst them.

73.Mustaqim: So see what the outcome of those warned was like.

74.Mustaqim: Except the sincere servants of Allah.

75.Mustaqim: And We previously called Nuh (Noah), and he responded well.

76.Mustaqim: And We rescued him and his family from the tremendous distress.

77.Mustaqim: And We made his descendants the survivors.

78.Mustaqim: And We left him to be remembered by those afterwards.

79.Mustaqim: Peace be with Nuh (Noah) in all the worlds.

80.Mustaqim: For this is how We reward those who do good.

81.Mustaqim: For he is of Our believing servants.

82.Mustaqim: Then We drowned the others.

83.Mustaqim: And of his faction is Ibrahim (Abraham).

84.Mustaqim: When he came to his Lord with a clean heart.

85.Mustaqim: When he said to his father and his people: what do you serve?

86.Mustaqim: Do you want invented gods besides Allah?

87.Mustaqim: So what do you think of the Lord of all worlds?

88.Mustaqim: Then he took a look at the stars.

89.Mustaqim: Then he said: I feel sick.

90.Mustaqim: Then they turned away from him.

91.Mustaqim: So he turned to their gods and said: don´t you eat?

92.Mustaqim: What is the matter with you that you don´t speak?

93.Mustaqim: Then he struck them with his right hand.

94.Mustaqim: Then they hurried towards him.

95.Mustaqim: He said: do you serve what you carve yourselves?

96.Mustaqim: When Allah created you and what you do?

97.Mustaqim: They said: build a structure for him and throw him into the fire.

98.Mustaqim: So they wanted to plot against him, but We made them the lowest.

99.Mustaqim: And he said: I will go towards my Lord, He will guide me.

100.Mustaqim: My Lord, make me from amongst the righteous.

101.Mustaqim: Then We gave him good news of a gentle son.

102.Mustaqim: Then when he was old enough to go out with him, he said, oh my son, I saw in my dream that I should sacrifice you, so see what you think. He said: oh my father, do what you have been commanded, you will find me if Allah pleases of the patient.

103.Mustaqim: So when they had both submitted and he turned him face down,

105.Mustaqim: You have already fulfilled the dream; for this is how we reward those who do good.

106.Mustaqim: For this is the clear test.

107.Mustaqim: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.

108.Mustaqim: And We left him to be remembered by those afterwards.

110.Mustaqim: This is how We reward those who do good.

111.Mustaqim: For he is of Our believing servants.

112.Mustaqim: And We gave him good news of Ishaq (Isaac) as a prophet from amongst the righteous.

113.Mustaqim: And We blessed him and Ishaq (Isaac), and of their descendants are those who do good and those who clearly wrong themselves.

114.Mustaqim: And We already favoured Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

115.Mustaqim: And We rescued them and their people from the tremendous distress.

116.Mustaqim: And We helped them and they were the victorious.

117.Mustaqim: And We gave them the clarifying book.

118.Mustaqim: And We guided them on the straight path.

119.Mustaqim: And We left them to be remembered by those afterwards.

120.Mustaqim: Peace be upon Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

121.Mustaqim: For this is how We reward those who do good.

122.Mustaqim: For they are of Our believing servants.

123.Mustaqim: And Ilyas (Elijah) is one of the messengers.

124.Mustaqim: When he said to his people: will you not beware (of Allah)?

125.Mustaqim: Do you call on Baal and abandon the best of creators?

126.Mustaqim: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

127.Mustaqim: But they denied him, so they will be presented.

128.Mustaqim: Except the sincere servants of Allah.

129.Mustaqim: And We left him to be remembered by those afterwards.

131.Mustaqim: For this is how We reward those who do good.

132.Mustaqim: For he is of Our believing servants.

133.Mustaqim: And Lut (Lot) is one of the messengers.

134.Mustaqim: When We rescued him and his family altogether.

135.Mustaqim: Except an old woman who stayed behind.

137.Mustaqim: And you pass by them in the mornings.

138.Mustaqim: And at night, so don´t you understand?

139.Mustaqim: And Yunus (Jonah) is one of the messengers.

140.Mustaqim: When he ran away to the laden ship.

141.Mustaqim: Then after drawing lots was defeated.

142.Mustaqim: Then the fish swallowed him whilst he blamed himself.

143.Mustaqim: And had he not been of those who glorify (Allah),

144.Mustaqim: He would have stayed in its belly till the day when they are resurrected.

145.Mustaqim: Then We flung him into the open whilst he was sick.

146.Mustaqim: And We grew a marrow plant for him.

147.Mustaqim: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or more.

148.Mustaqim: Then they believed and We gave them provision for a while.

149.Mustaqim: So ask them: does your Lord have daughters whilst they have sons?

150.Mustaqim: Or did We create the angels female whilst they were witnesses?

151.Mustaqim: It is of their inventions that they say:

152.Mustaqim: Allah has fathered children, and they are lying.

153.Mustaqim: That he has chosen daughters over sons.

154.Mustaqim: What is the matter with you, how do you judge?

156.Mustaqim: Or do you have a clear authority?

157.Mustaqim: Then bring your letter (of authority) if you are truthful.

158.Mustaqim: And they claimed a relationship between Him and the Jinn, when the Jinn already knew that they will be presented.

159.Mustaqim: Glorified is Allah above what they make out.

160.Mustaqim: Except the sincere servants of Allah.

161.Mustaqim: For you and what you served,

162.Mustaqim: You will not tempt anyone against Him,

163.Mustaqim: Except him who enters the hell-fire.

164.Mustaqim: And each of us has a known place.

165.Mustaqim: And We are the ones lined up.

166.Mustaqim: And We are the ones who glorify.

168.Mustaqim: If only we had a reminder from the earlier communities,

169.Mustaqim: We would have been sincere servants of Allah.

170.Mustaqim: But they rejected him, so they shall soon know.

171.Mustaqim: And Our word has gone before regarding Our messengers,

173.Mustaqim: And that Our forces will be victorious.

174.Mustaqim: So turn away from them for a while.

175.Mustaqim: And watch them, for soon they will see.

177.Mustaqim: Then when it comes down on their habitations, bad is the awakening of those who have been warned.

178.Mustaqim: And turn away from them for a while.

179.Mustaqim: And watch, for soon they will see.

180.Mustaqim: Glorified is your Lord, the Lord of Might, above what they make out.

181.Mustaqim: And peace be upon the messengers.

182.Mustaqim: And Allah is praised, the Lord of all worlds

1.Mustaqim: Sad. By the Qur´an as the reminder.

2.Mustaqim: But those who reject (the truth) are in arrogance and far away (from it).

3.Mustaqim: How many generations have We destroyed before them, then they called out when it was too late to escape.

4.Mustaqim: And they were astonished that a warner from amongst themselves came to them, and those who reject (the truth) said: this is a lying magician.

5.Mustaqim: Does he make all the gods one god? This is a strange thing.

6.Mustaqim: And their leaders urge them on: go and help your gods, this is what is needed.

7.Mustaqim: We haven´t heard of this in any other religion, this is an invention.

8.Mustaqim: Has the reminder been revealed to him from amongst us? But they are in doubt about My reminder. But they have not yet tasted My punishment.

9.Mustaqim: Do they own the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the mighty and generous?

10.Mustaqim: Or do they own the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend by any means.

11.Mustaqim: The forces of the allies will be defeated in this.

12.Mustaqim: The people of Nuh (Noah) and ´Ad and the Pharaoh with all his monuments denied before them.

13.Mustaqim: And Thamud and the people of Lut (Lot) and the inhabitants of the woodlands (al-Ayka); those were the allies.

14.Mustaqim: Each of them denied the messengers, so the punishment came to pass.

15.Mustaqim: And these are only waiting for a single scream, which cannot be prevented.

16.Mustaqim: And they said: our Lord, hasten our share for us before the day of reckoning.

17.Mustaqim: Have patience with what they say and remember Our powerful servant Daud (David) who was repentant.

18.Mustaqim: For We made the mountains of service to glorify with him in the evenings and at sunrise.

19.Mustaqim: And the assembled birds all returned to him.

20.Mustaqim: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and the power of speech.

21.Mustaqim: And has the information of the antagonists reached you when they climbed up to the secluded area?

22.Mustaqim: When they entered upon Dawud (David) and he was startled by them. They said: don´t be afraid, we are two antagonists one of whom has transgressed against the other, so judge between us with the truth and do not deviate and guide us to the level path.

23.Mustaqim: For this brother of mine has ninety-nine sheep and I have one sheep, so he said: entrust it to me, and he overpowered me in speech.

24.Mustaqim: He said: he has wronged you by asking for your sheep to be added to his sheep, and many partners transgress against each other except those who believe and do good work, and they are few. And Dawud (David) knew that We had tested him and asked his Lord for forgiveness and went down in prostration and repented.

25.Mustaqim: So We forgave him that, and he will be close to Us and have a good return.

26.Mustaqim: Oh Dawud (David), We have made you a representative on earth, so judge between people with the truth and do not follow desire to lead you astray from the way of Allah, for those who lead away from the way of Allah will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the day of reckoning.

27.Mustaqim: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between them without purpose. That is the assumption of those who reject (the truth), so woe to those who reject (the truth) from the fire.

28.Mustaqim: Or did We make those who believe and do good work like those who spread corruption on earth? Or did We make those who beware (of Allah) like those immoral?

29.Mustaqim: It is a blessed book We revealed to you so that they might understand its signs and so that those with understanding will reflect.

30.Mustaqim: And We gave Dawud (David) Sulayman (Solomon), a blessed servant, for he was repentant.

31.Mustaqim: When the best-bred horses were presented before him in the evening.

32.Mustaqim: Then he said: I was overtaken with love for beautiful horses above the remembrance of my Lord until they disappeared out of sight.

33.Mustaqim: Return them to me, then he began to pass (his hands) over their legs and necks.

34.Mustaqim: And We tested Sulayman (Solomon) and placed a (mere) body onto his throne, then he repented.

35.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom which will not befit anyone after me, for you are the generous.

36.Mustaqim: Then We made the wind of service to him to travel by his command willingly wherever he directed it.

37.Mustaqim: And the devils, all the builders and divers.

38.Mustaqim: And others tied in cuffs.

39.Mustaqim: This is Our gift, so give or withhold (of it) without counting.

40.Mustaqim: And he will be close to Us and have a good return.

41.Mustaqim: And remember Our servant Ayyub (Job) when he called his Lord that the devil has touched me with affliction and punishment.

42.Mustaqim: Stir with your foot: there is cold water to wash and drink.

43.Mustaqim: And We granted him his family and the like of it in addition as a mercy from Us and a reminder to those with understanding.

44.Mustaqim: And take a bunch of leaves in your hand and strike with it and do not break your vow. We found him to be patient, a blessed servant, for he was repentant.

45.Mustaqim: And remember Our servants Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya´qub (Jacob) full of strength and insight.

46.Mustaqim: We chose them for their sincere remembrance of the (final) abode.

47.Mustaqim: And they are amongst the chosen few with Us.

48.Mustaqim: And remember Isma´il (Ishmael), Al-Yasa´ (Elisha) and Dhu-l-Kifl (Ezekiel), and each was of the select.

49.Mustaqim: This is a reminder, and for those who beware (of Allah) is the best destination.

50.Mustaqim: Gardens of Eden with the doors opened for them.

51.Mustaqim: They recline there asking for lots of fruit and drink.

52.Mustaqim: And with them will be exclusive women companions.

53.Mustaqim: This is what you were promised for the day of reckoning.

54.Mustaqim: This is Our provision which will not deplete.

55.Mustaqim: So it is, and for the transgressors will be the worst destination.

56.Mustaqim: Hell, which they will enter, a bad place to be.

57.Mustaqim: So it is, so they shall taste it with boiling water and freezing cold.

58.Mustaqim: And other similar combinations.

59.Mustaqim: Here is a group to join you, there is no welcome for them, for they will enter the fire.

60.Mustaqim: They will say: but there is no welcome for you, you prepared this for us, and it is a bad place to stay.

61.Mustaqim: They will say: our Lord, whoever prepared this for us, give them double punishment in the fire.

62.Mustaqim: And they will say: how come we don´t see men we counted amongst the worst?

63.Mustaqim: We ridiculed them, but they have become invisible.

64.Mustaqim: This arguing of the inhabitants of the fire is indeed true.

65.Mustaqim: Say: I am only a warner, and there is no god but Allah the one and dominant.

66.Mustaqim: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the mighty and forgiving.

67.Mustaqim: Say: this is serious news.

68.Mustaqim: You turn away from it.

69.Mustaqim: I have no knowledge of the highest counsel when they argue.

70.Mustaqim: It has only been revealed to me that I am a plain warner.

71.Mustaqim: And when your Lord said to the angels: I am creating a human from clay.

72.Mustaqim: Then when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall prostate before him.

73.Mustaqim: Then all the angels prostrated.

74.Mustaqim: Except Iblis (the devil), he was arrogant and was of those who rejected (the truth).

75.Mustaqim: He said: oh Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating to what I created with both My hands? Have you become arrogant or were you proud?

76.Mustaqim: He said: I am better than him, You created me from fire and created him from clay.

77.Mustaqim: He said: then get out of here, for you are cursed.

78.Mustaqim: And My curse will be upon you until the day of repayment.

79.Mustaqim: He said: my Lord, then give me time till the day when they are resurrected.

80.Mustaqim: He said: then you are given time.

81.Mustaqim: Till the day of the time known.

82.Mustaqim: He said: then by Your power I will mislead them all.

83.Mustaqim: Except Your sincere servants amongst them.

84.Mustaqim: He said: let this be true, and I pronounce the truth.

85.Mustaqim: I will fill hell-fire with you and all of them who follow you.

86.Mustaqim: Say: I do not ask you for a reward for it and I do not impose.

87.Mustaqim: It is only a reminder for all the world.

88.Mustaqim: And you will soon know the news of it.

1.Mustaqim: The revelation of the book is from Allah the mighty and wise.

2.Mustaqim: For We revealed to you the book with the truth, so serve Allah, making religion sincere for Him.

3.Mustaqim: For sure to Allah belongs the sincere religion, and those who take protectors besides Him, (saying) we only serve them to bring us closer to Allah, Allah will judge between them regarding what they used to differ in, for Allah does not guide any liar and rejecter (of the truth).

4.Mustaqim: If Allah wanted to adopt a son, He would have chosen what He pleased from what He created, glorified is He, He is Allah the one and dominant.

5.Mustaqim: He created the heavens and the earth with truth, He makes the night cover the day and the day cover the night and made subservient the sun and the moon, each floats for a fixed term; for sure He is the mighty and forgiving.

6.Mustaqim: He created you from a single soul, then made from it its partner and sent you from the cattle eight in pairs; He creates you in the wombs of your mothers in a successive creation in three layers of darkness; that is Allah your Lord, His is the kingdom, there is no god but Him, so where to are  you diverted?

7.Mustaqim: If you reject (the truth), then Allah is independent of you, yet He is not content with the rejection from His servants, and if you give thanks, He is content with you, and no-one burdened will carry another´s burden, then your return is to your Lord and He will inform you what you used to do, for He knows what is kept inside.

8.Mustaqim: And if harm befalls man, he calls his Lord, turning to Him, then when He grants him a favour from Him, he forgets what he called for before and sets up partners for Allah to be lead astray from His way. Say: enjoy your rejection for a while, for you are of the inmates of the fire.

9.Mustaqim: Or what about him who is devoted throughout the night in prostration and standing (in prayer), concerned about the hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord? Say: are those who know and those who do not know the same? For only those with understanding reflect.

10.Mustaqim: Say: oh My servants who believe, beware of your Lord. For those who do good in this world will be good, and the earth of Allah is spacious, and the patient will be paid their reward without counting.

11.Mustaqim: Say: I have been commanded to serve Allah, making religion sincere for Him.

12.Mustaqim: And I have been commanded to be the first to submit (as Muslim).

13.Mustaqim: Say: I fear, if I disobeyed my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous day.

14.Mustaqim: Say: I serve Allah, making my religion sincere for Him.

15.Mustaqim: So serve what you please besides Him. Say: the losers are those who have lost themselves and their families on the day of resurrection; for sure this is the clear loss.

16.Mustaqim: They will be shut off by fire from above and from below, this is what Allah scares His servants with: oh My servants, beware of Me!

17.Mustaqim: And those who shun the idols and do not serve them and turn to Allah, for them is good news, so give good news to My servants.

18.Mustaqim: Those who listen to the speech and follow the best of it, those are the ones Allah has guided and those are the ones with understanding.

19.Mustaqim: So he for whom the word about the punishment comes to pass, are you going to rescue him from the fire?

20.Mustaqim: But for those who beware of their Lord will be chambers with chambers built above them and rivers flowing below them, a promise from Allah - Allah does not break His promise.

21.Mustaqim: Do you not see how Allah sends water from the sky, then He makes it pass through springs, then He makes vegetation of different colour grow from it, then it dries out and you see it yellow, then He makes it crumble - in that is surely a reminder for those with understanding.

22.Mustaqim: Consider then him whose chest Allah has expanded towards Islam and he follows a light from his Lord, and woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah, they are in clear error.

23.Mustaqim: Allah has revealed the best account in a book replete with similarities from which the skins of those who fear their Lord shiver, then their skins and hearts incline to the remembrance of Allah. This is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He pleases, and whomever Allah lets go astray, there is no-one to guide him.

24.Mustaqim: Consider then him who tries to keep the harm of the punishment off his face, and the wrongdoers will be told: taste what you have earned.

25.Mustaqim: Those before them denied, then the punishment reached them from where they were not aware.

26.Mustaqim: And Allah made them taste the humiliation in the life of this world, and the punishment of the hereafter is even greater if they only knew.

27.Mustaqim: And We have coined for people every kind of likeness in this Qur´an so that they reflect.

28.Mustaqim: An Arabic reading (Qur´an) without distortion, so that they beware (of Allah).

29.Mustaqim: Allah coins the similitude of a man who is owned by quarrelling partners and a man who belongs exclusively to one man - are they alike? Allah is praised, but most of them don´t know.

30.Mustaqim: You will die, and they will die.

31.Mustaqim: Then on the day of resurrection you will argue before your Lord.

32.Mustaqim: And who is more wrong than he who lies about Allah or denies truthfulness when it reaches him? Is not in hell a home for those who reject (the truth)?

33.Mustaqim: And he who brings truthfulness and confirms it, those are the ones who beware (of Allah).

34.Mustaqim: They will have what they please with their Lord, that is the reward for those who do good.

35.Mustaqim: So that Allah ignores from them the worst they did and gives them their reward for the best they used to do.

36.Mustaqim: Is not Allah enough for His servant? And they try to scare you with those besides Him, and whomever Allah lets go astray, there is no-one to guide him.

37.Mustaqim: And whomever Allah guides, there is no-one to lead him astray. Is not Allah mighty and vengeful?

38.Mustaqim: And if you asked them who created the heavens and the earth, they would say: Allah. Say: consider then what you call on besides Allah, if Allah wanted harm for me, would they remove His harm, or if He wanted mercy for me, would they withhold His mercy? Say: Allah is sufficient for me, on Him let all those rely who want to rely on something.

39.Mustaqim: Say: oh my people, act as you do, I also act, then soon you will know.

40.Mustaqim: Whom a humiliating punishment will reach and who will deserve a lasting punishment.

41.Mustaqim: We have revealed to you the book for mankind with truth, so whoever wants to be guided, does so for his own good, and who goes astray, goes astray against himself, and you are not a guardian over them.

42.Mustaqim: Allah receives the souls when they die, and those which did not die in their sleep, then He retains those for whom death has been decreed and sends the others until a fixed term, for in that are signs for people who reflect.

43.Mustaqim: Or do they take mediators besides Allah? Say: even though they do not have power over anything nor understand?

44.Mustaqim: Say: to Allah belongs all mediation, his is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, then you will return to Him.

45.Mustaqim: And when he mentions Allah alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter shudder, and when those besides Him are mentioned, then they rejoice.

46.Mustaqim: Say: oh Allah, originator of the heavens and the earth who knows the unseen and the apparent, You judge between Your servants in what they used to differ in.

47.Mustaqim: And if those who did wrong had all that is on earth and the like again, they would give it up to avert the harm of the punishment on the day of resurrection, and they become aware from Allah of what they did not count on.

48.Mustaqim: And they become aware of what they committed and what they used to make fun of overcomes them.

49.Mustaqim: And if harm befalls man, he calls Us, then when We grant him a favour from Us he says: I achieved this by knowledge, but it is a test and most of them don´t know.

50.Mustaqim: Those before them already said this but what they gathered did not benefit them.

51.Mustaqim: Then the evil of what they committed afflicted them, and the wrongdoers amongst these, the evil of what they committed will afflict them and they will not escape.

52.Mustaqim: Do they not know that Allah expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, for in that are signs for people who believe.

53.Mustaqim: Say: oh My servants who have been extravagant against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah, for Allah forgives all sins, for He is the forgiving, merciful.

54.Mustaqim: And turn to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment reaches you - then you will not be helped.

55.Mustaqim: And follow the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment reaches you suddenly when you are unaware.

56.Mustaqim: When a soul will say: what a loss that I neglected the cause of Allah when I was of those who made fun.

57.Mustaqim: Or will say: if only Allah had guided me I would have been of those who bewared (of Allah).

58.Mustaqim: Or will say when it sees the punishment: if only I could return and would be of those who do good.

59.Mustaqim: But no, My signs came to you before and you denied them and were arrogant and were of those who rejected (the truth).

60.Mustaqim: And on the day of resurrection you will see those who denied Allah with blackened faces - is not in hell a home for the arrogant?

61.Mustaqim: And Allah will rescue those who bewared on account of their accomplishment, no harm will touch them and they will not worry.

62.Mustaqim: Allah is the creator of everything and He is a guardian over everything.

63.Mustaqim: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth, and those who reject the signs of Allah, they are the losers.

64.Mustaqim: Do you command me to serve other than Allah you fools?

65.Mustaqim: And it has been revealed to me and to those before me that if you associate (anything with Allah) your work is wasted and you will be of the losers.

66.Mustaqim: But serve Allah and be of the grateful.

67.Mustaqim: And they do not measure Allah´s true ability, and the whole earth will be in His grasp on the day of resurrection and the heavens rolled up in His right hand, glorified and exalted is He above what they associate.

68.Mustaqim: And the horn will be blown and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on earth will be struck down except whom Allah pleases; then it will be blown again and they will stand up and see.

69.Mustaqim: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the book will be laid out, and the prophets and witnesses will be brought and it will be decided between them with truth and they will not be wronged.

70.Mustaqim: And every soul will be repaid what it did and He knows best what you do.

71.Mustaqim: And those who rejected (the truth) will be driven to hell in clusters until when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its guards will tell them: did not messengers of your own reach you and recite to you the signs of your Lord and warn you about the meeting of this day of yours? They will say: sure, but the word about the punishment has come to pass about those who rejected (the truth).

72.Mustaqim: They will be told: enter the gates of hell to remain there, and bad is the home of the arrogant.

73.Mustaqim: And those who bewared of their Lord will be driven to the garden in clusters until when they reach it, its gates will have been opened and its guards will tell them: peace be with you, you were good, so enter it forever.

74.Mustaqim: And they will say: praised is Allah who kept His promise and gave us the earth as an inheritance to settle in the garden where we please, so blessed is the reward of those who work.

75.Mustaqim: And you will see the angels circling the throne, glorifying the praise of their Lord, and it has been decided between them with truth and it will be said: praised is Allah the Lord of all worlds.

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: The revelation of the book is from Allah the mighty and knowing.

3.Mustaqim: He who forgives sin and accepts repentance, who has severe punishment and full power, there is no god but Him, to Him is the journey.
