4.Mustaqim: Only those who reject (the truth) argue about the signs of Allah, so be not deceived by how they move about in the land.

5.Mustaqim: The people of Nuh (Noah) before them and the allies after them denied, and each community wanted to overtake their messenger and argued in ignorance in order to refute the truth, then I overtook them, and how was My punishment!

6.Mustaqim: And this is how your Lord´s word about those who reject (the truth) comes true that they are inmates of the fire.

7.Mustaqim: Those who carry the throne and those surrounding it glorify the praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask for forgiveness for those who believe: our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge extends to everything, so forgive those who repent and follow Your way and safeguard them from the punishment of hell-fire.

8.Mustaqim: Our Lord, and let them enter the gardens of Eden which you have promised them, and those who are righteous amongst their parents and partners and children, for you are the mighty and wise.

9.Mustaqim: And safeguard them from (the punishment for) bad deeds, and whomever You safeguard (from the punishment for) bad deeds on that day You have already shown mercy, and that is the ultimate success.

10.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) will be called: Allah´s aversion is greater than your own aversion when you were called to faith but rejected.

11.Mustaqim: They will say: our Lord, you made us die twice and revived us twice, then we acknowledged our sins, so is there a way out?

12.Mustaqim: This is your outcome because when Allah alone was called, you rejected, and when something was associated with Him, you believed, then the judgement belongs to Allah, the exalted and great.

13.Mustaqim: He is who shows you His signs and sends for you from the sky provision, and only those who repent reflect.

14.Mustaqim: So call Allah, making the religion sincere for Him, even if the rejecters resent it.

15.Mustaqim: He is above all ranks and owns the throne, He sends the Spirit by His command to whom He pleases of His servants to warn of the day of meeting.

16.Mustaqim: On the day they are exposed nothing of them will be hidden from Allah. To whom does the kingdom belong today? to Allah the one and dominant.

17.Mustaqim: Today every soul will be repaid for what it has earned, there is no injustice today, for Allah is swift in counting.

18.Mustaqim: And warn them of the day to come when the hearts will be stuck near the throats; the wrongdoers will have no close confidant nor mediator to be followed.

19.Mustaqim: He knows every secret glance and what is hidden inside.

20.Mustaqim: And Allah decides with the truth, and those they call besides Him cannot decide anything, for Allah listens and sees.

21.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on earth and see what the outcome was like for those before them? They were greater in power and impact on earth than them, then Allah seized them on account of their sins, and they had no defence against Allah.

22.Mustaqim: This is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs but they rejected, so Allah seized them, for He is strong and severe in punishment.

23.Mustaqim: And We sent Musa (Moses) with Our signs and a clear authority.

24.Mustaqim: To Pharaoh and Haman and Qarun (Korah), but they said: a lying magician.

25.Mustaqim: Then when he brought them the truth from Us, they said: kill the children of those who believe with him and spare their women, and the plot of those who reject (the truth) is only in vain.

26.Mustaqim: And Pharaoh said: let me kill Musa (Moses), then he can call his Lord, for I fear that he will change your religion or bring about corruption on earth.

27.Mustaqim: And Musa (Moses) said: I seek refuge in my Lord from every arrogant person who does not believe in the day of reckoning.

28.Mustaqim: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who had hidden his belief said: are you going to kill a man for saying ´my Lord is Allah´ whilst he has already brought you clear proofs from his Lord? And if he is a liar, then his lie is upon him, and if he is truthful, some of what he has promised you will afflict you, for Allah does not guide whoever is an exaggerating liar.

29.Mustaqim: Oh my people, yours is the kingdom today and you dominate on earth, but who will help us against Allah´s harm when it reaches us. Pharaoh said: I only show you what I see and I only guide you to the way of good conduct.

30.Mustaqim: And the one who believed said: oh my people, I fear for you the like of the day of the allies.

31.Mustaqim: The like of the fate of the people of Nuh (Noah), ´Ad, Thamud and those after them, and Allah does not want to wrong His servants.

32.Mustaqim: And oh my people, I fear for you the day of being called.

33.Mustaqim: The day when you will turn your backs, you will have no protector against Allah, and whomever Allah lets go astray, there is no-one to guide him.

34.Mustaqim: And Yusuf (Joseph) already brought you clear proofs before, but you remained in doubt about what he brought you until when he passed away you said: Allah will not raise a messenger after him. This is how Allah lets the extravagant and doubtful go astray;

35.Mustaqim: Those who argue about the signs of Allah without authority given by Him, which is highly offensive to Allah and those who believe. This is how Allah imprints on the heart of every arrogant tyrant.

36.Mustaqim: And Pharaoh said: oh Haman, build me a structure so that I can reach the connections;

37.Mustaqim: The connections to the heavens and take a look at the god of Musa (Moses), and I surely consider him a liar. And this is how his bad deeds appealed to Pharaoh and he was diverted from the way, and the plot of Pharaoh lead only to destruction.

38.Mustaqim: And the one who believed said: oh my people, follow me, I will guide you to the way of good conduct.

39.Mustaqim: Oh my people, this worldly life is only a provision, and the hereafter is the lasting abode.

40.Mustaqim: Whoever does bad, he will only be rewarded with the like of it, and whoever does good, male or female, and is a believer, those will enter the garden where they will be provided for without counting.

41.Mustaqim: And oh my people, how come I call you to the garden and you call me to the fire?

42.Mustaqim: You call me to reject Allah and associate with Him what I have no knowledge of, and I call you to the mighty and forgiving.

43.Mustaqim: Without fail that which you call me to has no claim in this world and the next, and our return is to Allah, and the extravagant will be inhabitants of the fire.

44.Mustaqim: Then you will remember what I said to you and I will entrust my affairs to Allah, for Allah sees His servants.

45.Mustaqim: Then Allah protected him against the evil they were scheming whilst the family of Pharaoh was surrounded by the worst punishment.

46.Mustaqim: The fire to which they will be presented in the mornings and evenings, and on the day the hour happens: let the family of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment.

47.Mustaqim: And they dispute with each other in the fire, then the weak say to the arrogant: we followed you, so will you avert a portion of the fire from us?

48.Mustaqim: The arrogant say: we are all in it, for Allah has already judged between His servants.

49.Mustaqim: And those in the fire say to the guards of hell: call your Lord to reduce for us a day of the punishment.

50.Mustaqim: They say: did not your messengers reach you with clear proofs? They say: sure. They say: then call, and the call of those who rejected (the truth) is only in vain.

51.Mustaqim: For We help Our messengers and the believers in the worldly life and on the day the witnesses stand up.

52.Mustaqim: On the day when their excuses will not benefit the wrongdoers and they will be cursed and theirs is a bad abode.

53.Mustaqim: And We gave Musa (Moses) guidance and made the Children of Israel inherit the book.

54.Mustaqim: A guidance and reminder for those with understanding.

55.Mustaqim: So be patient, for the promise of Allah is true, and ask for forgiveness for your sin and glorify the praise of your Lord in the evenings and mornings.

56.Mustaqim: Those who argue about the signs of Allah without authority given by Him, they are only filled with pride and will not win the argument, so seek refuge in Allah, for He listens and sees.

57.Mustaqim: The creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of mankind don´t know.

58.Mustaqim: And the blind and the seeing are not the same, nor those who believe and do good work and the evil-doer, little do you reflect.

59.Mustaqim: The hour will come, there is no doubt in it, but most of mankind don´t believe.

60.Mustaqim: And your Lord says: call Me, I will respond to you, for those who are too arrogant to serve Me will enter hell in submission.

61.Mustaqim: Allah is who made the night for you to rest in and the day to see, for Allah is full of favours for mankind, but most of mankind are ungrateful.

62.Mustaqim: This is Allah for you, your Lord, the creator of everything, there is no god but Him, so where to are you diverted?

63.Mustaqim: This is how those are diverted who dispute the signs of Allah.

64.Mustaqim: Allah is who made the earth firm for you and the sky a cover and shaped you and made your shape beautiful and provided well for you, this is Allah for you, your Lord, so exalted is Allah the Lord of all worlds.

65.Mustaqim: He is the living, there is no god but Him, so call Him, making the religion sincere for Him, praised is Allah the Lord of all worlds.

66.Mustaqim: Say: I have been forbidden from serving those you call besides Allah when the clear proofs reached me from my Lord, and have been commanded to submit to the Lord of all worlds.

67.Mustaqim: He is who created you from soil, then from a sperm, then from an implant, then He brings you out as a child in order for you to reach your strength, then you are going to age, and amongst you is he who dies before, and you will reach a fixed term so that you might understand.

68.Mustaqim: He is who gives life and death, and when He decides a matter, He simply says to it "Be!", then  it is.

69.Mustaqim: Do you not consider how those who argue about the signs of Allah are diverted?

70.Mustaqim: Those who deny the book and what We sent Our messengers with, but soon they will know.

71.Mustaqim: When the cuffs will be on their necks and the chains, they will be dragged.

72.Mustaqim: Through boiling water, then they will be heated in the fire.

73.Mustaqim: Then they will be told: where is what you associated?

74.Mustaqim: Besides Allah? They say: they have deserted us, but we did not call on anything before, that is how Allah leads those astray who reject (Him).

75.Mustaqim: This is on account of you having rejoiced on earth without right and having been triumphant.

76.Mustaqim: Enter the gates of hell to remain there, for bad is the home of the arrogant.

77.Mustaqim: So be patient, for the promise of Allah is true, then whether We show you some of what We have promised them or take you away, to Us they will return.

78.Mustaqim: We previously sent messengers, some of whom We related to you and some of whom We did not relate to you, and no messenger would bring a sign except with the permission of Allah, then when the command of Allah came, it was decided with truth and the followers of falsehood were the losers by then.

79.Mustaqim: Allah is who gave you the cattle to ride on and to eat.

80.Mustaqim: And you have benefits in them and can attain with them things you desire, and on them and on the ship you are carried.

81.Mustaqim: And He shows you His signs, so which of the signs of Allah do you dislike?

82.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on earth and see what the outcome was like for those before them? They were more numerous than them and stronger in power and impact on earth, but what they gathered did not benefit them.

83.Mustaqim: Then when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in whatever knowledge they had, and what they made fun of overcame them.

84.Mustaqim: Then when they saw Our affliction they said: we believe in Allah alone and reject what we associated with Him.

85.Mustaqim: But their belief did not benefit them when they saw Our affliction. This is the custom of Allah which already came to pass amongst His servants, and those who reject (the truth) were the losers by then.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: A revelation from the Owner and Giver of Mercy.

3.Mustaqim: A book whose verses have been explained, an Arabic reading (Qur´an) for people who know.

4.Mustaqim: Good news and a warning, but most of them turn away and do not listen.

5.Mustaqim: And they say: our hearts are covered against what you call us to and in our ears is a weight and between us and you is a barrier, so act, for we are acting.

6.Mustaqim: Say: I am only a human like you whilst it has been revealed to me that your god is a single god, so go straight to Him and ask Him for forgiveness, and woe to the idolaters.

7.Mustaqim: Those who do not give Zakat and reject the hereafter.

8.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, for them is a limitless reward.

9.Mustaqim: Say: do you reject the One who created the earth in two days and you set up partners for Him? That is the Lord of all worlds.

10.Mustaqim: And He placed stabilisers on it from above it and blessed it and arranged its provision in four days in fair measure for those who seek it.

11.Mustaqim: Then He moved to the heaven which was smoke and said to it and to the earth: come obediently or reluctantly; they said: we come obediently.

12.Mustaqim: Then He arranged it into seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its affairs, and We adorned the lowest heaven with lights and protection, that is the arrangement of the mighty and knowing.

13.Mustaqim: Then if they turn away, say: I have warned you of being struck down like ´Ad and Thamud.

14.Mustaqim: When their messengers came to them continuously (saying:) do not serve anything but Allah, they said: if our Lord pleased He would have sent angels, so we reject what you have been sent with.

15.Mustaqim: Then as for ´Ad, they were arrogant on earth without right and said: who is stronger in power than us? Did they not consider that Allah who created them is stronger in power than them? And they disputed Our signs.

16.Mustaqim: Then We sent against them an icy wind over days of disaster to make them taste the punishment of humiliation in the worldly life, and the punishment of the hereafter is even more humiliating and they will not be helped.

17.Mustaqim: And as for Thamud, We guided them but they preferred blindness to guidance, so the humiliating punishment struck them down on account of what they committed.

18.Mustaqim: And We rescued those who believed and constantly bewared (of Allah).

19.Mustaqim: And on that day the enemies of Allah will be gathered to the fire and arranged into divisions.

20.Mustaqim: Until when they reach it, their hearing and eyesight and skins will witness against them as to what they did.

21.Mustaqim: And they will say to their skins: why did you witness against us? They will say: Allah has given us speech, He who gives speech to everything, and He created you the first time and to Him you return.

22.Mustaqim: And you did not expect that your hearing and eyesight and skins would witness against you, but you thought that Allah did not know much of what you did.

23.Mustaqim: And this thought you held about your Lord has ruined you so you became losers.

24.Mustaqim: So if they are patient, the fire is their home, and if they ask for reprieve, they will not be reprieved.

25.Mustaqim: And We assigned them friends so that they made appealing to them what lay before them and what lay behind them, and the word came true for them which had gone before in communities of the Jinn and mankind that they would be losers.

26.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: do not listen to this Qur´an and belittle it so that you will prevail.

27.Mustaqim: So We will make those who reject (the truth) taste a severe punishment and will reward them in line with the worst they did.

28.Mustaqim: That is the punishment of the enemies of Allah, the fire, they will have an eternal home in it as a reward for having disputed Our signs.

29.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say: our Lord, show us those of the Jinn and mankind who lead us astray so that we trample them under our feet so that they are the lowest.

30.Mustaqim: Those who say: our Lord is Allah, then uphold it, the angels descend on them, saying: fear not and worry not and look forward to the garden which you have been promised.

31.Mustaqim: We are your protectors in this world and the hereafter and you will have there whatever your souls desire and you will have there whatever you ask for.

32.Mustaqim: A gift from One who is forgiving and merciful.

33.Mustaqim: And who is better in speech than him who calls to Allah and does good and says: I am of those who have submitted (as Muslims).

34.Mustaqim: And the good deed and the bad deed are not the same; repel with that which is better, then the one with enmity between you and him will become like a dear friend.

35.Mustaqim: And only those who are patient achieve this and only those with good fortune achieve this.

36.Mustaqim: And if you are in any way provoked by the devil then seek refuge in Allah, for He is who listens and knows.

37.Mustaqim: And of His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon; do not prostrate to the sun nor to the moon but prostrate to Allah who created them if you serve Him.

38.Mustaqim: And if they are arrogant, then those near your Lord glorify Him night and day and do not grow weary.

39.Mustaqim: And of His signs is that you see the earth bare, then when We send water upon it, it comes to life and swells. For sure, the One who gives life to it will revive the dead, for He is able to do anything.

40.Mustaqim: Those who dispute Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is then he better who is thrown in the fire or he who arrives safe on the day of resurrection? Do as you please, for He sees what you do.

41.Mustaqim: Those who reject the reminder when it comes to them: it is certainly a mighty book.

42.Mustaqim: Falsehood does not reach it from before or behind, it is a revelation from One who is wise and praiseworthy.

43.Mustaqim: You are only told what messengers before you were told, for your Lord is full of forgiveness and full of painful punishment.

44.Mustaqim: And had We made it a foreign reading (Qur´an) they would have said: why have its verses not been explained? Foreign and Arab? Say: it is a guidance and healing for those who believe, and those who do not believe, there is a weight upon their ears and they are blind to it, those will be called from a distant place.

45.Mustaqim: And We already gave Musa (Moses) the book, then they differed about it, and had not a word gone before from your Lord, it would have been decided between them, and they are indeed in severe doubt about it.

46.Mustaqim: Whoever does good, it is for himself, and who does bad, it is against himself, and your Lord does not wrong His servants.

47.Mustaqim: To Him is the knowledge of the hour referred, and no fruit emerges from its shell and no female is pregnant or gives birth but with His knowledge, and on the day they will be asked: where are your associates? they will say: let us be, we have no evidence.

48.Mustaqim: And what they called on before deserted them, and they realise they have no escape.

49.Mustaqim: Man does not grow weary of calling for good, and when harm afflicts him, he is weary and depressed.

50.Mustaqim: And if We make him taste mercy from Us after harm afflicted him, he is likely to say: this is for me and I don´t think the hour will happen, and if I were to return to my Lord, I would find even better with Him, then We will inform those who rejected (the truth) of what they did and will make them taste an unrelenting punishment.

51.Mustaqim: And when We give blessings to man, he rebels and keeps aside, and when harm afflicts him, he prays excessively.

52.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered that if it is from Allah and then you reject it, who is more astray than him who is far away (from the truth)?

53.Mustaqim: We will show them Our signs in the cosmos and in themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is a witness to everything?

54.Mustaqim: But they are in doubt about meeting their Lord, yet He surrounds everything.

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: ´Ayn Sin Qaf.

3.Mustaqim: This is how Allah reveals to you and those before you, Allah, the mighty and wise.

4.Mustaqim: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and He is the exalted and great.

5.Mustaqim: The heavens almost break up from above and the angels glorify the praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth, for sure Allah is the forgiving and merciful.

6.Mustaqim: And those who adopt protectors besides Him, Allah is their keeper and you are not their guardian.

7.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed to you an Arabic reading (Qur´an) to warn the leading township and those around it and warn of the day of gathering in which there is no doubt; a group will be in the garden and a group will be in the fire.

8.Mustaqim: And if Allah pleased He would have made you a single community, but He enters whom He pleases into His mercy, and the wrongdoers have neither protector nor helper.

9.Mustaqim: Or do they take protectors besides Allah? But Allah is the protector and He revives the dead and He is able to do anything.

10.Mustaqim: And whatever you differ in, the judgement about it belongs to Allah, that is Allah your Lord, on Him I rely and to Him I repent.

11.Mustaqim: The originator of the heavens and the earth who gave you partners from amongst yourselves and the cattle in pairs, thus He made you spread out, there is nothing like Him, and He listens and sees.

12.Mustaqim: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth, He expands the provision for whom He pleases and tightens it, for He knows everything.

13.Mustaqim: He has ordained for you in the religion what He instructed Nuh (Noah) with and what He revealed to you and what We instructed Ibrahim (Abraham) with and Musa (Moses) and ´Isa (Jesus): that you uphold the religion and do not break up regarding it. It is a big deal for the idolaters what you call them to. Allah chooses whom He pleases to come to Him and guides to Him who repents.

14.Mustaqim: And they only broke up after the knowledge had reached them out of transgression amongst each other, and had not a word from your Lord gone before until a fixed term, it would have been decided between them, and those who inherited the book after them are in severe doubt about it.

15.Mustaqim: So call to that and be steadfast as you have been commanded and do not follow their desires and say: I believe in any book Allah has revealed and have been commanded to deal justly with you, Allah is our Lord and your Lord, our deeds are for us and your deeds are for you, there is no dispute between us and you, Allah will gather us and to Him is the journey.

16.Mustaqim: And those who dispute about Allah after He has been responded to, their argument is void before their Lord and upon them is (His) anger and theirs is a severe punishment.

17.Mustaqim: Allah is who revealed the book with truth and (set up) the balance, and how can you tell whether the hour might be near.

18.Mustaqim: Those are in a hurry for it who do not believe in it, and those who believe are anxious about it and know that it is the truth. For sure, those who are in doubt about the hour are in extensive error.

19.Mustaqim: Allah is kind to His servants; He provides for whom He pleases and He is the strong and mighty.

20.Mustaqim: Whoever wants the fruit of the hereafter, We increase its fruit for him, and whoever wants the fruit of this world, We give him of it and he has no share in the hereafter.

21.Mustaqim: Or do they have partners who ordain for them in the religion what Allah did not permit? And if it had not been for the promise of judgement, it would have been decided between them, and for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment.

22.Mustaqim: You will see the wrongdoers anxious about what they committed and it will fall upon them, and those who believe and do good work will be in the greenery of the gardens (of paradise) where they will have what they please with their Lord, that is the great favour.

23.Mustaqim: This is the good news Allah gives to His servants who believe and do good work. Say: I do not ask you for a reward for it except love towards relatives, and whoever performs a good deed, We increase good for him through it, for Allah forgives and appreciates.

24.Mustaqim: Or do they say he invented a lie against Allah? But if Allah pleased, He would seal your heart, and Allah eradicates falsehood and verifies the truth with His words, for He knows what is kept inside.

25.Mustaqim: And He is who accepts repentance from His servants and overlooks bad deeds and knows what you do.

26.Mustaqim: And He responds to those who believe and do good work and increases them of His favours, and for those who reject (the truth) is a severe punishment.

27.Mustaqim: And if Allah expanded the provision for His servants, they would transgress on earth, but He sends in measure what He pleases, for He is informed of and sees His servants.

28.Mustaqim: And He is who sends down the rain after they despair and spreads out His mercy, and He is the praiseworthy protector.

29.Mustaqim: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and all the creatures He spread on it, and He is able to gather them when He pleases.

30.Mustaqim: And whatever affliction befalls you, it is due to what you yourselves have brought about, and He overlooks a lot.

31.Mustaqim: And you will not escape on earth, and you have besides Allah no protector nor helper.

32.Mustaqim: And of His signs are the towering ships traversing the sea.

33.Mustaqim: If He pleases, He makes the wind stop and they remain motionless on top of it.

34.Mustaqim: Or He destroys them on account of what they committed, and He overlooks a lot.

35.Mustaqim: And those who argue about Our signs will know that they have no escape.

36.Mustaqim: For whatever you have been given is the provision of the life of the world, and what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who believe and rely on their Lord.

37.Mustaqim: And those who shun the major sins and indecencies, and whenever they are angry, they forgive.

38.Mustaqim: And those who respond to their Lord and keep up prayer and decide their affairs in consultation between them and spend of what We have provided them with.

39.Mustaqim: And those who when they are afflicted by transgression help each other.

40.Mustaqim: And the punishment for harm is a similar harm, but whoever lets it be and does good, his reward is with Allah, for He does not love the wrongdoers.

41.Mustaqim: And whoever takes revenge after having been wronged, they should not be prevented.

42.Mustaqim: Only those should be prevented who wrong people and transgress on earth without right, for those is a painful punishment.

43.Mustaqim: And whoever is patient and forgives, that is one of the firmest things (to do).

44.Mustaqim: And whomever Allah lets go astray, He has no protector after that, and you see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, say: is there a way of preventing it?

45.Mustaqim: And you see them presented before it, fearful in humiliation, cautiously looking around, and the believers will say: the losers today are those who lost themselves and their families on the day of resurrection, for sure the wrongdoers will be in a lasting punishment.

46.Mustaqim: And they had no protectors to help them besides Allah, and whomever Allah lets go astray, there is no way for him.

47.Mustaqim: Respond to your Lord before a day arrives when there is no avoiding Allah; on that day you will have no refuge and you will have no defence.

48.Mustaqim: And if they turn away, then We have not sent you as a guardian over them, for your duty is only to convey, and when We let man taste a mercy from Us, he rejoices in it, and when harm afflicts them on account of what they have sent ahead, then man is ungrateful.

49.Mustaqim: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, He creates what He pleases, He grants whom He pleases females, and grants whom He pleases males.

50.Mustaqim: Or He pairs them up as males and females, and He makes whom He pleases barren, for He is knowing and powerful.

51.Mustaqim: And it is not befitting for a human that Allah should talk to him except by revelation or from behind a barrier, or He sends a messenger to pass on of the revelation what He pleases by His permission, for He is knowing and wise.

52.Mustaqim: And this is how We revealed to you through a Spirit We command, you had no idea what the book was or the faith, but We made it a light to guide with it whom We please of Our servants, and you certainly guide towards a straight path.

53.Mustaqim: The path of Allah to whom belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, for sure to Allah return all matters.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: By the clear book.

3.Mustaqim: We made it an Arabic reading (Qur´an) so that  you might understand.

4.Mustaqim: And in the original book with Us it is exalted and wise.

5.Mustaqim: Should We then withdraw the reminder from you entirely because you are wasteful people?

6.Mustaqim: And how many a prophet have We sent to the earliest communities.

7.Mustaqim: And whenever a prophet came to them, they made fun of him.

8.Mustaqim: So We destroyed those with a grip stronger than theirs and the example of the earliest communities came to pass.

9.Mustaqim: And if you asked them who created the heavens and the earth, they will say: the mighty and knowing has created them.

10.Mustaqim: The One who gave you the earth as an expanse and cut paths in it for you so that you might be guided.

11.Mustaqim: And the One who sent water from the sky in measure, then We revive with it a dead land; likewise you will be brought out.

12.Mustaqim: And the One who created all pairs and gave you the ship and the cattle which you mount.

13.Mustaqim: So that you are well established on them, then remember the blessings of your Lord when you are established on them and say: glorified is He who made this subservient to us, we could not have subjected them.

14.Mustaqim: And we will turn to our Lord.

15.Mustaqim: And they assign for Him a portion of His (own) servants, for man is clearly ungrateful.

16.Mustaqim: Has He then taken daughters from what He created and chosen for you sons?

17.Mustaqim: And when any of them is given news of what they coin as a likeness for the Merciful, his face darkens and he is upset:

18.Mustaqim: Someone brought up amongst pleasantries - and he cannot sustain the argument.

19.Mustaqim: And they make the angels who are amongst the servants of Allah female. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded and they will be asked.

20.Mustaqim: And they say: if the Merciful pleased, we would not serve them besides Him. They have no knowledge of this, for they only guess.

21.Mustaqim: Or did We give them a book before so that they hold on to it?

22.Mustaqim: But they say: we found our fathers upon a practice and we are guided by their traditions.

23.Mustaqim: And this is how We never sent a warner before you to a town but its affluent people said: we found our fathers upon a practice and we emulate their traditions.

24.Mustaqim: He said: what if I brought you something better guided than what you found your fathers doing? They said: we reject what you have been sent with.

25.Mustaqim: So We took revenge on them, then see what the outcome of those who denied was like.

26.Mustaqim: And when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father and his people: I am free of what you serve.

27.Mustaqim: Except for the One who originated me, for He will guide me.

28.Mustaqim: And He made this into a lasting word amongst his descendants so they would return.

29.Mustaqim: But I have given provision to those and their fathers until the truth reaches them and a clearly spoken messenger.

30.Mustaqim: And when the truth reached them, they said: this is magic and we reject it.

31.Mustaqim: And they said: why was not this Qur´an revealed to a man of the two great towns?

32.Mustaqim: Do they divide the mercy of your Lord? We divide amongst them their livelihood in the worldly life and raised some of them above others in stages so that some of them take others in service, and the mercy of your Lord is better than what they amass.

33.Mustaqim: And if it wouldn´t turn mankind into a single community We would have granted those who reject the Merciful silver roofs on their houses and stairs on which they ascend.

34.Mustaqim: And (silver) doors for their houses and couches on which they recline.

35.Mustaqim: And golden decorations, but all of that would only be the provision of this world, and the hereafter with your Lord is for those who beware.

36.Mustaqim: And whoever is blind to the reminder of the Merciful, We assign for him a devil who will be a friend for him.

37.Mustaqim: And they divert them from the way but they think that they are guided.

38.Mustaqim: Until when he comes to Us he says: if only there was the distance of the two Easts between me and you, what a bad friend.

39.Mustaqim: And today it will not benefit you, if you did wrong, that you will share the punishment.

40.Mustaqim: Can you then make the deaf hear or guide the blind or who is in clear error?

41.Mustaqim: And if We take you away, We will take revenge on them.

42.Mustaqim: Or if We show you what We have promised them, We have power over them.

43.Mustaqim: So hold on to that which has been revealed to you, for you are on a straight path.

44.Mustaqim: And it is a reminder for you and your people, and you will soon be asked.

45.Mustaqim: And ask the messengers whom We sent before you, did We allow gods besides the Merciful to be served?

46.Mustaqim: And We sent Musa (Moses) with Our signs to Pharaoh and his leaders and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of all worlds.

47.Mustaqim: Then when he came to them with Our signs, they made fun of them.

48.Mustaqim: And every sign We showed them was greater than the previous one, and We overtook them with the punishment so that they might turn back.

49.Mustaqim: And they said: oh you magician, call your Lord for us on account of what He has promised to you, for we will be guided.

50.Mustaqim: Then when We removed the punishment from them, they broke their promise.

51.Mustaqim: And Pharaoh announced amongst his people, saying: oh my people, do I not own the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers which flow before me? Don´t you see?

52.Mustaqim: Am I not better than him who is a low cast and can hardly speak clearly?

53.Mustaqim: Then why have not golden bracelets been given to him or did the angels come in tow with him?

54.Mustaqim: So he fooled his people and they obeyed him, for they were sinful people.

55.Mustaqim: Then when they provoked Us We took revenge on them and drowned them altogether.

56.Mustaqim: Then We made them a precedent and an example for those to come.

57.Mustaqim: And when the son of Maryam (Mary) is given as an example, your people protest against it.

58.Mustaqim: And they say: are our gods better or he? They only present it to you as a contradiction, for they are argumentative people.

59.Mustaqim: For he is only a servant whom We have favoured and made him an example for the Children of Israel.

60.Mustaqim: And if We pleased, We could replace you with angels to be successors on the earth.

61.Mustaqim: And there is sure knowledge of the hour, so do not doubt it, and follow me, that is a straight path.

62.Mustaqim: And let not the devil divert you, for he is a clear enemy to you.

63.Mustaqim: And when ´Isa (Jesus) came with clear proofs he said: I have brought you wisdom and am to clarify to you some of that in which you differed, so beware of Allah and obey me.

64.Mustaqim: For Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him. This is a straight path.

65.Mustaqim: Then the allies differed amongst themselves, so woe to those who do wrong from the punishment of a painful day.

66.Mustaqim: Do they just wait that the hour reaches them suddenly when they are not aware?

67.Mustaqim: Close friends will be enemies to each other on that day, except those who beware (of Allah).

68.Mustaqim: Oh My servants, you shall not fear today nor shall you worry.

69.Mustaqim: Those who believe in Our signs and did submit (as Muslims).

70.Mustaqim: Enter the garden, you and your partners, happily.

71.Mustaqim: They will be waited upon with golden plates and cups and it will contain whatever the souls desire and what the eyes delight in, and you will remain there forever.

72.Mustaqim: And this is the garden which you have inherited on account of what you did.

73.Mustaqim: You have lots of fruit in it and eat from it.

74.Mustaqim: For the sinful remain in the punishment of hell-fire.

75.Mustaqim: It will not be lightened for them and they will be left with nothing.

76.Mustaqim: And We did not wrong them, but they were the wrongdoers.

77.Mustaqim: And they will call: oh angel, let your Lord finish us off. He will say: you will stay.

78.Mustaqim: We previously brought you the truth, but most of you disliked the truth.

79.Mustaqim: Or do they decide any matter? We decide.

80.Mustaqim: Or do they think that We do not hear their secrets and secret meetings? But no, Our messengers are with them, recording.

81.Mustaqim: Say: if the Merciful had a son, then I would be the first to serve (him).

82.Mustaqim: Glorified is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the throne, above what they make out.

83.Mustaqim: So leave them to busy themselves and play until they meet their promised day.

84.Mustaqim: And He is god in the heaven and god on earth, and He is the wise and knowing.

85.Mustaqim: Exalted is He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and He has knowledge of the hour and to Him you return.

86.Mustaqim: And those whom they call besides Him have no power of intercession except for him who is a witness to the truth and with knowledge.

87.Mustaqim: And if you were to ask them who created them, they would say: Allah. So where to are they diverted?

88.Mustaqim: And his saying (will be): oh my Lord, these people did not believe.

89.Mustaqim: So ignore them and say: peace, for they will soon know.

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: By the clear book.

3.Mustaqim: We revealed it during a blessed night, for We continually issued warnings.

4.Mustaqim: During it every matter to be judged is decided.

5.Mustaqim: A command from Us, for We continually sent (messengers).

6.Mustaqim: As mercy from your Lord, for He listens and knows.

7.Mustaqim: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you are certain.

8.Mustaqim: There is no god but He, He gives life and death, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

9.Mustaqim: But they play whilst in doubt.

10.Mustaqim: So look out for a day when the sky brings clear smoke.

11.Mustaqim: Which surrounds people, that is a painful punishment.

12.Mustaqim: Our Lord, remove the punishment from us, for we believe.

13.Mustaqim: How can they have a reminder (now), when a clear messenger came to them before?

14.Mustaqim: Then they turned away and said: he has been taught and is possessed.

15.Mustaqim: We will remove the punishment a little, for you will return.

16.Mustaqim: On the day We take a major grip, for We take revenge.

17.Mustaqim: And We tested before them the people of Pharaoh and an honourable messenger came to them.

18.Mustaqim: (Saying): Return to me the servants of Allah, for I am a reliable messenger to you.

19.Mustaqim: And do not exalt against Allah, for I have brought you a clear authority.

20.Mustaqim: And I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord that you would abuse me.

21.Mustaqim: And if you do not believe me then leave me alone.

22.Mustaqim: Then he called his Lord that these people are sinful.

23.Mustaqim: So travel with My servants at night, for you will be followed.

24.Mustaqim: And leave through the sea calmly, for they are forces to be drowned.

25.Mustaqim: How many gardens and springs did they leave behind.

26.Mustaqim: And plantations and honoured dwellings.

27.Mustaqim: And blessings which they enjoyed.

28.Mustaqim: This is what happened, and We made others inherit them.

29.Mustaqim: And the sky and the earth did not cry for them, and they were not spared.

30.Mustaqim: And We did rescue the Children of Israel from the humiliating punishment.

31.Mustaqim: From Pharaoh, for he was extravagantly wasteful.

32.Mustaqim: And We knowingly chose them above everybody else.

33.Mustaqim: And We gave them signs which contained a clear test.

34.Mustaqim: For these say:

35.Mustaqim: There is only our first death, and we will not be raised.

36.Mustaqim: Then bring our forefathers, if you are truthful.

37.Mustaqim: Are they better or the people of Tubba´ (in Yemen) and those before them, We destroyed them, for they were sinful.

38.Mustaqim: And We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between as a pastime.

39.Mustaqim: We only created them with the truth, but most of them don´t know.

40.Mustaqim: The day of division is the appointment for all of them.

41.Mustaqim: The day when no protector will benefit his protégée the least and they will not be helped.

42.Mustaqim: Except for the one on whom Allah has mercy, for he is the mighty and merciful.

43.Mustaqim: For the tree of Zaqqum,

44.Mustaqim: Is the food of the sinner,

45.Mustaqim: Like lava bubbling in the bellies,

46.Mustaqim: Like the bubbling of boiling water.

47.Mustaqim: Take him and carry him into the midst of hell-fire.

48.Mustaqim: Then pour the punishment of boiling water over his head.

49.Mustaqim: Taste it, for you are the mighty and honourable.

50.Mustaqim: For this is what you doubted.

51.Mustaqim: Those who beware (of Allah) will be in a safe place.

52.Mustaqim: In gardens and springs.

53.Mustaqim: They will wear silk and brocade, facing each other.

54.Mustaqim: This is how it is, and We will marry them to women of rare beauty.

55.Mustaqim: They will ask there for any kind of fruit in safety.

56.Mustaqim: They will not taste death there after the first death, and He will protect them from the punishment of hell-fire.

57.Mustaqim: A favour from your Lord, that is the ultimate success.

58.Mustaqim: And We have made it easy (to recite) in your language so that they might reflect.

59.Mustaqim: So watch out, for they will watch out.

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: The revelation of the book is from Allah the mighty and wise.

3.Mustaqim: In the heavens and the earth there are signs for the believers.

4.Mustaqim: And in your creation and in the creatures He spread out are signs for people who are certain.

5.Mustaqim: And in the alternation of night and day and the provision Allah has sent from the sky to revive with it the earth after its death and the turning of the winds are signs for people who understand.

6.Mustaqim: These are the signs of Allah which We recite to you in truth, so in what tale after Allah and His signs do they believe?

7.Mustaqim: Woe to every sinful liar.

8.Mustaqim: Who hears the signs of Allah recited to him, then he arrogantly persists as if he did not hear them, so announce to him a painful punishment.

9.Mustaqim: And if he comes to know of any of Our signs he makes fun of them; for those is a humiliating punishment.

10.Mustaqim: Hell will follow them and what they have gathered will not benefit them nor that they took protectors besides Allah, and theirs is a severe punishment.

11.Mustaqim: This is a guidance, and for those who reject the signs of their Lord is a punishment of painful affliction.

12.Mustaqim: Allah is who made of service to you the sea so that the ship sails on it by His command and you seek of His favours in order to be grateful.

13.Mustaqim: And He made of service to you what is in the heavens and what is on earth, entirely from Him, these are signs for people who reflect.

14.Mustaqim: Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not hope for the days of Allah, so that He may reward people in line with what they did.

15.Mustaqim: Whoever does good, it is for himself, and who does bad, it is against himself, then you return to your Lord.

16.Mustaqim: And We gave the Children of Israel the book and the judgement and the prophethood and provided them with good food and favoured them over everybody else.

17.Mustaqim: And We gave them clear proofs by way of the commandments, then they did not differ except after the knowledge had reached them out of transgression amongst each other, for your Lord will decide between them on the day of resurrection with regard to what they used to differ in.

18.Mustaqim: Then We placed you upon a code of conduct by way of commandments, so follow them and do not follow the desires of those who don´t know.

19.Mustaqim: For they will not benefit you the least with Allah, and the wrongdoers are protectors of each other, and Allah is the protector of those who beware (of Him).

20.Mustaqim: This is an eye-opener for mankind and a guidance and a mercy for people who are certain.

21.Mustaqim: Or do those who commit bad think that We make them equal to those who believe and do good during their lives and after death? They judge badly.

22.Mustaqim: And Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth and so that every soul will be rewarded for what it committed and they will not be wronged.

23.Mustaqim: Have you considered the one who takes his desire as god and Allah lets him go astray knowingly and seals his hearing and heart and places a blindfold over his eyes, so who will guide him after Allah, don´t you reflect?

24.Mustaqim: And they say: there is only our worldly life, we die and live, and only time destroys us, and they have no knowledge about it, they only presume.

25.Mustaqim: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, their argument is only that they say: bring our forefathers if you are truthful.

26.Mustaqim: Say: Allah gives you life, then He makes you die, then He gathers you to the day of  resurrection in which there is no doubt, but most people don´t know.

27.Mustaqim: And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and on the day the hour happens, on that day the followers of falsehood are losers.

28.Mustaqim: And you will see every community kneeling down; every community will be called towards its record: today you will be rewarded for what you used to do.

29.Mustaqim: This is Our record which speaks to you with the truth, for We used to write down what you used to do.

30.Mustaqim: Then as for those who believed and did good, their Lord will enter them into His mercy, that is the clear success.

31.Mustaqim: And as for those who rejected (the truth): were not My signs recited to you but you were arrogant and were sinful people?

32.Mustaqim: And when it was said that the promise of Allah is true and there is no doubt about the hour you said: we have no idea what the hour is, we follow only assumptions and we are not sure.

33.Mustaqim: And they become aware of the bad they had committed and what they used to make fun of overcame them.

34.Mustaqim: And it is said: today We forget you just as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours and your abode is the fire and you have no helpers.

35.Mustaqim: This is because you made fun of the signs of Allah and the worldly life deceived you, so today they will not emerge from it and they will not be allowed redress.

36.Mustaqim: So Allah is praised, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of all worlds.

37.Mustaqim: And to Him belongs greatness in the heavens and on earth, and He is the mighty and wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Mustaqim: Ha Mim.

2.Mustaqim: The revelation of the book is from Allah the mighty and wise.

3.Mustaqim: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except with truth and for a fixed term, and those who reject (the truth) turn away from what they have been warned of.

4.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered that which you call on besides Allah? Show me what they created of the earth, or do they have a share in the heavens? Bring me a book preceding this one or a trace of knowledge if you are truthful.

5.Mustaqim: And who is more astray than who calls besides Allah on those who will not respond to him until the day of resurrection and who are unaware of their prayers?

6.Mustaqim: And when mankind is gathered, they will be enemies to them and will reject their service.

7.Mustaqim: And when Our clear signs are recited to them, those who reject (the truth) say about the truth when it reaches them: this is plain magic.

8.Mustaqim: Or do they say he invented it? Say: if I invented it, then you are powerless to help me against Allah, He knows best what you engage in, He is sufficient as witness between me and you and He is the forgiving and merciful.

9.Mustaqim: Say: I am not the first of the messengers, and I don´t know what will happen to me nor to you, I only follow what has been revealed to me and I am only a clear warner.

10.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered that if it is from Allah and you reject it - whereas a witness from the Children of Israel gives evidence to something similar, then he believes - that you are arrogant? For Allah does not guide wrongdoing people.

11.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) say to those who believe: if it was good, they would not have got it before us. And as they are not guided by it they will say: this is an ancient falsehood.

12.Mustaqim: And before it came the book of Musa (Moses) as a guide and mercy, and this book is a confirmation in the Arabic language to warn those who do wrong and give good news to those who do good.

13.Mustaqim: Those who say: our Lord is Allah, then uphold it, they shall have no fear nor worry.

14.Mustaqim: Those are the inhabitants of the garden in which they remain as a reward for what they used to do.

15.Mustaqim: And We admonished man to be good to his parents. His mother carried him in discomfort and gave birth to him in discomfort, and carrying and weaning him takes thirty months, then finally when he reaches full strength and reaches forty years he says: my Lord, grant me that I am grateful for your blessings which You have blessed me with and my parents and that I do good work which You will be pleased with, and make my children good for me, for I turn to You and am of those who have submitted (as Muslims).

16.Mustaqim: Those are the ones of whom We will accept the best of what they did and whose bad deeds We disregard from amongst the inhabitants of the garden, a true promise that they were given.

17.Mustaqim: And he who says to his parents: get off, are you promising me that I will be raised when generations before me have gone by? And they implore Allah, (saying) woe to you, believe, for the promise of Allah is true, but he says: these are only stories of old.

18.Mustaqim: Those are the ones upon whom the word has come true (as it did) amongst the communities of Jinn and mankind who have passed before them, for they were losers.

19.Mustaqim: For all there are stages on account of what they did, and He will repay them their deeds and they will not be wronged.

20.Mustaqim: On the day those who reject (the truth) are presented to the fire: you spent all the good you had in your worldly life and enjoyed it, so today you will be rewarded with a humiliating punishment for having been arrogant on earth without right and for having been corrupt.

21.Mustaqim: And remember the brother of ´Ad when he warned his people in the sand dunes, and there have been warnings before him and after him, that you should not serve anyone but Allah, for I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.

22.Mustaqim: They said: did you come to us to divert us from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us if you are truthful.

23.Mustaqim: He said: knowledge rests with Allah, and I convey to you what I was sent with, but I see you are ignorant people.

24.Mustaqim: Then when they saw clouds approaching their valleys they said: these are clouds to bring us rain. But it is what you were in a hurry for: a wind containing a painful punishment.

25.Mustaqim: It destroys everything by the command of its Lord, so they ended up with only their homes left to be seen; this is how we punish the sinful people.

26.Mustaqim: And We had established them more than We established you and gave them hearing and eyesight and hearts, but neither their hearing nor their eyesight nor their hearts benefited them the least when they disputed the signs of Allah, and what they used to make fun of overcame them.

27.Mustaqim: And We destroyed towns around you before and explained the signs so that they might turn back.

28.Mustaqim: Then why did not those whom they adopted as gods to endear them to Allah help them? But they deserted them, and that is their falsehood and what they used to invent.

29.Mustaqim: And when We dispatched to you a group of the Jinn to listen to the Qur´an, then when they were in its presence they said: be quiet, then when it was completed, they went back to their people as warners.

30.Mustaqim: They said: oh our people, we have listened to a book which has been revealed after Musa (Moses), confirming what came before it, which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

31.Mustaqim: Oh our people, respond to the invitation of Allah and believe in Him, He will forgive you of your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

32.Mustaqim: And whoever does not respond to the invitation from Allah, he will not escape on earth and will have no protectors besides Him, those are in clear error.

33.Mustaqim: Do they not consider that Allah, the One who created the heavens and the earth and did not tire of their creation, is able to revive the dead, for sure He is able to do anything.

34.Mustaqim: And on the day those who rejected (the truth) are presented to the fire (it is said): is this not true? They will say: Sure, by our Lord. So taste the punishment because you used to reject (the truth).

35.Mustaqim: So be patient like those firm amongst the messengers were patient, and do not be in a hurry for them; on the day they see what they were promised it is as if they will not have stayed except an hour of the day. This is a declaration, so will anyone but the sinful people be destroyed?

1.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) and divert from the way of Allah, their work is lost.

2.Mustaqim: And those who believe and do good work and believe in what has been revealed to Muhammad, which is the truth from your Lord, He will cancel their bad deeds and improve their situation.

3.Mustaqim: That is because those who reject (the truth) follow falsehood and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord; this is how Allah coins their examples for mankind.

4.Mustaqim: So when you meet those who reject (the truth) - until the war settles -, strike their necks until you have weakened them, then tie them up firmly, after which you may be generous or ransom them; that is how it is, and if Allah pleased, He could have struck them down, but it is for Him to test some of you through others, and those who are killed in the way of Allah, their work will not be lost.

5.Mustaqim: He will guide them and improve their situation.

6.Mustaqim: And enter them into the garden which He has made known to them.

7.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, if you help Allah, Allah helps you and makes your foothold firm.

8.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth), they will be ruined and their work is lost.

9.Mustaqim: That is because they disliked what Allah revealed, so He wastes their work.

10.Mustaqim: Do they not travel on earth and see what the outcome was like for those before them? Allah brought destruction upon them, and for those who reject (the truth) is a similar fate.

11.Mustaqim: This is because Allah is the protector of the believers and those who reject (the truth) have no protector.

12.Mustaqim: Allah enters those who believe and do good work into gardens through which rivers flow, and those who reject (the truth) will have enjoyment and eat like the cattle eat, and the fire is their home.

13.Mustaqim: And how many towns which were stronger than your town, which threw you out, did We destroy and they had no helper.

14.Mustaqim: Is then one who follows clear proof from his Lord like one to whom his bad deeds appeal and they follow their desires?

15.Mustaqim: The likeness of the garden, those who beware (of Allah) have been promised: there are rivers of water which is not polluted and rivers of milk which does not change its taste and rivers of wine which is pleasant for those who drink it and rivers of pure honey, and they will have all kinds of fruit there and forgiveness from their Lord; unlike those who remain in the fire and are given boiling water to drink, so it cuts their intestines.

16.Mustaqim: And amongst them is he who listens to you until when they emerge from your presence they say to those who were given knowledge: what did he just say? Those are the ones whose hearts Allah has sealed and they follow their desires.

17.Mustaqim: And those who follow the guidance, He increases them in guidance and gives them their awareness.

18.Mustaqim: Are they then only waiting that the hour is upon them suddenly, whilst its signs have already come? So what reminder will they have when it reaches them?

19.Mustaqim: Know then that there is no god but Allah and seek forgiveness for your sins and for the believing men and women, and Allah knows your movements and your abode.

20.Mustaqim: And the believers say: why is no Surah being revealed? Then when a decisive Surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at you as if surrounded by death - more befitting for them would be:

21.Mustaqim: Obedience and appropriate words, then, once the matter has been decided, if they were true to Allah it would be better for them.

22.Mustaqim: Would you not, if you turn away, cause corruption on earth and cut off your family ties?

23.Mustaqim: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed and whom He makes deaf and blinds their eyesight.

24.Mustaqim: Do they not reflect on the Qur´an? Or are there locks upon their hearts?

25.Mustaqim: Those who turn their backs after the guidance has been made clear to them, the devil gives them suggestions and hope.

26.Mustaqim: That is because they say to those who dislike what Allah has sent: we obey you in some matters, and Allah knows their secrets.

27.Mustaqim: So how will it be when the angels take them away and strike their faces and backs?

28.Mustaqim: That is because they followed what displeases Allah and dislike His pleasure, so He wastes their work.

29.Mustaqim: Or do those with a disease in their hearts think that Allah will not expose their grudges?

30.Mustaqim: And if We pleased, We would show them to you so that you know them by their mark, but you will know them from the way they talk, and Allah knows your work.

31.Mustaqim: We shall test you until We know those who strive amongst you and those who have patience, and We shall test your intelligence.

32.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) and divert from the way of Allah and break away from the messenger after the guidance has been made clear to them, they will not harm Allah the least, and He will waste their work.

33.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, obey Allah and obey the messenger and do not spoil your work.

34.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) and divert from the way of Allah and then die in rejection, Allah will not forgive them.

35.Mustaqim: So do not lose heart and call for a truce when you will come out on top, and Allah is with you and will not deprive you of your work.

36.Mustaqim: For the life of this world is only play and pastime, and if  you believe and beware, He will give you your reward and will not ask you for your wealth.

37.Mustaqim: If He asked you for it and persisted you would withhold and He would expose your  grudges.

38.Mustaqim: You are the ones called to spend in the way of Allah, but amongst you is he who withholds - and whoever withholds only withholds from himself, and Allah is rich and you are poor; and if you turn away He will replace you with a different people who will not be like you.

1.Mustaqim: We have given you a clear victory.

2.Mustaqim: So that Allah forgives you any sin that has been and that is to come and completes His favours upon you and guides you on a straight path.

3.Mustaqim: And so that Allah helps you with mighty support.

4.Mustaqim: He is who sent tranquillity into the hearts of the believers to increase them further in their faith, and to Allah belong the forces of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is knowing and wise.

5.Mustaqim: So that He enters the believing men and women into gardens through which rivers flow, where they will remain, and cancels their bad deeds, and this is the ultimate success with Allah.

6.Mustaqim: And punishes the pretending men and women and idolatrous men and women who thought bad of Allah - the bad turns back on them, and Allah is angry with them and curses them and promises them hell, a bad destination.

7.Mustaqim: And to Allah belong the forces of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is mighty and wise.

8.Mustaqim: We sent you as a witness and bringer of good news and a warner.

9.Mustaqim: So that you would believe in Allah and His messenger and strengthen him and defend him and glorify Him in the mornings and evenings.

10.Mustaqim: Those who pledged allegiance to you have pledged allegiance to Allah; Allah´s hand was above their hands. Then if someone falls short, he falls short against himself, and if someone keeps what he promised to Allah, He will give him a tremendous reward.

11.Mustaqim: Those desert Arabs who stayed behind will say to you: our wealth and families kept us busy, so forgive us. They say with their mouths what is not in their hearts. Say: then who has any power for you over Allah if He wants harm or benefit for you? But Allah is informed of what you do.

12.Mustaqim: But you thought that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that appealed to you in your hearts and you thought bad and were ruined as people.

13.Mustaqim: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His messenger, We have promised a flame for those who reject (the truth).

14.Mustaqim: And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; He forgives whom He pleases and punishes whom He pleases, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

15.Mustaqim: Those who stayed behind say when you leave to acquire booty: allow us to follow you. They want to change the word of Allah. Say: you will not follow us; this is what Allah said before. Then they will say: you only envy us - but they hardly understand.

16.Mustaqim: Say to the desert Arabs who stayed behind: you will be called against a people with terrifying strength whom you will fight unless they surrender, then if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward, and if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.

17.Mustaqim: There is no blame on the blind, nor is there blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick, and whoever obeys Allah and His messenger, He enters him into the gardens through which rivers flow, and whoever turns away, He punishes him with a painful punishment.

18.Mustaqim: Allah was content with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts and sent tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with a near victory.

19.Mustaqim: And much booty for them to acquire, and Allah is mighty and wise.

20.Mustaqim: And Allah promised you that you would acquire much booty and sped this up for you and kept the people´s hands off you, to make it a sign for the believers and to guide you on a straight path.

21.Mustaqim: And more which you have not yet obtained but which Allah has full knowledge of, and Allah is able to do anything.

22.Mustaqim: And if those who reject (the truth) fought you, they would turn their backs and then not find any protector or helper.

23.Mustaqim: The custom of Allah which has gone before, and you will not find a change in the custom of Allah.

24.Mustaqim: And He is who kept their hands off you and your hands off them in the valley of Makkah after He had given you victory over them, and Allah saw what you did.

25.Mustaqim: They are the ones who reject (the truth) and prevent you from the sacred mosque and the intercepted offering from reaching its destination, and if there were not believing men and believing women whom you don´t know and whom you would pass over and for whom you would unknowingly be to blame - for Allah enters into His mercy whom He pleases -, if those had left We would have punished those who reject (the truth) amongst them with a painful punishment.

26.Mustaqim: When those who reject (the truth) placed rage into their hearts, the rage of ignorance, Allah sent His tranquillity upon His messenger and upon the believers and held them to the word of awareness (that there is no god but Allah), which they had most right to and which belonged to them, and Allah knows everything.

27.Mustaqim: Allah has verified His messenger´s vision with the truth that you will enter the sacred mosque, if Allah pleases, safe, with shaved and cropped heads, without fear, for He knew what you did not know and gave a near victory besides that.

28.Mustaqim: He is who sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it manifest over all religion, and Allah is sufficient as a witness.

29.Mustaqim: Muhammad is the messenger of Allah, and those with him are stern against those who reject (the truth) and merciful amongst themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, seeking favours from Allah and approval. Their marks are on their faces from the traces of prostration. That is their likeness in the Torah, and their likeness in the Gospel is that of a seed from which a shoot emerges, then strengthens, then rises straight from its stalk to please the planter and to annoy those who reject (the truth). Allah has promised those of them who believe and do good forgiveness and an immenses reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not put yourselves before Allah and His messenger and beware of Allah, for Allah listens and knows.

2.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet and do not talk loudly with him like you do with each other so that your work would be wasted whilst you don´t realise.

3.Mustaqim: Those who subdue their voices near the messenger of Allah, they are those whose hearts Allah has purified towards awareness; for them is forgiveness and a tremendous reward.

4.Mustaqim: Those who call you from behind your private rooms, most of them don´t understand.

5.Mustaqim: And if they had patience until you come out to them, it would be better for them, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

6.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, if a sinner comes to you with information, verify it before you afflict people in ignorance and then regret what you have done.

7.Mustaqim: And know that the messenger of Allah is amongst you. If he followed you in many matters, you would be in trouble, but Allah made faith dear to you and made it appealing in your hearts and made you dislike rejection and sin and transgression - those are the righteous.

8.Mustaqim: As a favour and blessing from Allah, and Allah is knowing and wise.

9.Mustaqim: And if two groups of believers fight, make peace between them, then if one of them transgresses against the other, fight the one which transgresses until it returns to the command of Allah, then when it returns, make peace between them with impartiality and be just, for Allah loves the just.

10.Mustaqim: For the believers are brothers, so make peace between your brothers and beware of Allah in order to receive mercy.

11.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, let not one people make fun of another people, perhaps they are better than them, nor let some women make fun of other women, perhaps they are better than them, and do not talk bad of each other nor call each other derogatory names - bad is a name of immorality after faith -, and those who do not repent are the wrongdoers.

12.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, greatly shun assumptions, for some assumptions are sinful, and do not spy nor backbite about each other. Would any of you want to eat the flesh of his dead brother? No, you dislike it. And beware of Allah, for Allah is accepting and merciful.

13.Mustaqim: Oh mankind, We have created you from male and female and made you into clans and tribes so that you know each other. The most honoured amongst you before Allah is the most aware (of Him) amongst you, for Allah is knowing and informed.

14.Mustaqim: The desert Arabs say: we believe. Say: you don´t believe yet, but say: we submit, and faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His messenger He will not deprive you of any of your work, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.

15.Mustaqim: For the believers are those who believe in Allah and His messenger and then have no doubt and strive with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah, those are the truthful.

16.Mustaqim: Say: are you teaching Allah your religion? And Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and Allah knows everything.

17.Mustaqim: They consider it as a favour to you that they have submitted. Say: don´t consider your submission a favour to me, but Allah did you a favour that He guided you to faith if you are truthful.

18.Mustaqim: For Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and Allah sees what you do.

1.Mustaqim: Qaf. By the glorious Qur´an.

2.Mustaqim: But they are astonished that a warner from amongst themselves came to them, so those who reject (the truth) say: this is a strange thing.

3.Mustaqim: That when we have died and are dust, we will be brought back from beyond.

4.Mustaqim: We know what the earth takes of them, and with Us is a protected record.

5.Mustaqim: But they deny the truth when it reaches them and they are in a state of confusion.

6.Mustaqim: Don´t they look at the sky above them how We constructed it and ornamented it and it has no cracks?

7.Mustaqim: And We expanded the earth and placed on it stabilisers and made grow on it of every splendid species.

8.Mustaqim: As an enlightenment and reminder for every repenting servant.

9.Mustaqim: And We sent water as a blessing from the sky and grow with it gardens and crops from seed.

10.Mustaqim: And tall date trees with layered date clusters.

11.Mustaqim: As a provision for the servants (of Allah), and We revive with it a dead land. Likewise will be the resurrection.

12.Mustaqim: The people of Nuh (Noah) and the people around the waterhole (ar-Rass) and Thamud denied before them.

13.Mustaqim: And ´Ad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lut (Lot).

14.Mustaqim: And the inhabitants of the woodlands (al-Ayka) and the people of Tubba´ (in Yemen); they all denied the messengers, so the promise came true.

15.Mustaqim: Are We then exhausted by the first creation? But they are uncertain about the new creation.

16.Mustaqim: And We created man and know what his soul suggests to him and We are closer to him than his jugular vein.

17.Mustaqim: When the two who keep meeting (him) sit on the right and the left.

18.Mustaqim: He does not utter a word but there is an observer present with him.

19.Mustaqim: And the delirium of death comes in truth, that is what you tried to avoid.

20.Mustaqim: And the horn is blown, that is the promised day.

21.Mustaqim: And every soul comes with a driver and a witness.

22.Mustaqim: You were unaware of this, then We removed your covering from you and your eyesight today is firm.

23.Mustaqim: And his companion will say: this is what I have brought.

24.Mustaqim: Throw every obstinate rejecter (of the truth) into hell.

25.Mustaqim: Who forbids what is good in transgression and doubt.

26.Mustaqim: Who placed another god with Allah, so throw him into the severe punishment.

27.Mustaqim: His companion will say: our Lord, I did not cause him to be excessive, but he was in extensive error.

28.Mustaqim: He will say: do not argue before Me, I have already advanced My promise to you.

29.Mustaqim: The word will not be changed before Me, and I do not wrong My servants.

30.Mustaqim: On the day We will say to hell: are you full? and it will say: is there more?

31.Mustaqim: And the garden will be brought near to those who beware (of Allah), without distance.

32.Mustaqim: This is what you were promised for every one who repents and is mindful.

33.Mustaqim: Who fears the Merciful in secret and comes with a repentant heart.

34.Mustaqim: Enter it with peace, that is the day of eternity.

35.Mustaqim: They will have what they please there, and with Us is more.

36.Mustaqim: And how many generations have We destroyed before them with a stronger grip than theirs, so search the land, is there an escape?

37.Mustaqim: In this is a reminder for whoever has a heart or listens and is a witness.

38.Mustaqim: And We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, and no exhaustion afflicted Us.

39.Mustaqim: So have patience with what they say and glorify the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.

40.Mustaqim: And glorify Him during the night and after your prostrations.

41.Mustaqim: And listen out on the day the caller calls from a nearby place.

42.Mustaqim: On the day they hear the roar in truth, that is the day of resurrection.

43.Mustaqim: We give life and give death and to Us is the journey.

44.Mustaqim: On the day the earth will rapidly spit them out, that will be an easy assembly for Us.

45.Mustaqim: We know best what they say, and you are no tyrant over them, so remind with the Qur´an those who fear the promise.

1.Mustaqim: By those dispersing (winds).

2.Mustaqim: And those load-carrying (clouds).

3.Mustaqim: And those (ships) travelling with ease.

4.Mustaqim: And those (angels) arranging affairs.

5.Mustaqim: What you have been promised is true.

6.Mustaqim: And the repayment will take place.

7.Mustaqim: By the well-textured sky.

8.Mustaqim: You differ in your claims.

9.Mustaqim: Those are diverted from it who are avert.

10.Mustaqim: Death to the liars.

11.Mustaqim: Who are carelessly inattentive.

12.Mustaqim: They ask: when will the day of repayment be?

13.Mustaqim: The day when they will be tried on the fire.

14.Mustaqim: Taste your trial, this is what you were in a hurry for.

15.Mustaqim: Those who beware (of Allah) will be in gardens and springs.

16.Mustaqim: They will take what their Lord gives them, for they did good before then.

17.Mustaqim: They slept little at night.

18.Mustaqim: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.

19.Mustaqim: And in their wealth those who asked and the destitute had a right.

20.Mustaqim: And on the earth are signs for those who are certain.

21.Mustaqim: And in yourselves, so don´t you see?

22.Mustaqim: And in the heaven is your provision and what you have been promised.

23.Mustaqim: So by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth just as you are able to speak.

24.Mustaqim: Has the story of the honoured guests of Ibrahim (Abraham) reached you?

25.Mustaqim: When they entered upon him and said: peace. He said: Peace, oh unfamiliar people.

26.Mustaqim: Then he went back to his family and brought a well-fed calf.

27.Mustaqim: Then he put it before them and said: won´t you eat?

28.Mustaqim: Then he felt afraid of them. They said: fear not, and they gave him good news of a knowledgeable boy.

29.Mustaqim: Then his wife approached with a shriek and struck her face and said: a barren old woman?

30.Mustaqim: They said: this is what your Lord said, for He is wise and knowing.

31.Mustaqim: He said: So what have you come for, oh messengers?

32.Mustaqim: They said: we were sent to the sinful people.

33.Mustaqim: To send upon them stones of clay.

34.Mustaqim: Embossed by your Lord for the wasteful.

35.Mustaqim: So We took out all the believers who were there.

36.Mustaqim: And We did not find there except one household of those who submitted (as Muslims).

37.Mustaqim: And We left in it a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Mustaqim: And in Musa (Moses) when We send him to Pharaoh with a clear authority.

39.Mustaqim: Then he turned away with his support and said: a magician or possessed.

40.Mustaqim: So We overtook him and his forces and flung them into the sea whilst he blamed himself.

41.Mustaqim: And in ´Ad when We sent against them the relentless wind.

42.Mustaqim: It leaves nothing that it comes upon without turning it rotten.

43.Mustaqim: And in Thamud when they were told enjoy  yourselves for a while.

44.Mustaqim: So they violated the command of their Lord and the lightning struck them whilst they looked on.

45.Mustaqim: And they could neither stand up nor were they helped.

46.Mustaqim: And the people of Nuh (Noah) before, for they were sinful people.

47.Mustaqim: And We constructed the heaven with support and We are expanding it.

48.Mustaqim: And We spread out the earth and how well did We level it.

49.Mustaqim: And of everything We created pairs so that you would reflect.

50.Mustaqim: So flee to Allah, for I am a clear warner from Him to you.

51.Mustaqim: And do not place with Allah any other god, for I am a clear warner from Him to you.

52.Mustaqim: Likewise no messenger came to those before them but they said: a magician or possessed.

53.Mustaqim: Is this their legacy? But they are transgressing people.

54.Mustaqim: So turn away from them and you are not to blame.

55.Mustaqim: And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.

56.Mustaqim: And I did not create Jinn and mankind except to serve Me.

57.Mustaqim: I do not want provision from them and don´t want them to feed Me.

58.Mustaqim: For Allah is the provider with firm strength.

59.Mustaqim: And the wrongdoers will have their share just like the share of their companions, so let them not be in a hurry.

60.Mustaqim: And for those who reject (the truth) the day they have been promised will prove a calamity.

1.Mustaqim: By the mountain.

2.Mustaqim: And the book with the record.

3.Mustaqim: In spread-out scrolls.

4.Mustaqim: And the constantly visited house.

5.Mustaqim: And the raised canopy.

6.Mustaqim: And the overflowing sea.

7.Mustaqim: The punishment of your Lord will take place.

8.Mustaqim: It cannot be averted.
