9.Mustaqim: On the day the sky will sway.

10.Mustaqim: And the mountains will move.

11.Mustaqim: Woe on that day to those who deny.

12.Mustaqim: Who play in a bubble.

13.Mustaqim: The day they will be forced into the fire of hell.

14.Mustaqim: This is the fire you used to deny.

15.Mustaqim: Is this magic or don´t you see?

16.Mustaqim: Enter it, then have patience or don´t have patience, it will be the same for you, for you are rewarded for what you used to do.

17.Mustaqim: Those who beware (of Allah) will be in gardens and blessings.

18.Mustaqim: Enjoying what their Lord gave them, and their Lord guarded them from the punishment of hell-fire.

19.Mustaqim: Eat and drink legitimately on account of what you used to do.

20.Mustaqim: They will recline on couches arranged in rows, and We will marry them to women of rare beauty.

21.Mustaqim: And those who believed and their descendants followed them in faith, We unite them with their descendants and will not deprive them of any of their work; everyone will secure what he has earned.

22.Mustaqim: And We give them abundance of the fruit and meat they desire.

1.Mustaqim: Allah has heard the speech of her who disputed with you about her husband and complained to Allah, and Allah hears your discussion, for Allah listens and sees.

2.Mustaqim: Those of you who divorce their women by likening them to their mothers, they are not their mothers, their mothers are only those who gave birth to them, and they say something unacceptable and false, and Allah is lenient and forgiving.

3.Mustaqim: And those who divorce their women by likening them to their mothers and go back on their word, they must free a slave before the two touch, that is what you are admonished with, and Allah is informed of what you do.

4.Mustaqim: And who is unable, he must fast two consecutive months before the two touch, and he who does not find (the means) must feed sixty poor, that is in order for you to believe in Allah and His messenger, and these are the limits of Allah, and for those who reject (the truth) is a painful punishment.

5.Mustaqim: Those who transgress the limits of Allah and His messenger will be defeated just like those before them were defeated, and We have already sent clear proofs, and for those who reject (the truth) is a humiliating punishment.

6.Mustaqim: On the day Allah raises them all and informs them of what they did, Allah counted it and they forgot it, and Allah is a witness to everything.

7.Mustaqim: Don´t you see that Allah knows what is in the heavens and on earth, and there is not a secret meeting of three, but He is the fourth with them, nor of five, but He is the sixth with them, nor of less or more than that but He is with them wherever they are, then He informs them of what they did on the day of resurrection, for Allah knows everything.

8.Mustaqim: Don´t you see how those who were forbidden from secret meetings returned to what they were forbidden from and conspired to sin and rebellion and disobedience to the messenger, and when they came to you they greeted you in a way Allah does not have you greeted and say to themselves: why does Allah not punish us for what we say? Hell is enough for them, they will enter it, and it is a bad journey.

9.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, when you meet in secret, do not conspire to sin and rebellion and disobedience to the messenger, but conspire to righteousness and awareness (of Allah), and beware of Allah to whom you will be gathered.

10.Mustaqim: For secret meetings are from the devil so that he worries the believers, and he will not harm them at all except by the permission of Allah, and on Allah let the believers rely.

11.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, when you are told to make room in gatherings, make room, Allah will make room for  you, and when you are told to get up, get up, Allah will elevate those of you who believe and who were given knowledge in rank, and Allah is informed of what you do.

12.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, when you have a private meeting with the messenger, give charity in advance of your private meetings, that is better and purer for you, and if you don´t find (the means), then Allah is forgiving and merciful.

13.Mustaqim: Do you hesitate to give charity before your private meetings? If you don´t do it and Allah has turned to you in forgiveness, then keep up prayer and give Zakat and obey Allah and His messenger, and Allah is informed of what you do.

14.Mustaqim: Don´t you see those who befriend a people whom Allah is angry with, they are neither part of you nor them and knowingly swear upon a lie.

15.Mustaqim: Allah has promised them a severe punishment, for bad is what they used to do.

16.Mustaqim: They adopt their faith by way of protection then divert from the way of Allah, so theirs is a humiliating punishment.

17.Mustaqim: Neither their wealth nor children will help them the least against Allah; those are the inmates of the fire where they will remain.

18.Mustaqim: On the day Allah raises all of them and they swear to Him like they swore to you and think that they have a case, but no, they are liars.

19.Mustaqim: The devil has taken possession of them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah; those are the party of the devil, for sure the party of the devil are the losers.

20.Mustaqim: Those who transgress the limits of Allah and His messenger, those are the lowest.

21.Mustaqim: Allah has decreed that I and My messengers will win, for Allah is strong and mighty.

22.Mustaqim: You will not find people who believe in Allah and the last day showing love to those who transgress the limits of Allah and His messenger, even if they were their fathers or sons or brothers or families; for those, Allah has written faith in their hearts and helps them with a spirit from Him and enters them into gardens through which rivers flow where they will remain. Allah is content with them and they are content with Him. Those are the party of Allah, for sure the party of Allah are the successful.

1.Mustaqim: What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the mighty and wise.

2.Mustaqim: He is who expelled those who rejected (the truth) from the people of the Book from their homes for a first gathering. You did not think that they would come out, and they thought that their strongholds would keep Allah out, so Allah came to them from where they did not expect and cast fear into their hearts. They destroyed their houses with their own hands and the hands of the believers, so take a lesson oh you who see.

3.Mustaqim: And if Allah had not written expulsion for them, He would have punished them in this world and in the hereafter the punishment of the fire would be theirs.

4.Mustaqim: This is because they break away from Allah and His messenger, and whoever breaks away from Allah, then Allah is severe in punishment.

5.Mustaqim: You did not cut down a tree or leave it standing on its roots but with the permission of Allah and so that He would humiliate the sinful.

6.Mustaqim: And whatever Allah gave to His messenger from them, you did not spur on any horses or camels for it, but Allah gives His messengers control over what He pleases, and Allah is able to do anything.

7.Mustaqim: And whatever Allah gave to His messenger from the inhabitants of the towns, it belongs to Allah and His messenger and the relatives and the orphans and the poor and the traveller, so that it does not just circulate amongst the rich of you, and what the messenger gives you, take it, and what he forbids you, leave it, and beware of Allah, for Allah is severe in punishment.

8.Mustaqim: For the poor of the emigrants who left their homes and wealth to seek favour from Allah and contentment and help Allah and His messenger, those are the truthful.

9.Mustaqim: And those who prepared the home and had faith before they came, loving those who migrated to them and not finding within themselves any desire for what they were given and preferring them over themselves even if they were in poverty, and whoever is protected from the greed of his own soul, those are the successful.

10.Mustaqim: And those who came after them saying: our Lord forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and do not place in our hearts any spite towards those who believe, our Lord, for you are lenient and merciful.

11.Mustaqim: Have you not seen those who pretend, saying to their brothers who reject (the truth) from the people of the Book: if you are expelled, we will migrate with you and we will not obey anybody against you ever, and if you are fought, we will help you, and Allah is a witness that they are liars.

12.Mustaqim: If they are expelled, they do not migrate with them, and if they are fought, they do not help them, and if they were to help them, they would turn their backs, then they will not be helped.

13.Mustaqim: They have more fear in their hearts of you than of Allah, that is because they are people who do not understand.

14.Mustaqim: They will not fight you all out except from fortified towns or from behind walls, their adversity amongst themselves is strong, you think they are together, but their hearts are apart, that is because they are people who do not think.

15.Mustaqim: Like those before them nearby, they tasted the evil outcome of their affairs and a painful punishment is theirs.

16.Mustaqim: Like the devil when he says to man: reject (the truth), then when he rejects (it) he says: I am free of  you, for I fear Allah the Lord of all worlds.

17.Mustaqim: So the outcome of both is that they will be forever in the fire, and that is the punishment of the wrongdoers.

18.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, beware of Allah and let each soul mind what it sends ahead for tomorrow, and beware of Allah, for Allah is informed of what you do.

19.Mustaqim: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves, those are the sinful.

20.Mustaqim: The inhabitants of the fire and the inhabitants of the garden are not alike, the inhabitants of the garden are the successful.

21.Mustaqim: Had We sent this Qur´an onto a mountain you would see it break down out of fear of Allah, and these are the examples We coin for mankind so that they reflect.

22.Mustaqim: He is Allah the One besides whom there is no god, who knows the unseen and the apparent, He is the owner and giver of mercy.

23.Mustaqim: He is Allah the One besides whom there is no god, the king, the holy, the origin of peace, the safeguard, the controller, the mighty, the compelling, the elevated, glorified is Allah above what they associate.

24.Mustaqim: He is Allah the creator, the originator, the artist, to him belong the most beautiful names, whatever is in the heavens and on earth glorifies Him, and He is the mighty, the wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not take My enemy and your enemy as protectors, showing love towards them when they have rejected the truth you have received and expelled the messenger and you because you believe in Allah, your Lord, when you go out striving in My way and seeking My contentment, but you secretly show love towards them, and I know best what you conceal and what you disclose, and whoever amongst you does that, he has strayed from the level way.

2.Mustaqim: When they get hold of you they are enemies to you and stretch their hands out against you and talk bad of you and love that you would reject (the truth).

3.Mustaqim: Your family ties and children will not benefit you on the day of resurrection when He will judge between you, and Allah sees what you do.

4.Mustaqim: There is a beautiful example for you in Ibrahim (Abraham) and those with him when they said to their people: we are free of you and what you serve besides Allah, we reject you, and enmity and hatred will forever exist between us until you believe in Allah alone; except for Ibrahim (Abraham) saying to his father: I will ask forgiveness for you, and I cannot avail you the least before Allah; our Lord, on You we rely and to You we repent and to You is the journey.

5.Mustaqim: Our Lord, do not make us a target for those who reject (the truth), and forgive us, our Lord, for You are the mighty and wise.

6.Mustaqim: There is a beautiful example for you in them for whoever hopes for Allah and the last day, and whoever turns away, Allah is rich and praiseworthy.

7.Mustaqim: Perhaps Allah will place love between you and your enemies, and Allah is capable, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

8.Mustaqim: Allah does not stop you from doing good and being just to those who did not fight you due to religion and did not expel you from your houses, for Allah loves the just.

9.Mustaqim: Allah only stops you from befriending those who fought you and expelled you from your houses and helped in your expulsion, and whoever befriends them, those are the wrongdoers.

10.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, when emigrating believing women come to you, test them. Allah knows best about their faith. Then when you find them to be believers, do not return them to those who reject (the truth) - they are not permitted for each other. And give them what they have spent, and it is no sin for  you to marry them if you give them their dues, and do not hold on to the bonds with those who reject (the truth), but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent, that is the judgement of Allah who judges between you, and Allah is knowing and wise.

11.Mustaqim: And if you have lost wives to those who reject (the truth), and you have obtained booty, then give those who have lost their wives the measure of what they have spent and beware of Allah in whom you believe.

12.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, when the believing women come to you, let them give allegiance to you that they will not associate anything with Allah and will not steal nor fornicate nor kill their children nor come up with some false invented claim regarding the parentage of their children nor disobey you in anything appropriate. So let them give allegiance and ask forgiveness from Allah for them, for Allah is forgiving and merciful.

13.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, do not befriend a people with whom Allah is angry, they despair of the hereafter like those who reject (the truth) despair of the inhabitants of the graves.

1.Mustaqim: What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, and He is the mighty and wise.

2.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, why do you say what you don´t do?

3.Mustaqim: It is highly offensive to Allah that you say what you don´t do.

4.Mustaqim: Allah loves those who fight in His way in ranks as if they were a tight-fitting structure.

5.Mustaqim: And when Musa (Moses) said to his people, oh my people, why do you give me troubles when you know that I am the messenger of Allah to you, then when they turned aside, Allah turned their hearts, and Allah does not guide sinful people.

6.Mustaqim: And when ´Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary) said: oh children of Israel, I am the messenger of Allah to you, confirming what came before me of the Torah and giving you good news of a messenger to come after me whose name is Ahmad, then when he came to them with clear proofs they said: this is plain magic.

7.Mustaqim: And who is more wrong than he who invents against Allah a lie when he is called to submission (Islam), and Allah does not guide wrongdoing people.

8.Mustaqim: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, and Allah will complete His light even if those who reject (the truth) resent it.

9.Mustaqim: He is who sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it manifest over all religion even if the idolaters resent it.

10.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, shall I point you to a trade which will rescue you from a painful punishment?

11.Mustaqim: Believe in Allah and His messenger and strive in the way of Allah with your wealth and your lives, that is better for you if you knew.

12.Mustaqim: He will forgive you your sins and enter you into gardens through which rivers flow and good accommodation in the gardens of Eden, that is the ultimate success.

13.Mustaqim: And other things which you love, help and victory from Allah are near, and give good news to the believers.

14.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, be helpers of Allah like ´Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary) said to the disciples: who will be my helpers towards Allah? The disciples said: we are the helpers of Allah, then a group of the Children of Israel believed and a group rejected (the truth), so We strengthened those who believed against their enemies and they became dominant.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Mustaqim: What is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, the king, the holy, the mighty, the wise.

2.Mustaqim: He is who raised amongst the gentiles a messenger from amongst them who recites to them His signs and purifies them and teaches them the book and the wisdom, when before that they were in clear error.

3.Mustaqim: And others of them whom they have not yet met, and He is the mighty and wise.

4.Mustaqim: This is the favour of Allah which He gives to whom He pleases, and Allah possesses immense favours.

5.Mustaqim: The likeness of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not act on it is like the donkey who carries scrolls, bad is the likeness of people who deny the signs of Allah, and Allah does not guide wrongdoing people.

6.Mustaqim: Say: oh you Jews, if you claim that you are protected friends of Allah besides (the rest of) mankind, then wish for death if you are truthful.

7.Mustaqim: And they never wish for it because of the deeds they have sent ahead, and Allah knows the wrongdoers.

8.Mustaqim: Say: death, which you run away from, will catch up with you, then you will be returned to the One who knows the unseen and the apparent and He will inform you of what you used to do.

9.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, if you are called to prayer on Friday, hurry to the remembrance of Allah and leave your business, that is better for you if you knew.

10.Mustaqim: Then when the prayer has finished spread out on earth and seek the favours of Allah and remember Allah a lot in order to be successful.

11.Mustaqim: And when they see trade or pastime, they disperse towards it and leave you standing; say: what is with Allah is better than pastime and trade, and Allah is the best of providers.

1.Mustaqim: When the pretenders come to you they say: we witness that you are the messenger of Allah, and Allah knows that you are indeed His messenger, and Allah witnesses that the pretenders are lying.

2.Mustaqim: They adopt their faith by way of protection then divert from the way of Allah, bad is what they used to do.

3.Mustaqim: That is because they believed, then rejected, so their hearts were sealed so that they do not understand.

4.Mustaqim: And when you see them, their physique amazes you, and when they speak, you listen to their speech as if they were towering trees; they think that every shout is against them, they are the enemy, so be wary of them, may Allah destroy them, where to are they diverted?

5.Mustaqim: And when they are told: come so that the messenger of Allah asks for forgiveness for you, they turn their heads aside and you see them arrogantly moving away.

6.Mustaqim: It is the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or don´t ask forgiveness for them - Allah will not forgive them, for Allah does not guide sinful people.

7.Mustaqim: They are the ones who say: don´t spend on those who are with the messenger of Allah until they break away, and to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the pretenders don´t understand.

8.Mustaqim: They say: when we return to Madinah the stronger will drive the weaker out of it, and to Allah belongs all strength and to His messenger and to the believers, but the pretenders don´t know.

9.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, let not your wealth and children distract you from the remembrance of Allah, and whoever does so, those are the losers.

10.Mustaqim: And spend of what Allah has provided you with before death comes to any of you and he will say: my Lord, if only You delayed me for a little longer, so that I can give charity and be of the righteous.

11.Mustaqim: And Allah will not delay any soul when its term has come, and Allah is informed of what you do.

1.Mustaqim: Whatever is in the heavens and what is on earth glorifies Allah, His is the kingdom and His is the praise and He is able to do anything.

2.Mustaqim: He is who created you, and amongst you is he who rejects (the truth) and he who believes, and Allah sees what you do.

3.Mustaqim: He created the heavens and the earth with truth and shaped you and made your shape beautiful, and to Him is the journey.

4.Mustaqim: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth and knows what you conceal and what you disclose, and Allah knows what is kept inside.

5.Mustaqim: Did not the information of those who rejected (the truth) before reach you, so they tasted the evil outcome of their affairs and theirs is a painful punishment.

6.Mustaqim: That is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs but they said: are we to be guided by a human? So they rejected (the truth) and turned away, and Allah does not need them, and Allah is rich and praiseworthy.

7.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) claim that they will not be resurrected, say: sure, by my Lord, you will be resurrected, then you will be informed of what you did, that is easy for Allah.

8.Mustaqim: So believe in Allah and His messenger and the light which We have sent down, and Allah is informed of what you do.

9.Mustaqim: On the day He will gather you to the day of congregation, that is the day of dispossession, and whoever believes in Allah and does good, He will cancel his (minor) bad deeds and enter him into gardens through which rivers flow where they will remain forever, that is the ultimate success.

10.Mustaqim: And those who reject (the truth) and deny Our signs, those are the inmates of the fire where they will remain, and it is a bad destination.

11.Mustaqim: No affliction strikes except with the permission of Allah, and whoever believes in Allah, He will guide his heart, and Allah knows everything.

12.Mustaqim: And obey Allah and the messenger, but if you turn away, then the duty of Our messenger is only to convey clearly.

13.Mustaqim: Allah, there is no god but Him, so on Allah shall the believers rely.

14.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, there are enemies of you amongst your partners and children, so be wary of them, and if you are lenient and forgive and seek forgiveness, then Allah is forgiving and merciful.

15.Mustaqim: For your wealth and children are a test and with Allah is a tremendous reward.

16.Mustaqim: So beware of Allah as much as you can and listen and obey and spend for the good of yourselves, and whoever is protected from the greed of his own soul, those are the successful.

17.Mustaqim: If you lend Allah an excellent loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you, and Allah is appreciative and gentle.

18.Mustaqim: The One who knows the unseen and the apparent, the mighty, the wise.

1.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, when you divorce women, then divorce them for their waiting period and observe the waiting period and beware of Allah your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses and let them not leave unless they have come up with a clear indecency, and these are the limits of Allah, and whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has wronged himself. You don´t know if Allah might bring about a different situation after that.

2.Mustaqim: Then when they have reached their term, keep them honourably or part from them honourably, and let two just people amongst you be witnesses and let them uphold the evidence before Allah. That is the admonition for whoever believes in Allah and the last day, and who bewares of Allah, He will find him a way out.

3.Mustaqim: And He provides for him from where he does not expect it, and whoever relies on Allah, He is sufficient for him, for Allah enforces His command; Allah has given a measure to everything.

4.Mustaqim: And for those of your women who have the menopause and you are unsure, their waiting period is three months as for those who missed a period, and those who are pregnant, their waiting period is until they have given birth, and whoever bewares of Allah, He will make his affairs easy for him.

5.Mustaqim: This is the command of Allah He revealed to you, and whoever bewares of Allah, He cancels his bad deeds and increases his reward.

6.Mustaqim: Accommodate them where you accommodate yourselves and do not harm them to constrain them, and if they are pregnant, then spend on them until they have given birth, and if they breast-feed for you, then give them their reward, and consult each other appropriately, and if you disagree, then let someone else breast-feed for him.

7.Mustaqim: Let the one with abundance spend of his abundance, and whose provision is tightened, let him spend of what Allah gave him, Allah does not burden a soul beyond what He has given it. Allah will grant ease after hardship.

8.Mustaqim: And how many towns disobeyed the command of their Lord, so We subjected them to a severe reckoning and punished them severely?

9.Mustaqim: Then they tasted the evil outcome of their affairs, and the outcome of their affairs was a loss.

10.Mustaqim: Allah has promised them severe punishment, so beware of Allah oh you who have understanding and believe; Allah has already sent you a reminder.

11.Mustaqim: A messenger who recites the clear signs of Allah to you in order to take those who believe and do good out of darkness into the light, and whoever believes in Allah and does good, He will enter him into gardens through which rivers flow where they will remain forever; Allah has already prepared the best provision for him.

12.Mustaqim: Allah is who created seven heavens and likewise of the earth. The command comes down between them so that you know that Allah is able to do anything and that Allah has full knowledge of everything.

1.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, why do you prohibit what Allah has permitted to you, seeking the contentment of your wives, and Allah is forgiving and merciful.

2.Mustaqim: Allah has already prescribed for you the expiation of your oaths, and Allah is your protector and He is knowing and wise.

3.Mustaqim: And when the prophet talked in confidence to one of his wives, then when she announced it and Allah disclosed it to him, he made known some of it and withheld some, so when he informed her of it she said: who told you this? He said: the Knowing and Informed has told me.

4.Mustaqim: If both of you repent to Allah, your hearts will have deviated, and if you support each other against him, then Allah is his protector, and Jibril (Gabriel) and the righteous of the believers, and the angels will support him also.

5.Mustaqim: If he divorced you, his Lord might replace you with better wives who submit (as Muslims), believe, are humble, repent, serve (Allah), fast, were previously married or are virgins.

6.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, protect yourselves and your families from a fire whose fuel is people and stones, guarded over by stern and strong angels who do not disobey Allah in what He commands them and do what they have been commanded.

7.Mustaqim: Oh you who reject (the truth), don´t make excuses today, for you are rewarded on account of what you did.

8.Mustaqim: Oh you believers, turn in sincere repentance to Allah, maybe Allah will cancel your bad deeds and enter you into gardens through which rivers flow on the day when Allah will not humiliate the prophet and those who believed with him; their light will race before them and on their right, they will say: our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us, for You are able to do anything.

9.Mustaqim: Oh prophet, fight the rejecters and the pretenders and be tough with them, and their abode is hell, a bad destination.

10.Mustaqim: Allah coins as similitude for those who reject (the truth) the wife of Nuh (Noah) and the wife of Lut (Lot): they were in the care of two righteous servants of Ours but deceived them, so they did not avail them the least against Allah and they will be told: enter the fire with those who enter.

11.Mustaqim: And Allah coins as a similitude for those who believe the wife of Pharaoh when she said: my Lord, build me a house with You in the garden and rescue me from Pharaoh and his deeds and rescue me from the wrongdoing people.

12.Mustaqim: And Maryam (Mary), the daughter of ´Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her of Our spirit, and she confirmed the words and books of her Lord and was of the humble.

1.Mustaqim: Exalted is He in whose hand is the kingdom and He is able to do anything.

2.Mustaqim: The One who created death and life to test you as to who does the best deeds, and He is the mighty and forgiving.

3.Mustaqim: The One who created seven heavens in layers; you don´t see any neglect in the creation of Allah. Look again, do you see any gaps?

4.Mustaqim: Then look yet another time, your gaze will return to you weak and exhausted.

5.Mustaqim: And We have adorned the heaven of this world with lights and made them a repellent for the devils and promised them the punishment of the fire.

6.Mustaqim: And for those who reject their Lord is the punishment of hell, a bad destination.

7.Mustaqim: When they are thrown in it they hear it gulping and bubble up.

8.Mustaqim: It almost bursts with anger, whenever a group is thrown into it, its guards ask them: did not a warner reach you?

9.Mustaqim: They will say: sure, a warner reached us, but we denied and said: Allah has not revealed anything, you are just in a great delusion.

10.Mustaqim: And they will say: if we listened or pondered, we would not be inmates of the fire.

11.Mustaqim: So they acknowledge their sins, so away with the inmates of the fire.

12.Mustaqim: For those who fear their Lord in secret is forgiveness and a great reward.

13.Mustaqim: So conceal your speech or disclose it, He knows what is kept inside.

14.Mustaqim: Does not He who created know? And He is the kind and informed.

15.Mustaqim: He is who made the earth stretch out for you, so walk on its back and eat of His provision, and towards Him is the resurrection.

16.Mustaqim: Are you safe that He who is in the heaven will not make the earth swallow you up and it will quake?

17.Mustaqim: Or are you safe that He who is in the heaven will not sent a storm against you, then you will know what My warning means?

18.Mustaqim: And those before them denied, then how was My rebuttal!

19.Mustaqim: Don´t they look at the birds above them extending and retracting their wings? None but the Owner of Mercy holds them up, for He sees everything.

20.Mustaqim: Or who will be a force to help you besides the Owner of Mercy? Those who reject (the truth) deceive themselves.

21.Mustaqim: Or who will provide for you if He withholds His provision? But they persist in insolence and resentment.

22.Mustaqim: Is he who walks with his face stuck to the ground better guided or who walks upright on a straight path?

23.Mustaqim: Say: He is who brought you into existence and gave you hearing and eyesight and hearts, little thanks you give.

24.Mustaqim: Say: He is who spread you out on earth, and to Him will you be gathered.

25.Mustaqim: And they say: when will this promise happen if you are truthful?

26.Mustaqim: Say: the knowledge is with Allah, and I am only a clear warner.

27.Mustaqim: Then when they see it close by, the faces of those who reject (the truth) will be gloomy and they are told: this is what you asked for.

28.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered if Allah destroyed me and those with me, or has mercy on us, who will protect those who reject (the truth) from a painful punishment?

29.Mustaqim: Say: He is the Owner of Mercy, we believe in Him and rely on Him, then you will soon know who is in clear error.

30.Mustaqim: Say: have you considered if your water would turn brackish, who will bring you flowing water?

1.Mustaqim: Nun. By the pen and what they write.

2.Mustaqim: By the grace of your Lord, you are not possessed.

3.Mustaqim: And you will have a limitless reward.

4.Mustaqim: And you are of great character.

5.Mustaqim: So you will see and they will see.

6.Mustaqim: Who of you has been tempted.

7.Mustaqim: For your Lord knows best who has strayed from His way and He knows best those who are guided.

8.Mustaqim: So do not obey the deniers.

9.Mustaqim: They want you to compromise, so they compromise.

10.Mustaqim: And do not obey anyone who makes empty promises.

11.Mustaqim: Who incites and spreads dissent.

12.Mustaqim: Who forbids what is good in transgression and sin.

13.Mustaqim: A demagogue and a low-life.

14.Mustaqim: Though he has wealth and children.

15.Mustaqim: When Our signs are recited to him he says: stories of old.

16.Mustaqim: We will brand him on the snout!

17.Mustaqim: We tested them like We tested the inhabitants of the garden when they swore: we will harvest it in the morning.

18.Mustaqim: And they did not have any reservations.

19.Mustaqim: Then, a delegation from your Lord encircled it whilst they were asleep.

20.Mustaqim: And it became as if depleted.

21.Mustaqim: Then they called each other in the morning:

22.Mustaqim: Let´s go to your plantation if you want to cut it down.

23.Mustaqim: So they set off, urging each other to keep out of view,

1.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) amongst the people of the Book and the idolaters will not give up until the clear proof reaches them.

2.Mustaqim: A messenger from Allah who recites to them from purified pages.

3.Mustaqim: Containing lasting statements.

4.Mustaqim: Nor did those who were given the book differ except after the clear proof reached them.

5.Mustaqim: And they were only ordered to serve Allah, making religion sincere for Him and devoted, and to keep up prayer and give Zakat, and that is the lasting religion.

6.Mustaqim: Those who reject (the truth) amongst the people of the Book and the idolaters are in the fire of hell where they will remain; they are the worst creatures.

7.Mustaqim: Those who believe and do good work, they are the best creatures.

8.Mustaqim: Their reward with their Lord is the gardens of Eden through which rivers flow where they will remain forever. Allah is content with them and they are content with Him; that is for him who is fearful of his Lord.

1.Mustaqim: When the earth shakes its last,

2.Mustaqim: And the earth expels its burden,

3.Mustaqim: And man says: what is the matter with it?

4.Mustaqim: That day it will tell its story,

5.Mustaqim: Because your Lord inspired it.

6.Mustaqim: That day mankind will proceed in groups to have their deeds inspected.

7.Mustaqim: Then who did a tiny speck´s weight of good, will see it.

8.Mustaqim: And who did a tiny speck´s weight of bad, will see it.

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Mustaqim: By the snorting battle horses,

2.Mustaqim: Who strike up sparks,

3.Mustaqim: And attack in the morning,

4.Mustaqim: Stirring up dust,

5.Mustaqim: And breaking through the crowd,

6.Mustaqim: Man is ungrateful of his Lord,

7.Mustaqim: And he is a witness to that,

8.Mustaqim: And he loves affluence greatly.

9.Mustaqim: Does he not know that when what is in the graves will be overturned,

10.Mustaqim: And what is kept inside will be exposed,

11.Mustaqim: Your Lord will be informed about him that day?

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Mustaqim: The Calamity.

2.Mustaqim: What is the calamity?

3.Mustaqim: And how do you know what the calamity is?

4.Mustaqim: That day mankind will be like scattered moths,

5.Mustaqim: And the mountains will be like puffed up wool.

6.Mustaqim: Then he whose scales are heavy,

7.Mustaqim: Will be in a life of contentment.

8.Mustaqim: And whose scales are light,

9.Mustaqim: The pit will take care of him,

10.Mustaqim: And how do you know what it is?

11.Mustaqim: A scorching fire.

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Mustaqim: Competition for riches keeps you busy,

2.Mustaqim: Until you enter your graves.

3.Mustaqim: But no, you will soon know,

4.Mustaqim: But no again, you will soon know,

5.Mustaqim: For sure, if you had knowledge of the inevitable,

6.Mustaqim: You would see hell-fire,

7.Mustaqim: Then you will see it with your own eyes,

8.Mustaqim: Then you will be asked that day about blessings.

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Mustaqim: By Time,

2.Mustaqim: Man is at a loss,

3.Mustaqim: Except those who believe and do good work, admonish each other with the truth and encourage each other to patience.

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Mustaqim: Woe to every mocking slanderer.

2.Mustaqim: Who gathers wealth and counts it.

3.Mustaqim: He thinks his wealth will let him live forever.

4.Mustaqim: But no, he will be flung into the shredder.

5.Mustaqim: And how do you know what the shredder is?

6.Mustaqim: Allah´s lit fire,

7.Mustaqim: Which engulfs the hearts.

8.Mustaqim: It closes in on them,

9.Mustaqim: In extensive columns.

1.Mustaqim: Did you not see how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?

2.Mustaqim: Did He not make their plot go astray,

3.Mustaqim: And sent against them flocks of birds,

4.Mustaqim: Who pelted them with hardened stones,

5.Mustaqim: So He made them like eaten up stalks?

1.Mustaqim: For the unity of Quraysh,

2.Mustaqim: Their unity during the winter and summer journey,

3.Mustaqim: Let them serve the Lord of this house,

4.Mustaqim: Who fed them against hunger and protected them against fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Mustaqim: Have you considered him who denies his (religious) debt?

2.Mustaqim: He is who snubs the orphan,

3.Mustaqim: And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.

4.Mustaqim: Woe then to those who pray,

5.Mustaqim: Who are negligent of their prayers,

6.Mustaqim: Who show off,

7.Mustaqim: And refuse assistance.

1.Mustaqim: We have given you abundance.

2.Mustaqim: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice,

3.Mustaqim: For your adversary is bereft.

1.Mustaqim: Say: Oh you who reject (the truth),

2.Mustaqim: I do not serve what you serve,

3.Mustaqim: And you are no servants of what I serve,

4.Mustaqim: And I am no servant of what you used to serve,

5.Mustaqim: And you are no servants of what I serve,

6.Mustaqim: You have your religion and I have mine.

1.Mustaqim: When help and victory come from Allah,

2.Mustaqim: And you see people entering in the religion of Allah in large groups,

3.Mustaqim: Then glorify the praise of your Lord and ask His forgiveness, for He is accepting.

1.Mustaqim: May the hands of the father of flame perish, and may he perish.

2.Mustaqim: His wealth and what he earned will not benefit him.

3.Mustaqim: He will enter a fire full of flames.

4.Mustaqim: And his wife, the carrier of gossip,

5.Mustaqim: Will have a rope of palm fibre around her neckline.

1.Mustaqim: Say: He is Allah alone,

2.Mustaqim: Allah the everlasting,

3.Mustaqim: He does not reproduce nor has been reproduced,

4.Mustaqim: And nobody is a match for Him.

1.Mustaqim: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of dawn,

2.Mustaqim: From the harm of what He created,

3.Mustaqim: And from the harm of darkness when it sets in,

4.Mustaqim: And from the harm of women blowing on knots,

5.Mustaqim: And from the harm of the envious when he shows envy.

1.Mustaqim: Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,

2.Mustaqim: The king of mankind,

3.Mustaqim: The god of mankind,

4.Mustaqim: From the harm of the secret whisperer,

5.Mustaqim: Who whispers within people,

6.Mustaqim: From amongst Jinn and mankind.
